original: @173b * // bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las mdo btus pa bzhugs //
analyzed: @173b * // bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las mdo btus pa bzhugs //
translated: The Sutra Extracted from the Authentically Victorious Scriptures

original: # // bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las mdo btus pa /
analyzed: # // bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las mdo btus pa /
translated: The Sutra Extracted from the Authentically Victorious Scriptures

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par gsung ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par gsung ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Perfectly Pure Speaker.

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten mkhyen //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten mkhyen //
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One, the Knower of the World,

original: dngos po 'di dag ci 'dra de bzhin gsung //
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag ci 'dra de bzhin gsung //
translated: Speaks just as things are.

original: bdud kyi stobs bcom mchod pa'i gnas su 'os //
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs bcom mchod pa'i gnas su 'os //
translated: Having conquered the power of Mara, he is worthy of offerings.

original: bde gshegs rig pa gsum dang rkang par ldan //
analyzed: bde gshegs rig pa gsum dang rkang par ldan //
translated: The Sugata possesses the three knowledges and the four fearlessnesses.

original: 'dul 'os kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
analyzed: 'dul 'os kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
translated: He is the unsurpassed guide, worthy of being tamed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to the Blessed Buddha.

original: lha mi'i mkhan po khyod kyi mthus bstangs pas //
analyzed: lha mi'i mkhan po khyod kyi mthus bstangs pas //
translated: By your power, O teacher of gods and humans,

original: skye bo yang dag bka' yi snod du bsgrub //🔽bcom ldan spyan ras dbang po 'jig rten mgon //
analyzed: skye bo yang dag bka' yi snod du bsgrub // bcom ldan spyan ras dbang po 'jig rten mgon //
translated: Beings are made into proper vessels for the teachings.🔽I respectfully pay homage to the Blessed One, Avalokiteshvara, the protector of the world,

original: thugs rje che la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: thugs rje che la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: The great compassionate one.

original: 'gro ba thams cad yang dag lta lam du //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yang dag lta lam du //
translated: I establish all beings on the path of the correct view.

original: rigs pas tshul bzhin gzud pa bsgrub par bya //🔽bcom ldan mi pham rgyal tshab thams cad gsol //
analyzed: rigs pas tshul bzhin gzud pa bsgrub par bya // bcom ldan mi pham rgyal tshab thams cad gsol //
translated: And to establish the truth by reasoning.🔽I bow down to the Bodhisattva Maitreya,🔽The supreme friend of all beings,

original: byams mchog gting la gus par phyag 'tshal te //🔽pha rol rgol bar smra ba thams cad kyis //
analyzed: byams mchog gting la gus par phyag 'tshal te // pha rol rgol bar smra ba thams cad kyis //
translated: The regent of the Lord of the World,🔽The one who cannot be defeated by any opponent.🔽I bow down to the Bodhisattva Akashagarbha,

original: pham par byar med phyogs nyid bsgrub par bya //🔽bcom ldan nam mkha'i snying po skyon mi 'chags //
analyzed: pham par byar med phyogs nyid bsgrub par bya // bcom ldan nam mkha'i snying po skyon mi 'chags //
translated: The one who is free from all faults,🔽The one who has an infinite mind,🔽The one who is the great friend of all beings.

original: mtha' yas blo la gus pas phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: mtha' yas blo la gus pas phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I bow down to the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra,🔽The chief of all the Bodhisattvas,

original: ro gcig chos kyi nam mkha' go phye zhing //🔽stong nyid chos kyi mtshan bstan bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: ro gcig chos kyi nam mkha' go phye zhing // stong nyid chos kyi mtshan bstan bsgrub par bya //
translated: The one who has the conduct of the ocean,

original: bcom ldan kun du bzang po sras kyi gtso //
analyzed: bcom ldan kun du bzang po sras kyi gtso //
translated: The one who is the great friend of all beings.🔽I bow down to the Bodhisattva Manjushri,

original: rgya mtsho'i spyod la gus par phyag 'tshal te //🔽dge bas khyab pa'i gtsug lag bzang brjod pa //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i spyod la gus par phyag 'tshal te // dge bas khyab pa'i gtsug lag bzang brjod pa //
translated: The one who has the wisdom of the ocean,🔽The one who is the great friend of all beings.

original: 'jig rten kun la phan gdags legs par bsgrub //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la phan gdags legs par bsgrub //
translated: I bow down to the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara,🔽The one who has the eyes of the ocean,🔽The one who is the great friend of all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'jigs 'joms phyag na rdo rje bsnams //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'jigs 'joms phyag na rdo rje bsnams //
translated: I bow down to the Bodhisattva Kshitigarbha,🔽The one who has the mind of the ocean,🔽The one who is the great friend of all beings.

original: dpa' brtson gtso la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: dpa' brtson gtso la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I bow down to the Bodhisattva Vajrapani,🔽The one who has the strength of the ocean,🔽The one who is the great friend of all beings.

original: lta ba ngan pas bsnyems pa'i brag chen kun //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pas bsnyems pa'i brag chen kun //
translated: And the great rock of conceit due to bad views.

original: rnam par gzhom pa'i thabs 'di bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: rnam par gzhom pa'i thabs 'di bsgrub par bya //
translated: I will accomplish this method of complete destruction.🔽I bow with respect to the foremost spiritual friend,

original: bcom ldan 'jam dpal bla med dpal gyi bdag / dge bshes gtso la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'jam dpal bla med dpal gyi bdag / dge bshes gtso la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: The glorious lord of the unsurpassed Mañjuśrī,

original: rang dga' 'dod ris gdams ngag len spong zhing //
analyzed: rang dga' 'dod ris gdams ngag len spong zhing //
translated: Abandoning the instructions of one's own desires and factions,

original: dpal ldan lung nyid 'dzin par bsgyur ba bsgrub //
analyzed: dpal ldan lung nyid 'dzin par bsgyur ba bsgrub //
translated: I will accomplish the transformation into upholding the glorious scriptures.

original: bcom ldan sgrib pa'i shugs drag bzod dka' gnon //
analyzed: bcom ldan sgrib pa'i shugs drag bzod dka' gnon //
translated: The Bhagavān is oppressed by the strong and difficult-to-bear force of obscurations,

original: rgyal sras mchog la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rgyal sras mchog la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I bow with respect to the supreme son of the Victor,🔽I will accomplish the complete suppression of all

original: 'gro ba yang dag mthong la sgrib po cog / ma lus bzhin du mnan pa bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang dag mthong la sgrib po cog / ma lus bzhin du mnan pa bsgrub par bya //
translated: Obscurations to the perfect vision of beings.🔽I bow with respect to the foremost source of the essence of the earth,

original: bcom ldan sa yi snying po 'byung gnas mchog / gzungs rab brtan la gus par phyag 'tshal te //🔽theg pa @174a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan sa yi snying po 'byung gnas mchog / gzungs rab brtan la gus par phyag 'tshal te // theg pa @174a * //
translated: The Bhagavān, the greatly stable dhāraṇī,

original: gcig gis rin chen sa lta bus //
analyzed: gcig gis rin chen sa lta bus //
translated: With the single vehicle, which is like a precious earth,

original: 'gro ba ma lus yang dag bkur ba bsgrub //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus yang dag bkur ba bsgrub //
translated: I will accomplish the perfect carrying of all beings without exception.

original: khams gsum rnam rgyal dpa' bas mgo na mdzod pa //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam rgyal dpa' bas mgo na mdzod pa //
translated: The hero with the head treasury of the conqueror of the three realms,

original: brjid kyis 'dul la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: brjid kyis 'dul la gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage with respect to the one who tames with majesty.

original: srid pa gsum gyi log lta thams cad las //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi log lta thams cad las //
translated: From all the wrong views of the three existences,

original: rnam par rgyal ba nges par bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba nges par bsgrub par bya //
translated: I will accomplish the one who is victorious.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo g-yo ba kun mi brten //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo g-yo ba kun mi brten //
translated: The noble one is unwavering, not relying on any movement.

original: ri rab mthu bas brtan la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: ri rab mthu bas brtan la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is more stable than the powerful Meru.

original: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba'i 'jig rten gyis //
analyzed: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba'i 'jig rten gyis //
translated: By the demons and adversaries of the world,

original: nam yang sus kyang mi g-yos bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: nam yang sus kyang mi g-yos bsgrub par bya //
translated: I will accomplish the one who is never moved by anyone.

original: za hor gyi bikshu theg pa chen po pha  yul kha gsar nar skyes pa dang ma sh'anti gho sha zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyis a'atsarya bo dhi sa tva zhes btags pa gsung rab thams cad la mkhas shing /
analyzed: za hor gyi bikshu theg pa chen po pha  yul kha gsar nar skyes pa dang ma sh'anti gho sha zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyis a'atsarya bo dhi sa tva zhes btags pa gsung rab thams cad la mkhas shing /
translated: The great being, the bhikṣu from Zahor named Mahāsattva, was born in his father's country and was called Ācārya Bodhisattva by the world. He was learned in all the scriptures,

original: tshul khrims dang shes rab tu ldan pas mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus la zhugs pa zhig bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa las thos pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang shes rab tu ldan pas mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus la zhugs pa zhig bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa las thos pa /
translated: and through possessing discipline and wisdom, he engaged in unwavering diligence. From him, my spiritual friend, I heard the following:

original: dper na mi zhig smra ba yang med /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig smra ba yang med /
translated: For example, a person who neither speaks

original: spyod pa yang med na de'i tshod gzung du yang mi rigs te /🔽smra ba dang spyod pa yod na yon tan dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: spyod pa yang med na de'i tshod gzung du yang mi rigs te / smra ba dang spyod pa yod na yon tan dang ldan pa'am /
translated: If there is no activity, it is not reasonable to measure its extent.

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa yang gdod bye brag dbyer rung /
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa yang gdod bye brag dbyer rung /
translated: If there is speech and activity, then it is possible to distinguish whether it is endowed with good qualities or🔽faults.

original: mthu ci yod pa yang shes par nus pa bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyang bdag gis mngon sum du ni ma mthong mod kyi de dag gis smras pa dang / spyod pa so so'i gtsug lag las byung ba mthong na bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni gzhan gang dang yang mi 'dra bar bzang la rgya che ba nyid du bdag gis khong du chud de /
analyzed: mthu ci yod pa yang shes par nus pa bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyang bdag gis mngon sum du ni ma mthong mod kyi de dag gis smras pa dang / spyod pa so so'i gtsug lag las byung ba mthong na bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni gzhan gang dang yang mi 'dra bar bzang la rgya che ba nyid du bdag gis khong du chud de /
translated: Just as it is possible to know what power there is, although I have not seen the Bhagavān Buddha and the worldly gods directly, when I see the speech and activity that arise in their individual scriptures, I understand that the teaching of the Sugata is good and vast, unlike any other.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'di skad du bstod pa yang bdag gi sgor byams pa'i phyir snying du sdug ste bstod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'di skad du bstod pa yang bdag gi sgor byams pa'i phyir snying du sdug ste bstod pa yang ma yin /
translated: I praise the teaching of the Buddha in this way because it is dear to my heart. It is not a praise that is done out of obligation.

original: 'jig rten gyi lha dag gi gtsug lag la bsngags par mi smra ba yang de dag gis bdag la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir zhe sdang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lha dag gi gtsug lag la bsngags par mi smra ba yang de dag gis bdag la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir zhe sdang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that he does not praise the scriptures of the worldly gods because he hates them for harming him.

original: rig pas brtags na de ltar khyad zhugs kyis sems can la srog spang du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos kyang bzung zhing bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pas brtags na de ltar khyad zhugs kyis sems can la srog spang du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos kyang bzung zhing bcad par bya'o //
translated: When examined with reason, it is just as in the case of the unsuitability of abandoning the life of a sentient being. In the same way, the holy Dharma should be upheld and not rejected.

original: 'jig rten gyi lha dang mi la yon tan dang mthu yod pa kun kyang yun ring po'i dus nas dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las ma byung ba med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lha dang mi la yon tan dang mthu yod pa kun kyang yun ring po'i dus nas dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las ma byung ba med de /
translated: All the good qualities and powers of the worldly gods and humans are not unarisen from the roots of virtue of serving the Three Jewels for a long time.🔽The essence of all scriptures is the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: gtsug lag go cog gi snying po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa du mar gsungs pa'i rjes su bsams te brtags na /
analyzed: gtsug lag go cog gi snying po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa du mar gsungs pa'i rjes su bsams te brtags na /
translated: When one reflects and examines in accordance with the many statements such as this,

original: a'atsarya bodhi satvas gsungs pa med  de /
analyzed: a'atsarya bodhi satvas gsungs pa med  de /
translated: the statement of Ācārya Bodhisattva is not found.

original: @174b de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs so //🔽so so'i bsam pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas na gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: @174b de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs so // so so'i bsam pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas na gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dod kyang rung /
translated: The teachings of the Tathagata, endowed with the twelve branches of the scriptures, are like a wish-fulfilling gem.🔽Since it fulfills the wishes of each one, whether one desires the excellence of the supramundane,

original: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'dod kyang rung /
translated: or the excellence of the mundane,

original: sgra dang yi ge'i 'bru la mkhas pa 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: sgra dang yi ge'i 'bru la mkhas pa 'dod kyang rung /
translated: or skill in the sounds, syllables and letters,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma dang sbyar zhing rtogs par bya ba la sogs te gang 'dod kyang rung /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma dang sbyar zhing rtogs par bya ba la sogs te gang 'dod kyang rung /
translated: or the understanding of the characteristics of all things by means of the valid cognitions, and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang goms par bya ba las 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang goms par bya ba las 'da' ba med do //
translated: there is nothing that surpasses the study, reflection and meditation on the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab lta bu zab cid  rgya che ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab lta bu zab cid  rgya che ste /
translated: The scriptures of the Bhagavat Buddha are profound and vast.

original: zad mi shes pa la bdag 'dra ba'i shes pa rgya chung zhing rmongs pas dgongs pa'i don gob lob tu bshad pa ni rgya mtsho chen po la bya gag gi rtsal gyis gcod par rtsol ba dang 'dra ste mi nus bar mngon pa la bdag gi tshod mi
analyzed: zad mi shes pa la bdag 'dra ba'i shes pa rgya chung zhing rmongs pas dgongs pa'i don gob lob tu bshad pa ni rgya mtsho chen po la bya gag gi rtsal gyis gcod par rtsol ba dang 'dra ste mi nus bar mngon pa la bdag gi tshod mi
translated: Since my mind is small and ignorant, I am unable to explain the meaning of the intent of the sutra in a way that is not repetitive, just as a duck is unable to cut through the great ocean with its wings.🔽

original: 'dzin par ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'dzin par ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Since my own mind is small and confused, I am unable to explain the meaning of the Buddha's thought in a way that is not distorted.  It is like trying to measure the great ocean with the footprint of a cow.  Therefore, I have not measured myself against others, but why have I explained this?

original: 'jig rten na tshad mar byed pa rnams dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las rigs pa bzhi 'byung ba mthong na bshad pa 'di dag 'dri bar yang mi sems pa zhig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na tshad mar byed pa rnams dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las rigs pa bzhi 'byung ba mthong na bshad pa 'di dag 'dri bar yang mi sems pa zhig ste /
translated: If one sees that the four reasonings that occur in the noble Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning are used as valid cognitions in the world, one will not think to question these explanations.

original: 'jig rten dag bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma rin po che 'di lta bu mi spyod par sangs rgyas la sogs pa mu stegs can rnams bdag bdag gi rang bzos 'jig rten slu zhing tshad mar ston pa'i lugs mthong nas gsung rab kyi tshad ma bcabs na dkon
analyzed: 'jig rten dag bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma rin po che 'di lta bu mi spyod par sangs rgyas la sogs pa mu stegs can rnams bdag bdag gi rang bzos 'jig rten slu zhing tshad mar ston pa'i lugs mthong nas gsung rab kyi tshad ma bcabs na dkon
translated: Seeing that the world does not use this precious, valid cognition of the Buddha's word, but instead uses the systems of the tirthikas, such as the Buddha, who deceive the world with their own fabrications and who claim to be valid cognitions, I have revealed the valid cognition of the scriptures.

original: mchog gsum la snying ring ba dang / sems can la 'khus par gyur te de'i phyir mi bzod pa ni mig tu gra ma'i dum bu sod ba dang 'dra bar rtag tu nyam nga nas mkhas pa dag la bskul ba'i rkyen tsam du 'di bris so //
analyzed: mchog gsum la snying ring ba dang / sems can la 'khus par gyur te de'i phyir mi bzod pa ni mig tu gra ma'i dum bu sod ba dang 'dra bar rtag tu nyam nga nas mkhas pa dag la bskul ba'i rkyen tsam du 'di bris so //
translated: Because of this, I have been unable to bear the fact that the three jewels are neglected and that sentient beings are mistreated. Therefore, I have written this work simply as a stimulus for the wise, as if a grain of sand were stuck in the eye.

original: chos so cog gi dbang bgyid pa rigs pa'i rnam pa smos pa 'jig rten na rgyal po dag bdag gi rigs su ci 'dod pa dag gi dbang gis 'grub pa bzhin du chos so cog la bdag gi phyogs su gzung pa yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i rigs pa'i🔽dbang gis 'grub ste /
analyzed: chos so cog gi dbang bgyid pa rigs pa'i rnam pa smos pa 'jig rten na rgyal po dag bdag gi rigs su ci 'dod pa dag gi dbang gis 'grub pa bzhin du chos so cog la bdag gi phyogs su gzung pa yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i rigs pa'i dbang gis 'grub ste /
translated: The power of all dharmas refers to the types of reasoning. Just as kings in the world have power over whatever they desire in their own family, likewise, whatever is taken as one's own position in all dharmas is accomplished by the power of reasoning.

original: chos thams cad kyi rgyal po lta bur rigs pa zhes bya ba chos kyi rjes su gsungs pa'i rigs pa bzhi brjod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rgyal po lta bur rigs pa zhes bya ba chos kyi rjes su gsungs pa'i rigs pa bzhi brjod do //
translated: The four reasonings that were taught by the Lord of Dharma are called the king of all dharmas.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: They are taught in the noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: rigs pa de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rigs pa de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Those reasonings are of four types:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi @175a * //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi @175a * // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of efficacy, the reasoning of logical possibility, and the reasoning of reality.

original: rigs pa bzhi'i phyogs tsam zhig mdor brjod na /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi'i phyogs tsam zhig mdor brjod na /
translated: If we briefly describe just a portion of the four reasonings,

original: ltos pa'i rigs ba zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'bras bu'i rigs pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs ba zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'bras bu'i rigs pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: the so-called reasoning of dependence is the expression of the reasoning of phenomena and their effects.

original: 'du byed rnams gang dang gang la tha snyad du gdags pa dang / gang dang gang gi 'bras bu skye ba yang de dang de'i rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang dang gang la tha snyad du gdags pa dang / gang dang gang gi 'bras bu skye ba yang de dang de'i rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par bstan pa'o //
translated: It demonstrates that all phenomena and all effects that are conventionally designated depend on their causes and conditions.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang rgyu'i sgo nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang rgyu'i sgo nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: The so-called reasoning of efficacy is the expression of the reasoning of action and cause.

original: gang dang gang gi bya ba de dang de la byed pa dang gang dang gang gi rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa ni de dang de'i 'bras bu'i bya ba byed par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi bya ba de dang de la byed pa dang gang dang gang gi rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa ni de dang de'i 'bras bu'i bya ba byed par bstan pa'o //
translated: It demonstrates that whatever action is performed by whatever agent and whatever effect is produced is definitely the effect of its cause and conditions.

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The so-called logical argument of proof is universal.

original: gang dang gang bsgrub pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang bsgrub pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the definition of the valid cognition that is to be proved.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: The so-called logical argument of reality is expressed from the perspective of the nature of phenomena.

original: chos rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa gang dang gang gi rang bzhin yod pa de dang de bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa gang dang gang gi rang bzhin yod pa de dang de bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of whatever nature of conventional truth and ultimate truth exists in phenomena.

original: rigs pa 'di bzhi'i mtshan nyid la log pa dang / yang dag pa'i bye brag gtan la dbab pa'i gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di bzhi'i mtshan nyid la log pa dang / yang dag pa'i bye brag gtan la dbab pa'i gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The definition of these four logical arguments should be understood as the logical argument of proof that determines the distinction between the incorrect and the correct.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The definition of the logical argument of dependence is as follows.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams bskyed pa'i phyir rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gang rgyur gyur pa dang rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni ltos pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams bskyed pa'i phyir rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gang rgyur gyur pa dang rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni ltos pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
translated: The principle of dependence is stated as follows: “That which is a cause and that which is a condition are the principle of dependence, because they generate the formations and because they conventionally designate them.”

original: 'du byed skye ba dang tha snyad gdags pa la rang dbang med de /
analyzed: 'du byed skye ba dang tha snyad gdags pa la rang dbang med de /
translated: The generation of the formations and their conventional designation are not independent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa tshogs pa la sdod pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa tshogs pa la sdod pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of causes and conditions is called the principle of dependence.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The formations are twofold:

original: phyi dang nang gi tshogs so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi tshogs so //
translated: the internal collection and the external collection.

original: de la gdags nas chos kyi bar gyi khams drug ni phyi'i chos so //
analyzed: de la gdags nas chos kyi bar gyi khams drug ni phyi'i chos so //
translated: Among them, the six elements of form up to the dharma element are external dharmas.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ni nang gi chos so //
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ni nang gi chos so //
translated: The elements of the faculties and consciousness are internal dharmas.

original: skyed pa zhes bya ba ni gang ma skyes pa gdod ma nas skyed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pa zhes bya ba ni gang ma skyes pa gdod ma nas skyed pa'o //
translated: Generation means that which generates what has not yet arisen from the beginning.

original: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la bye brag gi rnam pa tshig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la bye brag gi rnam pa tshig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression subsequently designated refers to the particular aspects of things that are expressed in words.

original: de dag kyang 'dra ba la ltos te mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa dang gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dra ba la ltos te mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa dang gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: They are twofold: those that exist as different aspects in dependence upon similarity and those that exist as different aspects in dependence upon dissimilarity.

original: 'dra ba la ltos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba la ltos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by those that exist as different aspects in dependence upon similarity?

original: nas la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba nas la sogs pa so so'i sa bon la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba nas la sogs pa so so'i sa bon la ltos pa'o //
translated: The production of the effect of barley, etc., is dependent upon the individual seeds of barley, etc.

original: de'i nang nas kyang rkyen gang dang phrad pa de'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni ma du lung ga'i sa bon la rgya skyegs kyis bskus te bskyed na de rgyal ba'i 'bras bu nang phyi rtsa lag dmar por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i nang nas kyang rkyen gang dang phrad pa de'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni ma du lung ga'i sa bon la rgya skyegs kyis bskus te bskyed na de rgyal ba'i 'bras bu nang phyi rtsa lag dmar por 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the particular differences that occur in dependence upon conditions are as follows: If the seed of a pomegranate is smeared with lac and planted, the interior and exterior of its fruit will be red.

original: mdu @175b lung ga'i rang bzhin yang ma nyams la rgya skyegs kyi kha dog kyang yod bzhin du smin pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: mdu @175b lung ga'i rang bzhin yang ma nyams la rgya skyegs kyi kha dog kyang yod bzhin du smin pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: Even though the nature of the pomegranate is not lost and the color of the lac is present, the fruit is similar to the seed in dependence upon the lac. This is called those that exist as different aspects in dependence upon similarity.

original: mdu lung ga'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyis bskus pa smin pa'i tshe nang phyi rtsa lag 'ba' zhig dmar te /
analyzed: mdu lung ga'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyis bskus pa smin pa'i tshe nang phyi rtsa lag 'ba' zhig dmar te /
translated: When the seed of a pomegranate is smeared with lac and ripens, the inside and outside of the fruit are only red.

original: sa bon dmar por ma gyur pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dmar por ma gyur pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The seed does not become red, so there is a dissimilar part.

original: 'bru lhag lhug tsam du brngos te sa bon du btab pa ni myu gu nas snye ma'i bar du skye la /
analyzed: 'bru lhag lhug tsam du brngos te sa bon du btab pa ni myu gu nas snye ma'i bar du skye la /
translated: When a seed is roasted just enough to be loose, it is planted as a seed and grows from a sprout to an ear of corn.🔽When it ripens as a fruit, the condition of roasting causes the eyes to go blind.

original: 'bras bur smin pa'i dus na brngos pa'i rkyen gyis mig long bar gyur ba lta bu sa bon gyi mthu nyams pas smin pa'i tshe'ang 'bru mar red pa ni mthun pa ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur smin pa'i dus na brngos pa'i rkyen gyis mig long bar gyur ba lta bu sa bon gyi mthu nyams pas smin pa'i tshe'ang 'bru mar red pa ni mthun pa ltos pa'o //
translated: When it ripens, the power of the seed is impaired, so the grain is spoiled.

original: de'i tshe 'bru yongs su ma smin pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bru yongs su ma smin pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: At that time, the seed that is not fully ripe has a dissimilar part.

original: sa bon 'gag kyang rung ste zhing las skyes pa las /
analyzed: sa bon 'gag kyang rung ste zhing las skyes pa las /
translated: Even if the seed ceases, it grows from the field.

original: la la ma rgyal bar brngas pa dang / snyem gcig las kyang 'bras bu la la ni grung /
analyzed: la la ma rgyal bar brngas pa dang / snyem gcig las kyang 'bras bu la la ni grung /
translated: Some are harvested without ripening, and from a single ear of corn, some of the kernels are ripe,

original: la la ni shun te /
analyzed: la la ni shun te /
translated: some are husks.

original: snye ma la bye brag med kyang 'bras bu la bye brag tu gyur pa yang sa bon ces btab pa'i rang bzhin ma gyur ba ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: snye ma la bye brag med kyang 'bras bu la bye brag tu gyur pa yang sa bon ces btab pa'i rang bzhin ma gyur ba ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: Although there is no difference in the ears of corn, there is a difference in the fruits, and the nature of what is called a seed is unchanged. This is in terms of similarity.

original: rgyal ba dang ma rgyal ba'i tshul mi 'dra ba dang / grung po'i nang na shun pa yang yod pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal ba dang ma rgyal ba'i tshul mi 'dra ba dang / grung po'i nang na shun pa yang yod pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
translated: The way of being victorious or not victorious is different, and even the husk is present in the ripe one. This is the presence of a different aspect.

original: 'di lta bu dag ni phyi rol gyi chos su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag ni phyi rol gyi chos su shes par bya'o //
translated: Such things should be understood as external phenomena.

original: gzhan la bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i smin pa myong ba la de'i nang nas kyang rkyen gang dang phrad ba de'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i smin pa myong ba la de'i nang nas kyang rkyen gang dang phrad ba de'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The result of the karma of causing happiness and suffering to others is also experienced as the ripening of happiness and suffering. From within that, the specific result is due to the condition that is encountered.

original: 'phags pa las rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa las rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las 'byung ba /
translated: This is found in the noble Sūtra on the Analysis of Karma:

original: 'dod chags las byung ba'i ngang tshul ngan pa'i las kyis ngan song du skye ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags las byung ba'i ngang tshul ngan pa'i las kyis ngan song du skye ste /
translated: “Through the karma of bad conduct arising from attachment, one is born in the lower realms.

original: rma bya la sogs pa sbu sdug cing 'tsher bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu ngang tshul ngan pa spyad pa'i sdig gis ngan song du'ang skye la /
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa sbu sdug cing 'tsher bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu ngang tshul ngan pa spyad pa'i sdig gis ngan song du'ang skye la /
translated: The peacock and so on have beautiful and resplendent feathers means that one is born in the lower realms due to the sin of engaging in bad conduct.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la byams pa yod pas spu sdug cing 'tsher bar yang gyur pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la byams pa yod pas spu sdug cing 'tsher bar yang gyur pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: Since love exists in the mind possessing attachment, the beautiful and resplendent feathers are similar.

original: 'dod chags gzugs med pa las kha dog gi bye brag tu gyur pa dang / mis tshul khrims bshig ste byar skyes ba ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags gzugs med pa las kha dog gi bye brag tu gyur pa dang / mis tshul khrims bshig ste byar skyes ba ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: Attachment becomes the specific color of the formless realm and humans who destroy ethics and are born as birds have dissimilar aspects.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las kun du gnas pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las kun du gnas pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas, giving that is always present, guarding ethics, and so on are called the mundane perfections.

original: 'jig rten las mi 'gul mi g-yo mi 'phag go zhes 'byung ba lta bu sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba byas pa'i bsod nams kyis 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa'ang smin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don du @176a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las mi 'gul mi g-yo mi 'phag go zhes 'byung ba lta bu sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba byas pa'i bsod nams kyis 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa'ang smin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don du @176a * //
translated: It is like the statement: “One does not move, does not waver, does not leap out of the world.”

original: ma bsngos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bur ma grub pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsngos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bur ma grub pa ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The merit of practicing generosity and so on ripens as mundane excellence, but it does not establish the fruit of transcending the mundane because it is not dedicated for that purpose.🔽This is similar to the other.

original: sbyin pa lta bu gzhan la byas pa bdag gi longs spyod du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyin pa lta bu gzhan la byas pa bdag gi longs spyod du 'gyur la /
translated: For example, generosity done for others becomes one’s own enjoyment.🔽If one is stingy and keeps it for oneself, one becomes poor.

original: ser sna byas te bdag la bcangs na dbul por 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna byas te bdag la bcangs na dbul por 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: This is the dissimilar part.🔽The noble Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma says:

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las 'byung ba dge ba'i las zhig byas kyang las kyi rgyab dge ba dang mi dge ba ci byas pa las de'i smin pa so sor myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dul ba las 'byung ba sems dang ldan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las 'byung ba dge ba'i las zhig byas kyang las kyi rgyab dge ba dang mi dge ba ci byas pa las de'i smin pa so sor myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dul ba las 'byung ba sems dang ldan pa las kyang /
translated: “Even if one does a virtuous action that arises from the holy Dharma, one experiences the ripening of that action individually, according to whatever virtuous or nonvirtuous action one has done.”🔽The Vinaya says:🔽“One who has a mind

original: yan lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las pham pa dang / sbam po la sogs pa'i rim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las pham pa dang / sbam po la sogs pa'i rim par 'gyur te /
translated: The difference in the degree of the sin is due to the difference in the completeness or incompleteness of the limbs, and to the difference in the degree of the stupidity, etc.🔽The difference in the degree of the fruit is due to the difference in the degree of the sin.🔽The difference in the degree of the sin is due to the difference in the degree of the stupidity, etc.🔽The difference in the degree of the stupidity, etc. is due to the difference in the degree of the practice.

original: mi dge ba'i sdig yod kyang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi mthun par 'gyur ba ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sdig yod kyang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi mthun par 'gyur ba ni 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the practice is due to the difference in the degree of the habit.🔽The difference in the degree of the habit is due to the difference in the degree of the beginning.

original: des pha rol la bde bar gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal du gyur pa'i myong ba la bye brag med kyang bdag la dge ba dang sdig pa'i smin ba mi 'dra bar gyur pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: des pha rol la bde bar gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal du gyur pa'i myong ba la bye brag med kyang bdag la dge ba dang sdig pa'i smin ba mi 'dra bar gyur pa ni mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the beginning is due to the difference in the degree of the cause.🔽The difference in the degree of the cause is due to the difference in the degree of the seed.🔽The difference in the degree of the seed is due to the difference in the degree of the karma.🔽The difference in the degree of the karma is due to the difference in the degree of the mental orientation.

original: mi 'dra ba'i ltos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i ltos pa gang zhe na /
translated: The difference in the degree of the mental orientation is due to the difference in the degree of the mental attention.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental attention is due to the difference in the degree of the mental activity.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental activity is due to the difference in the degree of the mental disposition.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental disposition is due to the difference in the degree of the mental habit.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental habit is due to the difference in the degree of the mental practice.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental practice is due to the difference in the degree of the mental beginning.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental beginning is due to the difference in the degree of the mental cause.

original: rva las smyug mar 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rva las smyug mar 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the mental cause is due to the difference in the degree of the mental seed.🔽The difference in the degree of the mental seed is due to the difference in the degree of the mental karma.

original: rva dang smyug ma yang bshan zhing rno ba dang spu gu can du skye bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: rva dang smyug ma yang bshan zhing rno ba dang spu gu can du skye bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the mental karma is due to the difference in the degree of the mental orientation.

original: lci ba las autpal skye ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba las autpal skye ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the mental orientation is due to the difference in the degree of the mental attention.

original: ldam ldum gyi rigs su mthun pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: ldam ldum gyi rigs su mthun pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The difference in the degree of the mental attention is due to the difference in the degree of the mental activity.🔽The difference in

original: 'brog gi ko mo'i 'khyag pa la nyi ma bab pa'i 'od dang rtsar 'phrang pa las me 'byung ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'brog gi ko mo'i 'khyag pa la nyi ma bab pa'i 'od dang rtsar 'phrang pa las me 'byung ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The fire that arises from the friction of two sticks of wood in a dry riverbed in the winter is dependent on a difference.

original: nyi ma'i rang bzhin dro ba las rkyen byas pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rang bzhin dro ba las rkyen byas pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The sun's nature is heat, and it acts as a condition for that. This is the similarity.

original: myu gu skye ba ni zhing dang chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhis rkyen byas pa las skye ste /
analyzed: myu gu skye ba ni zhing dang chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhis rkyen byas pa las skye ste /
translated: The arising of a sprout is dependent on the four great elements, such as the field, water, and so on, as conditions.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs mi 'dra ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs mi 'dra ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The difference in color and shape is dependent on a difference.

original: de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The similarity is that they are all the same in being of the nature of the four great elements.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis rtsva dang shing dang gyo mo la sogs pa bsdus pa las sems can gyi gzugs dang spyod par snang ba yang shing rtsi la spyod pa med pa ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis rtsva dang shing dang gyo mo la sogs pa bsdus pa las sems can gyi gzugs dang spyod par snang ba yang shing rtsi la spyod pa med pa ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The magician gathers grass, wood, pebbles, and so on, and through that the appearance of the forms and behavior of sentient beings arises. The absence of the use of wood resin is dependent on a difference.

original: sgyu ma mkhan nyid dang sngags kyi lha'ang sems can yin pas rkyen byas pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nyid dang sngags kyi lha'ang sems can yin pas rkyen byas pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The magician and the deity of the mantra are sentient beings, so the condition is similar.🔽In different regions, in some places, even though the seed is planted in the husk, it grows in two or three days. In some places, even though the seed is planted in the husk, it becomes like that.

original: yul gyi khams tha dad pa las yul la lar ni sa bon rme'ur btab kyang thog gnyis gsum tsam nas 'tsho ba yul la lar ni sa bon so ba btab kyang de'i tshul gyis rme 'ur 'gyur ba dang / skyur rtsi'i sa bon @176b bskyed pa las kyang ci khag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: yul gyi khams tha dad pa las yul la lar ni sa bon rme'ur btab kyang thog gnyis gsum tsam nas 'tsho ba yul la lar ni sa bon so ba btab kyang de'i tshul gyis rme 'ur 'gyur ba dang / skyur rtsi'i sa bon @176b bskyed pa las kyang ci khag tu 'gyur /
translated: From the seed of sour fruit, it becomes sour.

original: ci khag las skyur rtsir 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ci khag las skyur rtsir 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: From sour, it becomes the seed of sour fruit. This is based on the dissimilar.

original: rme'u dang so ba yang nas su rigs gcig pa dang / skyur rtsi dang ci khag kyang shing gi nang na rigs mthun pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: rme'u dang so ba yang nas su rigs gcig pa dang / skyur rtsi dang ci khag kyang shing gi nang na rigs mthun pa ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The husk and the seed are of the same type, and sour and sour fruit are of the same type among trees. This is the similar part.

original: zhing gi bye brag ma yin par sa gcig la gso ma'i sa bon btab pa las kha cig me tog chags la 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: zhing gi bye brag ma yin par sa gcig la gso ma'i sa bon btab pa las kha cig me tog chags la 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: Without the difference of field, in one place, from planting a pumpkin seed, some become flowers without fruit. This is based on the dissimilar.

original: gso ma'i rang bzhin du 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gso ma'i rang bzhin du 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
translated: The similarity of their nature as being cultivated is the aspect of similarity.

original: de dag ni phyi rol gyi chos su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phyi rol gyi chos su shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as external phenomena.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos tshul bzhin yid la bya ba las skyes te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos tshul bzhin yid la bya ba las skyes te /
translated: The uncontaminated wisdom of the aryas arises from properly contemplating contaminated phenomena.

original: zag pa med pa dang zag par bcas pa chos mi 'dra ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang zag par bcas pa chos mi 'dra ba ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The aspect of dissimilarity is that contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena are dissimilar.

original: de dag dge bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dge bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The aspect of similarity is that they are similar in being virtuous.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la bar chad med par 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las kyang sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la bar chad med par 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las kyang sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang /
translated: The mind and mental factors of the summit of existence and the meditative attainment of nondiscriminating cessation that is a nonassociated formative factor that arises from the mind and the meditative attainment of cessation that is a mind and mental factor that arises from the mind.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sems las ma grol ba'i sems 'byung ba dang 'dod chags kyi sems las zhe sdang gi sems 'byung ba dang / dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sems las ma grol ba'i sems 'byung ba dang 'dod chags kyi sems las zhe sdang gi sems 'byung ba dang / dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba dang /
translated: a liberated mind arises from an unliberated mind, a mind of anger arises from a mind of attachment, a nonvirtuous mind arises from a virtuous mind, a mind of the form realm arises from a mind of the desire realm,

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs pa ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs pa ni mi 'dra ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: a mind of the formless realm arises from a mind of the form realm, and so on.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs shin tu phra ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs shin tu phra ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: The most subtle collection of mind and mental factors of the summit of existence is the cause of the explained mind because it has a similar aspect.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las sems dang sems las byung ba'i skye ba yang nam 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshen  yang las kyi mtshan nyid bkag ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las sems dang sems las byung ba'i skye ba yang nam 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshen  yang las kyi mtshan nyid bkag ste /
translated: The arising of mind and mental factors from the meditative attainment of cessation is also a characteristic of karma because it is not stopped when the meditative attainment of cessation is entered.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ma bkag pas shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las /
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ma bkag pas shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las /
translated: Since the characteristics of the family are not refuted, the cause of the🔽nature of consciousness is the five pristine consciousnesses.🔽

original: las kyi rang bzhin sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa'o //
translated: Since the characteristics of the family are not refuted, the arising of the mind and mental factors, which have the nature of karma, from the cause that is the nature of consciousness is a similarity.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sems las ma grol ba'i sems 'byung ba yang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa dang / dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba yang sems kyi rang bzhin du 'dra ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @177a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sems las ma grol ba'i sems 'byung ba yang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa dang / dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba yang sems kyi rang bzhin du 'dra ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @177a * //
translated: The arising of a liberated mind from an unliberated mind is also a similarity in the nature of consciousness. The arising of an unvirtuous mind from a virtuous mind is also a similarity in the nature of the mind.

original: sems las gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sems las gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ba la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'dra ba ni 'dra ba'i cha yod pa yin te /
translated: The arising of a mind that experiences form from a mind that experiences desire realm objects is also a similarity in arising from a cause that is associated with affliction.

original: 'di dag ni nang gi chos su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nang gi chos su shes par bya'o //
translated: These are to be understood as internal phenomena.

original: phyi logs kyi chos dang nang gi chos de dag gcig gi dpe gcig gis bya bar 'dod na yang rim pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi logs kyi chos dang nang gi chos de dag gcig gi dpe gcig gis bya bar 'dod na yang rim pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: If you think that external phenomena and internal phenomena are the same, then they are similar in the following ways.

original: de ltar 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la ltos shing skye bar 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la ltos shing skye bar 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma says that arising depends on similarity and dissimilarity:

original: 'dra ba las 'dra ba skye ba dang / mi 'dra bar skye ba dang 'dra ba las 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa skye ba dang / shas kyis 'dra ba las shas kyis 'dra ba skye ba dang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba las 'dra ba skye ba dang / mi 'dra bar skye ba dang 'dra ba las 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa skye ba dang / shas kyis 'dra ba las shas kyis 'dra ba skye ba dang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four possibilities: arising from the similar to the similar, arising from the dissimilar to the dissimilar, arising from the similar to the dissimilar, and arising from the partially similar to the partially similar.

original: de las ji ltar na 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyu 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las ji ltar na 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyu 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the cause of the similar is the similar?

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyu las 'bru nyid du 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyu las 'bru nyid du 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, from the cause of rice, rice itself arises.

original: de bzhin du nang gi dge ba'i las 'dra na lha dang mi'i nang du 'bras bu 'dra ba nyid du dmigs pa ni mtha' dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi dge ba'i las 'dra na lha dang mi'i nang du 'bras bu 'dra ba nyid du dmigs pa ni mtha' dang po'o //
translated: In the same way, if the internal action is similar, then in gods and humans, a similar result is observed. This is the first possibility.

original: mi 'dra ba rnams kyis rgyu mi 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni dper na 'o ma mngar po las zho skyur po 'byung ba lta bu ste /🔽de bzhin du nang gi la yang 'jig rten 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba dang / 'dod pa byas pa'i sgra dang / reg dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri rnams kyis byas pa las zho skyur por gyur pa bzhin du sems can dmyal ba dang /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba rnams kyis rgyu mi 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni dper na 'o ma mngar po las zho skyur po 'byung ba lta bu ste / de bzhin du nang gi la yang 'jig rten 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba dang / 'dod pa byas pa'i sgra dang / reg dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri rnams kyis byas pa las zho skyur por gyur pa bzhin du sems can dmyal ba dang /
translated: The difference in causes for different effects is like the sour curd that comes from sweet milk.🔽In the same way, in the inner world, the result of the sweet and pleasant actions of this world is the sour and unpleasant result of the hells,

original: byol song dang yi dags kyi nang du mi 'dod pa dang / mi bzang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dmigs pa ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: byol song dang yi dags kyi nang du mi 'dod pa dang / mi bzang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dmigs pa ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: animals, and hungry ghosts. This is the second extreme.

original: 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni dper na rams dang ba bla sbyar bas kha dog mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba lta bu ste ;
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni dper na rams dang ba bla sbyar bas kha dog mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba lta bu ste ;
translated: The similarity of causes for dissimilar effects is like the color that comes from mixing turmeric and indigo.

original: de bzhin du nang gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la yang las dang 'bras bur mi 'dra ba dang / 'bras bu dang las su mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la yang las dang 'bras bur mi 'dra ba dang / 'bras bu dang las su mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: Likewise, with regard to the internal maturation of the results of action, there are three types of action and result that are not similar:

original: dper na mtshon sbyin pa log par lta ba rnams mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir phyugs gsod pa dag sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba lta bu ste mtha' gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mtshon sbyin pa log par lta ba rnams mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir phyugs gsod pa dag sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba lta bu ste mtha' gsum pa'o //
translated: For example, those who give weapons and those who have wrong views go to hell, even though they desire heaven.

original: shas kyis 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyus shas kyis 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni skud pa dkar po phra mo las snam bu dkar po sbom po nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: shas kyis 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyus shas kyis 'dra bar 'gyur ba ni skud pa dkar po phra mo las snam bu dkar po sbom po nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The fourth alternative is that the cause is similar in part and the result is similar in part. For example, a coarse white cloth results from a fine white thread.

original: phra sbom la mi 'dra ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: phra sbom la mi 'dra ba yod pa'o //
translated: The coarse and fine are not similar.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba'i las phra mo bsags pa sems can dmyal ba chen por skye ba'i las byed pa ni mtha' bzhi pa'o zhes @177b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba'i las phra mo bsags pa sems can dmyal ba chen por skye ba'i las byed pa ni mtha' bzhi pa'o zhes @177b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the accumulation of subtle nonvirtuous actions produces the result of being born in a great hell.

original: 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conventional designation of similarity?

original: 'di dag ni ming dang 'khor 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ming dang 'khor 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhe 'am /
translated: These are called similar because they are similar in name,

original: rtags dang las 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhe'am /
analyzed: rtags dang las 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhe'am /
translated: or similar in sign and action,

original: rang bzhin dang chos 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang chos 'dra bas na 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o //
translated: or similar in nature and attribute.

original: mi 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is designation according to the dissimilar?

original: nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med cing gzung du mi rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med cing gzung du mi rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that space is not unobstructed and ungraspable,🔽but that form is graspable and obstructible.🔽It is not that space is the opposite of the characteristics of form,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa la gzhig tu rung bas na gzugs yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid las zlog pa lta bu yin pas na nam mkha'o zhes bya ba dang thung ngu las lhag pa na ring ngo ;
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa la gzhig tu rung bas na gzugs yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid las zlog pa lta bu yin pas na nam mkha'o zhes bya ba dang thung ngu las lhag pa na ring ngo ;
translated: but that space is the opposite of the characteristics of form.🔽It is not that long is not the opposite of short,🔽but that long is the opposite of short.

original: / ring por ma slebs pas na thung ngo zhes bya ba dang / yongs su ma dag pa ltar skyon dang bcas pa ma yin pas na yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: / ring por ma slebs pas na thung ngo zhes bya ba dang / yongs su ma dag pa ltar skyon dang bcas pa ma yin pas na yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is not that purity is not the opposite of impurity,🔽but that purity is the opposite of impurity.

original: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan lta bu med pa nas yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta bu dag ni mi 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan lta bu med pa nas yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta bu dag ni mi 'dra ba'i rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o //
translated: The qualities of complete purity are not nonexistent, but they are not completely pure.

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba las rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gsung rab dag las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba las rjes su tha snyad gdags pa gsung rab dag las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: The scriptures also mention designations that are similar and dissimilar.

original: 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Dense Array Sūtra says:🔽The understanding of the nonexistence of rabbit horns arises from the existence of ox horns.

original: ri bong gi rva med par rtogs pa yang glang gi rva yod par rtogs pa'i zla las byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa'i rgyan gyi mdo las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer rtag tu yon tan bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan brgyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med par rtogs pa yang glang gi rva yod par rtogs pa'i zla las byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa'i rgyan gyi mdo las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer rtag tu yon tan bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan brgyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The Ornament of the Qualities of the Land of the Tathāgata Sūtra, which is part of the Ornament of Mañjuśrī’s Buddha Land, says that the perfect array of the qualities of the buddha land of the Tathāgata King of the Array of Constant Light Rays is similar to the array of the qualities of the buddha land of the Tathāgata King of the Array of Constant Light Rays.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu gzigs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu gzigs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddha's field of the Tathagata Samantadarśin will be endowed with the same perfect array of excellences as the Buddha's field of Śākyamuni.

original: lhag chad med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag chad med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There will be no excess or deficiency.

original: 'du byed de dag bskyed pa dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag bskyed pa dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions that generate those formations and that conventionally designate them?

original: skyes pa'i rgyu ni drug rkyen ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rgyu ni drug rkyen ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are six causes of birth and four conditions.🔽In the Abhidharma, cause is said to be of six types: homogeneous immediate

original: chos mngon pa las 'byung ba de la rgyu ni rab tu ldan pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / cha mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang drug go //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las 'byung ba de la rgyu ni rab tu ldan pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / cha mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang drug go //
translated: cause, concomitant cause, universal cause, retributive cause, and active cause.🔽Condition is said to be of four types: causal condition,

original: rkyen ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang bzhi'o //
translated: immediate condition, object condition, and dominant condition.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga rnams so //
translated: Among them, the causal condition is the five causes.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma @178a * //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma @178a * //
translated: The condition of immediate contiguity is the final mind and mental factors of an arhat.🔽

original: ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa thams cad do //
translated: The condition as direct antecedent is all minds and mental factors that have arisen, with the exception of the final mind and mental factors of an arhat.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition is all phenomena.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The dominant condition is the active cause.

original: de la rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen di chos mngon pa las 'byung ba'i ming mang po la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen di chos mngon pa las 'byung ba'i ming mang po la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The causes and conditions for the designation of subsequent expressions are the many terms that occur in the Abhidharma.

original: de la ming gi tshogs ni brda 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming gi tshogs ni brda 'dus pa'o //
translated: Among them, the collection of names is the collection of terms.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag 'dus pa'o //
translated: The collection of phrases is the collection of sentences.

original: 'bru'i tshogs ni yi ge 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i tshogs ni yi ge 'dus pa'o //
translated: The collection of letters is the collection of syllables.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste dang po'o /🔽// / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste dang po'o / // / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: This is the first chapter, on the characteristics of reasoning by the method of interdependence.🔽The characteristics of reasoning by the method of efficacy.

original: gang chos rnams kyi 'thob pa'i phyir ram /🔽greg pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi 'thob pa'i phyir ram /🔽greg pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The method of efficacy is the method of cause and effect.🔽The method of efficacy is the method of cause and effect.

original: skyes nas kyang las su bya ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
analyzed: skyes nas kyang las su bya ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
translated: This is the principle of efficacy.

original: de la 'thob ba ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'thob ba ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: Obtainment is the acquisition and possession of something.

original: de yang sa bon tsam du rgyu 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thob pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang sa bon tsam du rgyu 'thob pa dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thob pa dang gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold: the obtainment of a cause as a mere seed and the obtainment of the nature of the result.

original: sa bon tsam du rgyu 'thob pa gang zhe na /🔽'phags pa'i sa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams byas pa dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa byas pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang /
analyzed: sa bon tsam du rgyu 'thob pa gang zhe na / 'phags pa'i sa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams byas pa dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa byas pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang /
translated: What is the obtainment of a cause as a mere seed?

original: de dag gi sa bon lta bu bag chags dang ldan pa'o /
analyzed: de dag gi sa bon lta bu bag chags dang ldan pa'o /
translated: It is the possession of the roots of virtue that obtain the ārya levels and results, the possession of the merit that obtains the happiness of gods and humans, the possession of the sin that obtains the experience of the suffering of the lower realms, and the possession of the seeds of those that are neutral.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obtainment of the nature of the result?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu mngon du rnyed pa yin te mya ngan las 'das pa dang / sa dang 'bras bu mngon du 'thob pa dang / bsod nams kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa 'am /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu mngon du rnyed pa yin te mya ngan las 'das pa dang / sa dang 'bras bu mngon du 'thob pa dang / bsod nams kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa 'am /
translated: The result of these is the attainment of nirvana, the attainment of the levels and the result and the attainment of the result of merit.

original: sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong ba'o //
translated: The result of these is the attainment of nirvana, the attainment of the stages and the results, the attainment of the result of merit, or the experience of the result of sin.

original: greg pa ni gang gi dngos por red pa las kyang don gyi mtha' yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: greg pa ni gang gi dngos por red pa las kyang don gyi mtha' yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The completion of the result is the full completion of the object through the thing that is its result.

original: dper na myu gu las sdong po 'am /
analyzed: dper na myu gu las sdong po 'am /
translated: For example, from the sprout, the trunk,

original: 'bras bur smin pa'i bar du de la gnod pa bsrung zhing phan pa bsdu ba'i nan tan gyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur smin pa'i bar du de la gnod pa bsrung zhing phan pa bsdu ba'i nan tan gyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: up to the ripening of the fruit, it is completed by the earnest practice of protecting it from harm and gathering what is beneficial.

original: myu gu de la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten gyi chos mgo byung ba'i rnam pa mthar phyin par sgrub pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa thob pas gong ma'i sa yongs su greg par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu de la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten gyi chos mgo byung ba'i rnam pa mthar phyin par sgrub pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa thob pas gong ma'i sa yongs su greg par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as with the sprout, the completion of the aspects of the arising of worldly dharmas is accomplished, and the completion of the higher stages through attaining the noble stages, and so on.

original: skyes nas kyang las su bya ba ni dngos por red pa de dag ji srid du rgyun yod pa de srid du bya ba byed pa yod de /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang las su bya ba ni dngos por red pa de dag ji srid du rgyun yod pa de srid du bya ba byed pa yod de /
translated: Also, once arisen, they perform their function as long as they exist.

original: dper na shing lcug ma la sogs par skyes phyin chang lcug mas ni bcing ba'i las byed /
analyzed: dper na shing lcug ma la sogs par skyes phyin chang lcug mas ni bcing ba'i las byed /
translated: For example, once a plant such as a bamboo has arisen, the shoot performs the function of binding,

original: sdong pos ni ka ba'i las byed /
analyzed: sdong pos ni ka ba'i las byed /
translated: the stem performs the function of a pillar,

original: @178b me tog gis rgyan gyi las byed /🔽lo mas ni dkri ba'i las byed /
analyzed: @178b me tog gis rgyan gyi las byed / lo mas ni dkri ba'i las byed /
translated: the flowers perform the function of ornament,🔽the leaves perform the function of wrapping and the fruit performs the function of filling.

original: 'bras bus ni 'grangs pa'i las byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos la bdag gi sa'i bye brag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'ang thabs kyi tha dad pa nas so so'i lam la gzhog pa la sogs pa chos gang gi rgyur nges pa de'i 'bras bu so sor skyed pa dang /
analyzed: 'bras bus ni 'grangs pa'i las byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos la bdag gi sa'i bye brag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'ang thabs kyi tha dad pa nas so so'i lam la gzhog pa la sogs pa chos gang gi rgyur nges pa de'i 'bras bu so sor skyed pa dang /
translated: Also, the ārya Dharma benefits sentient beings through the specific stages of the self, such as establishing them in the individual paths, which are determined to be the cause of any Dharma.

original: dbang po drug shes pa dang bcas pa yul du nges par 'jug pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni 'phur /
analyzed: dbang po drug shes pa dang bcas pa yul du nges par 'jug pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni 'phur /
translated: The six sense faculties together with consciousness engage their objects with specific methods and birds and so on fly.

original: nya la sogs pa ni rgyug pa dang 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis dngos po so so'i mthu yod pas gang la gang rigs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nya la sogs pa ni rgyug pa dang 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis dngos po so so'i mthu yod pas gang la gang rigs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Fish and so on, by running and in this way, have the power of individual things, so they do the activity that is appropriate for each.

original: de dag gi rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang byed pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / gzhir gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang byed pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / gzhir gyur pa yin te /
translated: That which is called “that which has become a cause” and “that which has become a condition” is that which is included as a part of the activity and that which has become the basis.

original: rgyu drug dang rkyen bzhi gong du smos ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rgyu drug dang rkyen bzhi gong du smos ba rnams yin no //
translated: The six causes and the four conditions mentioned above are those.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter on the characteristics of the reasoning of activity performance.

original: // / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la dam bcas shing bstan te /
analyzed: // / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la dam bcas shing bstan te /
translated: In the characteristics of the reasoning of proof by means of reasons, the thesis is stated and taught.

original: smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dang rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
analyzed: smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dang rkyen du gyur pa de dag ni gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa bshad do //
translated: In order to establish the meaning that is spoken of and to make it understood, those that have become causes and those that have become conditions are said to be the reasoning of proof by means of reasons.

original: de la dam bca' ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smras pa da bzhin du 'bras bu dang bcas par khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam bca' ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smras pa da bzhin du 'bras bu dang bcas par khas blangs pa'o //
translated: The vow is the promise to accomplish the result in accordance with the statement.

original: 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result?

original: gang gis yal gzugs 'khra bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gis yal gzugs 'khra bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is that by which one is bound to the tree.

original: ji ltar dam bcas ma grub na pha logs kyi skyabs su 'gro ba dang / de'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa dang shes rab bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dam bcas ma grub na pha logs kyi skyabs su 'gro ba dang / de'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa dang shes rab bsgom pa'o //
translated: If the vow is not accomplished, one will not go to the other side, nor will one go forth into his teaching, nor will one guard morality, nor will one attain concentration, nor will one cultivate wisdom.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa sems can gyi don du 'gyur bas yal gzugs 'khra bar bya'i lha khang gzhig pa dang yul gru dbrog pa dang srog gi bar chad dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba la sogs pa sdig to mi dge ba'i yal gzugs mi bca'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa sems can gyi don du 'gyur bas yal gzugs 'khra bar bya'i lha khang gzhig pa dang yul gru dbrog pa dang srog gi bar chad dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba la sogs pa sdig to mi dge ba'i yal gzugs mi bca'o //
translated: One should not bind oneself to the tree of evil and non-virtue, such as destroying temples, plundering villages, obstructing life, and causing physical suffering, because such things do not benefit sentient beings in this way.

original: yal gzugs 'khra ba med par btsan na yang 'gran tor can khas brgya pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi ci rigs par yal gzugs 'khra bar bya'o //
analyzed: yal gzugs 'khra ba med par btsan na yang 'gran tor can khas brgya pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi ci rigs par yal gzugs 'khra bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not allow the intermingling of the two forms of evidence, then it will be like a hundred cases of dispute, but if one allows the intermingling of the two forms of evidence, then it will be like a single case of dispute.

original: yal gzugs 'khras ba de la pham rgyal dang / gnyis kar mi 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu bya ba ni yon yod pa dang khrin can dang bar mdo dang gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yal gzugs 'khras ba de la pham rgyal dang / gnyis kar mi 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu bya ba ni yon yod pa dang khrin can dang bar mdo dang gsum du shes par bya'o //
