translated: The specific cases of victory and defeat and of neither victory nor defeat in the intermingling of the two forms of evidence should be understood as being of three types: the case of the witness, the case of the written record, and the case of the oath.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are these?

original: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad mas grub na yon yod pa @179a * //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad mas grub na yon yod pa @179a * // zhes bya ste /
translated: If one is established by a valid cognition that is completely pure with regard to the characteristics, then it is the case of the witness.

original: rgyal po mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad mas sun phyung ba khrin can zhes bya ste pham pa'o //🔽mtshan nyid bzhi 'am lngas yongs su ma dag pa'i tshad mas grub ces zer yang rung /
analyzed: rgyal po mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad mas sun phyung ba khrin can zhes bya ste pham pa'o // mtshan nyid bzhi 'am lngas yongs su ma dag pa'i tshad mas grub ces zer yang rung /
translated: If one is refuted by a valid cognition that is completely pure with regard to the characteristics, then it is the case of the written record.

original: sun byung zhes zer yang rung /
analyzed: sun byung zhes zer yang rung /
translated: If one is established by a valid cognition that is not completely pure with regard to the four or five characteristics, or if one is refuted by such a valid cognition,

original: tshad dang ma sbyar bar che ge mo zhig gi phyir ro zhe 'am /
analyzed: tshad dang ma sbyar bar che ge mo zhig gi phyir ro zhe 'am /
translated: or if one is established or refuted without applying a valid cognition, then it is the case of the oath.

original: gang che ge mo zhig tu 'gyur ro zhe 'am /
analyzed: gang che ge mo zhig tu 'gyur ro zhe 'am /
translated: One says, I will become such and such.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs te tshig rgyal ba smras pa ni bar mdo ba zhes bya sde /
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs te tshig rgyal ba smras pa ni bar mdo ba zhes bya sde /
translated: Or, This is so and so, and so on. These are called words of victory.

original: grub ba sun 'byin pa gnyis kal ma gtogs kyis slar bskyar ba'i gtan tshigs zhig yod na mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma dang sbyar zhing gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: grub ba sun 'byin pa gnyis kal ma gtogs kyis slar bskyar ba'i gtan tshigs zhig yod na mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma dang sbyar zhing gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: If there is a reason for repeating both the establishment and the refutation, it is to be applied with a valid cognition that is completely pure by nature and to be ascertained.

original: phyogs re re 'dzin pa gnyis ka la bskyar ba'i gtan tshigs med na kha tsam du dor ro //
analyzed: phyogs re re 'dzin pa gnyis ka la bskyar ba'i gtan tshigs med na kha tsam du dor ro //
translated: If there is no reason for repeating both positions, it is to be discarded as mere words.

original: bstan pa ni khong du ma chud pa rnams la khong du gzhug ba yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni khong du ma chud pa rnams la khong du gzhug ba yin te /
translated: The teaching is to make those who have not understood it understand it.

original: gtan la phab pa'i yan lag rnam pa bdun dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gtan la phab pa'i yan lag rnam pa bdun dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught to have seven aspects of ascertainment.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: gleng bslang ba dang / mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa 'am /
analyzed: gleng bslang ba dang / mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa 'am /
translated: The introduction, the concordant, the discordant,

original: 'gal ba dang grub pa'i mtha' rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan nyid gsum gyi don dang 'dra ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rtags yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang grub pa'i mtha' rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan nyid gsum gyi don dang 'dra ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rtags yod pa'o //
translated: 1. the introduction, 2. the objection, 3. the completion of the philosophy, 4. the similarity of meaning of the three realities, 5. the prediction, and 6. the existence of the reason.

original: de la gleng bslang ba ni phas mi 'dri ba la yang tshur bskul ba yin te /🔽pha rol gyi tshur rtogs nas nyan thos gyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de la gleng bslang ba ni phas mi 'dri ba la yang tshur bskul ba yin te / pha rol gyi tshur rtogs nas nyan thos gyi theg pa'am /
translated: The introduction is the urging of the questioner to ask, even if he does not.

original: theg pa chen po'i phyogs gang 'os pa cig las gleng pa'i gzhi bca' ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i phyogs gang 'os pa cig las gleng pa'i gzhi bca' ba'o //
translated: Having understood the other's question, he establishes the basis of the discussion in the Sravakayana or the Mahayana, whichever is appropriate.

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the agreement and disagreement?

original: gang las gleng bslang ba'i gzhir bcas pa de dang mu stegs can gang la bstan pa de'i gtsug lag tu mthun par bsgrub pa'i mtha' 'gro ba las 'byung ba bzhin du bstan pa'am /
analyzed: gang las gleng bslang ba'i gzhir bcas pa de dang mu stegs can gang la bstan pa de'i gtsug lag tu mthun par bsgrub pa'i mtha' 'gro ba las 'byung ba bzhin du bstan pa'am /
translated: The basis of the discussion is established in agreement with the scriptures of the tirthikas to whom it is taught, as in the case of the origin of the world.

original: gzhan du chos bzang ngan gyi khyad zhugs pa dang / rgya che chung mi 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du chos bzang ngan gyi khyad zhugs pa dang / rgya che chung mi 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the good or bad qualities of the doctrine and the great or small differences in the scriptures are taught.

original: de gnyis las gang bstan na dad pa skye zhing yang dag pa'i lam rtogs par 'gyur ba cig gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las gang bstan na dad pa skye zhing yang dag pa'i lam rtogs par 'gyur ba cig gis bstan pa'o //
translated: If one of these two is taught, it is taught by the one who gives rise to faith and realizes the right path.

original: grub pa'i mtha' rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the completion of tenets?

original: so so'i phyogs bzung ste /
analyzed: so so'i phyogs bzung ste /
translated: Taking up one's own position,

original: yang dag pa gang yin pa'i yul bstod na grub pa'i mtha' phyogs 'ga' tsam gyis mi brtsad par gtsug lag 'byung ba'i mdo che ge thog thag tu bskrun te /
analyzed: yang dag pa gang yin pa'i yul bstod na grub pa'i mtha' phyogs 'ga' tsam gyis mi brtsad par gtsug lag 'byung ba'i mdo che ge thog thag tu bskrun te /
translated: if the object of what is right is praised, the tenets are not disputed by just a few positions, but the scriptures are spread far and wide.

original: btsad kyi ro snyis  drag gam /
analyzed: btsad kyi ro snyis  drag gam /
translated: Is the king's food good or not?

original: smra bde mi bde 'am /
analyzed: smra bde mi bde 'am /
translated: Is the speech good or not?

original: tshig dor mi dor tsam gyi yus su mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshig dor mi dor tsam gyi yus su mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It does not occur as a mere boast of whether the words are rejected or not.

original: de ste la la zhig ngo gang drag dang / smra gang bde dang / sgra la gang mkhas kyis brgya zhing rtsod na ni 'jig rten gyi 'gran thor can khas brgya @179b par zad de don med kyis yal gzugs mi 'khra bar ci dgar rtsod cig /
analyzed: de ste la la zhig ngo gang drag dang / smra gang bde dang / sgra la gang mkhas kyis brgya zhing rtsod na ni 'jig rten gyi 'gran thor can khas brgya @179b par zad de don med kyis yal gzugs mi 'khra bar ci dgar rtsod cig /
translated: If someone were to argue, saying, Who is more noble? Who speaks better? Who is more skilled in sound?, then the world would be filled with braggarts, and the meaning would be lost in meaningless chatter.

original: gtsug lag gi mdo bskrun pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag gi mdo bskrun pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the spreading of the scriptures?

original: chos so cog gi thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha'i lo rgyus dang / sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rim pa dang rnam grangs dang / 'khor ban gnas pa'i rgyu ci las byung /
analyzed: chos so cog gi thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha'i lo rgyus dang / sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rim pa dang rnam grangs dang / 'khor ban gnas pa'i rgyu ci las byung /
translated: the causes from which the world comes into being,

original: thar par bya ba'i lam gang yin /
analyzed: thar par bya ba'i lam gang yin /
translated: the path by which one is liberated,

original: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i nyes pa ci yod /
translated: the faults of remaining in cyclic existence,

original: thar par gyur pa'i yon tan cis 'phags /
analyzed: thar par gyur pa'i yon tan cis 'phags /
translated: the qualities by which one is elevated to liberation,

original: lung las 'byung ba'i tshig 'gal ba 'dra ba zhig yod na gang yang mi spang bar gnyis ka mthun par sgrub pa dang / 'di rnams bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: lung las 'byung ba'i tshig 'gal ba 'dra ba zhig yod na gang yang mi spang bar gnyis ka mthun par sgrub pa dang / 'di rnams bskrun pa'o //
translated: and if there are any seemingly contradictory statements in the scriptures, to establish that they are both correct without rejecting either.

original: mtshan nyid gsum gyi don dang ldan pa gang zhen /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum gyi don dang ldan pa gang zhen /
translated: What is it to possess the meaning of the three natures?

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: It is the imagined, the dependent, and the consummate.

original: de la kun brtags pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //🔽gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do // gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Among them, the imagined is worldly convention.🔽The dependent is conventional truth.

original: yongs su grub pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The consummate is ultimate truth.

original: de la sangs rgyas pa'i lta bar mtshungs pa nang phyogs re re bzung ste rtsod na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas pa'i lta bar mtshungs pa nang phyogs re re bzung ste rtsod na /
translated: If one argues, taking up the Buddhist view in its entirety,

original: mtshan nyid gang gi phyogs su bzung ba de'i grub pa ni mtha' dang mthun par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang gi phyogs su bzung ba de'i grub pa ni mtha' dang mthun par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the proof of that position, whatever its characteristics, is established in accordance with the limits of the position.

original: pha logs kyi phyogs la sun dbyung ba yang bdag gi phyogs su bzung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mthun par sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: pha logs kyi phyogs la sun dbyung ba yang bdag gi phyogs su bzung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mthun par sun dbyung ngo //
translated: The refutation of the opponent's position is also a refutation in accordance with the tenets of the position that I hold.

original: de las grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyi phyogs kyis bdag gi phyogs mi 'grub ba lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: de las grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyi phyogs kyis bdag gi phyogs mi 'grub ba lta ci smos kyi /
translated: How much less could the position of another tenet system establish my position!

original: grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyis pha rol gyi lta ba sun phyung du zin kyang bdag gi lta ba'i nang du bsdur mi nus so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyis pha rol gyi lta ba sun phyung du zin kyang bdag gi lta ba'i nang du bsdur mi nus so //
translated: Even if the view of the opponent is refuted by another tenet system, it cannot be included within my view.

original: de bas na sun dbyung ba yang bdag gi lta ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mthun pas sun dbyung ste /
analyzed: de bas na sun dbyung ba yang bdag gi lta ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mthun pas sun dbyung ste /
translated: Therefore, the refutation is also a refutation in accordance with the tenets of my view.

original: kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs ltar grub na yang gzhan gyi dbang ngam yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ltar mi brjod do //
analyzed: kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs ltar grub na yang gzhan gyi dbang ngam yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ltar mi brjod do //
translated: Even if the imagined nature is established as the characteristic of the dependent nature, it is not called the dependent nature or the perfected nature.

original: lhag ma gnyis kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: The remaining two natures should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: mu stegs can dang brtsad na ni bden pa gnyis gang ltar grub kyang sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba'i nang du bsdur rung la /🔽'dus byas kyi chos thams cad la'ang mtshan nyid gsum yod kyis /
analyzed: mu stegs can dang brtsad na ni bden pa gnyis gang ltar grub kyang sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba'i nang du bsdur rung la / 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad la'ang mtshan nyid gsum yod kyis /
translated: When debating with the tīrthikas, it is suitable to include any of the two truths within the Buddhist view, regardless of how they are established.🔽All conditioned phenomena have three natures.

original: mtshan nyid gsum char dang ldan pa'i lta bar khas blangs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum char dang ldan pa'i lta bar khas blangs te /
translated: Therefore, one should accept the view that all phenomena have the three natures.

original: de dag gi tshul gyis ci rigs par sgrub cing sun dbyung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshul gyis ci rigs par sgrub cing sun dbyung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: One should teach that they are established and refuted in accordance with their mode of being.

original: drang ba gang zhen /
analyzed: drang ba gang zhen /
translated: What is the interpretable meaning?

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba lta bu'i sgro 'dogs pa dang @180a * //🔽phri ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba lta bu'i sgro 'dogs pa dang @180a * // phri ba med pa'o //
translated: It is like what appears in the Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra and so on, which is free from superimposition and denial.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang / phri ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang / phri ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is superimposition and what is denial?

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of each.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa dang / med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: 1. overestimation of the characteristic of non-existence, 2. overestimation of the view of non-existence, 3. overestimation of the cause of non-existence, 4. overestimation of the entity of non-existence.

original: phri bde'ang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phri bde'ang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four kinds of underestimation:

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid las phri ba dang / yod pa'i lta ba las phri ba dang / yod pa'i rgyu las phri ba dang / yod pa'i dngos po las phri ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid las phri ba dang / yod pa'i lta ba las phri ba dang / yod pa'i rgyu las phri ba dang / yod pa'i dngos po las phri ba'o //
translated: 1. underestimation of the characteristic of existence, 2. underestimation of the view of existence, 3. underestimation of the cause of existence, 4. underestimation of the entity of existence.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la ril po dang rtag pa dang / ji ltar snar ba de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la ril po dang rtag pa dang / ji ltar snar ba de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin par zhen pa'o //
translated: Overestimation of the characteristic of non-existence is the adherence to the aggregates, elements, and media as a whole, as permanent, and as not different from what appears to be so.

original: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid la bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang gang zag tu lta ba ngan par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid la bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang gang zag tu lta ba ngan par zhen pa'o //
translated: The reification of the view of non-existence is the adherence to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as the self, sentient beings, life, nourisher, person, and individual.

original: med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni sngon rgyu las ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis sgyu ma lta bur sngon ma byung zhing med pa las gzugs dang snang ba'i rgyu dran pa sngon du 'jug pas 'byung zhing med pa las byung nas kyang 'jig par 'dzin
analyzed: med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni sngon rgyu las ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis sgyu ma lta bur sngon ma byung zhing med pa las gzugs dang snang ba'i rgyu dran pa sngon du 'jug pas 'byung zhing med pa las byung nas kyang 'jig par 'dzin
translated: The reification of the cause of non-existence is the belief that consciousness, not previously arisen from causes, arises from the non-existent, like an illusion, and having arisen from the non-existent, it perishes.

original: pa'o // med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni nam mkha' dang 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa dngos po med par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni nam mkha' dang 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa dngos po med par zhen pa'o //
translated: The reification of non-existent entities is the adherence to unconditioned space, cessation, and nirvana as non-existent entities.

original: phri ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phri ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is diminution?

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsum po la sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhi lta bus sgro btags nas de dag gi mtshan nyid dam lta ba 'am rgyu 'am dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba las phri ba yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsum po la sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhi lta bus sgro btags nas de dag gi mtshan nyid dam lta ba 'am rgyu 'am dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba las phri ba yin no //
translated: 1. imputation of existence, 2. imputation of nonexistence, 3. imputation of both existence and nonexistence, and 4. imputation of neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: lung bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the prediction?

original: phas 'dri ba la lan gdab pa yin te /
analyzed: phas 'dri ba la lan gdab pa yin te /
translated: It is the answer to a question.🔽There are four kinds of answers:

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa dang / phyir dri ba dang / mi bstan pa dang bzhi'o //🔽de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa dang / phyir dri ba dang / mi bstan pa dang bzhi'o // de gang zhe na /
translated: 1. answer by definition, 2. answer by question, 3. answer by silence, and 4. answer by asking for a clarification of the question.

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa ni /
translated: What is the answer by definition?

original: chos bdag med pa de gang la med ces 'dri na chos thams cad la bdag med par mtshungs so zhes bya ba dang / don dam par na mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i chos gang yin zhes 'dri na chos thams cad do zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dus gsum gyi nang na dus gang gi chos mkhyen zhes 'dri na dus thams cad kyi chos so cog mkhyen to zhes @180b bya ba dang /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa de gang la med ces 'dri na chos thams cad la bdag med par mtshungs so zhes bya ba dang / don dam par na mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i chos gang yin zhes 'dri na chos thams cad do zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dus gsum gyi nang na dus gang gi chos mkhyen zhes 'dri na dus thams cad kyi chos so cog mkhyen to zhes @180b bya ba dang /
translated: If one asks, “In the three times, in which time does the omniscient one know phenomena?” one should say, “He knows all phenomena of the three times.”

original: sems can thams cad 'chi 'am mi 'chi zhes 'dri na 'chi'o zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'chi 'am mi 'chi zhes 'dri na 'chi'o zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: If one asks, “Do all sentient beings die or not?” one should say, “They die.”

original: thun mong gi chos las phyogs gcig gi tshul du 'dri ba la mgo gcig tu lung ston to //
analyzed: thun mong gi chos las phyogs gcig gi tshul du 'dri ba la mgo gcig tu lung ston to //
translated: Thus, in response to questions that are asked in terms of a single aspect of a common phenomenon, one should give a definitive answer.

original: rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa ni /
translated: The second, the definitive answer through analysis, is as follows.

original: chos thams cad rtag gam mi rtag ces 'dri na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtag gam mi rtag ces 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Are all phenomena permanent or impermanent?”

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni mi rtag /'dus ma byas kyi chos ni rtag go zhes bya ba dang / byang chub gsum la bye brag med dam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni mi rtag /'dus ma byas kyi chos ni rtag go zhes bya ba dang / byang chub gsum la bye brag med dam zhes 'dri na /
translated: Is there no distinction among the three enlightenments?

original: rnam par grol ba la ni bye brag med de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la ni bye brag med de /
translated: There is no distinction in liberation,🔽but there is a distinction in the Dharma body.🔽Are all sentient beings born or not born?

original: chos kyi skus bye brag yod do zhes bya ba dang / sems can thams cad skye 'am mi skye zhes 'dri na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni skye'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skus bye brag yod do zhes bya ba dang / sems can thams cad skye 'am mi skye zhes 'dri na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni skye'o //
translated: If one asks, Are those with afflictions born?🔽One should explain, Those without afflictions are not born in the manner of those with afflictions being born.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i tshul gyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs te so so'i mtshan nyid las spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'dri ba la rnam par phye ste bstan to //🔽phyir dris te lung bstan pa ni zla mi smos par bzang khyad ji tsam zhe 'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i tshul gyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs te so so'i mtshan nyid las spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'dri ba la rnam par phye ste bstan to // phyir dris te lung bstan pa ni zla mi smos par bzang khyad ji tsam zhe 'am /
translated: Thus, one should explain by distinguishing the general characteristics from the specific characteristics in such questions.

original: ngan khyad ji tsam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ngan khyad ji tsam zhes 'dri na /
translated: As for the answer by counter-question, if one asks, How much is the excellence of good? or How much is the excellence of bad?🔽without specifying,

original: gang btang bskrun zhes 'dri ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan thos pa'i sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog gam mi ldog ces 'dri na /
analyzed: gang btang bskrun zhes 'dri ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan thos pa'i sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog gam mi ldog ces 'dri na /
translated: and Do all sentient beings who hear the name of the Tathagata turn away from unsurpassable awakening or not?

original: shing gi sa bon zhig sa bon gyi nyes pa thams cad med na /
analyzed: shing gi sa bon zhig sa bon gyi nyes pa thams cad med na /
translated: If someone asks, If a seed of a tree is without all the faults of a seed,

original: rkyen rnams su ldan pa dang mi ldan pa las myu gu nas rdzogs pa'i bar du ji ltar 'gyur zhes phyir dri ba dang / srog chags chad par bcug ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams su ldan pa dang mi ldan pa las myu gu nas rdzogs pa'i bar du ji ltar 'gyur zhes phyir dri ba dang / srog chags chad par bcug ste /
translated: how does it become from a sprout up to a complete tree from having conditions either complete or incomplete?

original: gson po 'am shi ba zhes 'dri ba la khyod bdag la dbang yod na /
analyzed: gson po 'am shi ba zhes 'dri ba la khyod bdag la dbang yod na /
translated: If someone asks, Having killed a living being, is it alive or dead?🔽If someone asks, If you have power over me,🔽what should I do?

original: gang ltar bya zhes dri ba la sogs pa nyes pa'i klan ka tshol ba la skungs  gzhar bar phyir dris te bstan to //
analyzed: gang ltar bya zhes dri ba la sogs pa nyes pa'i klan ka tshol ba la skungs  gzhar bar phyir dris te bstan to //
translated: and so on, one should teach by asking in return, seeking out the faults of the one who is arguing.

original: lung mi bstan pa ni gnyis su med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: lung mi bstan pa ni gnyis su med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhes 'dri na /
translated: If someone asks, What is the characteristic of the nondual and the inexpressible in the indeterminate?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa bzhin du mi smra ba dang / bdag ces bya ba rtag gam mi rtag ces 'dri na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa bzhin du mi smra ba dang / bdag ces bya ba rtag gam mi rtag ces 'dri na /
translated: when asked whether the self is permanent or impermanent,

original: bdag nyid kyang med pas na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang med pas na /
translated: since the self itself does not exist,🔽it cannot be said to be either permanent or impermanent.🔽If one is asked a question that is not a proper question, such as “Is the child of a barren woman born or unborn?”

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa brjod du med de lan mi glan pa dang dag ngan pa 'am rtsub po zhig zer na chos dpyad pa la ma gtogs te lan mi glan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa brjod du med de lan mi glan pa dang dag ngan pa 'am rtsub po zhig zer na chos dpyad pa la ma gtogs te lan mi glan pa yin no //
translated: one should not answer, except in order to discuss the Dharma.🔽If one is asked a question that is not to be discussed, such as “Is the Tathāgata existent or nonexistent after nirvāṇa?”

original: lung mi bstan pa ni mkhan po'i dpe ma khyud bya ba ma yin gyi tshul gyis go bar @181a * //🔽rung ste ; bstan mi dgos pa dang bstan kyang khong du mi chud pa dang / bstan na ste pha rol gyi sems bsrung ba dang / de rnams kyi phyir mi bstan mod kyi dus gzhan du snod dang sbyar zhing bstan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lung mi bstan pa ni mkhan po'i dpe ma khyud bya ba ma yin gyi tshul gyis go bar @181a * // rung ste ; bstan mi dgos pa dang bstan kyang khong du mi chud pa dang / bstan na ste pha rol gyi sems bsrung ba dang / de rnams kyi phyir mi bstan mod kyi dus gzhan du snod dang sbyar zhing bstan pa yang yod do //
translated: one should not answer, except in order to discuss the Dharma.🔽If one is asked a question that is to be set aside, such as “Is the Tathāgata the same as or different from the aggregates?”🔽one should not answer, except in order to discuss the Dharma.

original: rtags yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtags yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: If one is asked a question that is to be discussed, such as “Are the aggregates, etc.

original: yang na mi las bla mar gyur pas gtsug lag tu gyur pa ston to cog smon pa'i tshig lta bur 'ol ma chags par smra ba ni gang yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na mi las bla mar gyur pas gtsug lag tu gyur pa ston to cog smon pa'i tshig lta bur 'ol ma chags par smra ba ni gang yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: There is no one who speaks without having examined the meaning of the words of aspiration.

original: gang gis dngos po med pa las yod par 'dzin to cog kyang de ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig dang nor te yod pa las med par lta'o cog kyang bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa cig gis bsgribs pas med par smra'o cog gag kyang rung /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po med pa las yod par 'dzin to cog kyang de ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig dang nor te yod pa las med par lta'o cog kyang bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa cig gis bsgribs pas med par smra'o cog gag kyang rung /
translated: Whoever grasps as existent what is not existent, errs in regard to another thing which is not that. Whoever views as nonexistent what is existent, errs in regard to something which is existent.

original: de'i mtshan nyid las gzhan du ston to cog kyang de dang 'dra bar snang ba 'ga' zhig las nor bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid las gzhan du ston to cog kyang de dang 'dra bar snang ba 'ga' zhig las nor bar gyur to //
translated: Whoever teaches a characteristic other than that, errs in regard to something which appears like that.

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa las yod par 'dzin pa bzlog par bya na yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes mi bya bar yod par 'dod pa de rkyen gang las gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan yod par bsgrubs la de'i gtan tshigs kyis
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa las yod par 'dzin pa bzlog par bya na yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes mi bya bar yod par 'dod pa de rkyen gang las gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan yod par bsgrubs la de'i gtan tshigs kyis
translated: Therefore, when one is to be dissuaded from grasping as existent what is not existent, one should not say that it is absolutely nonexistent. One should establish the existence of another thing from which the existent is produced, and by that reason

original: bstan to // yod pa las med par lta ba bzlog par bya na yod pa'i gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig gis sgrub kyi de mngon sum du dmigs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa 'dis bsgribs so zhes byas la dngos po gang yod pa dang /🔽sgrib pa gang yin pa bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sgrub cing bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to // yod pa las med par lta ba bzlog par bya na yod pa'i gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig gis sgrub kyi de mngon sum du dmigs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa 'dis bsgribs so zhes byas la dngos po gang yod pa dang / sgrib pa gang yin pa bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sgrub cing bstan to //
translated: One should establish and teach it by means of a reason that includes whatever exists and whatever obscures the direct perception of it.

original: mtshan gyi gzhi yod pa dang med pa la mi rtsod par mtshan nyid la rtsod pa zhig yod na yang /
analyzed: mtshan gyi gzhi yod pa dang med pa la mi rtsod par mtshan nyid la rtsod pa zhig yod na yang /
translated: If there is a dispute about the definition, not about whether the basis of the definition exists or does not exist,

original: pha logs smra ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu mi sgrub par mtshan nyid ji ltar 'dod pa dang / de 'dra bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan gang dang / nor ba'i gtan tshigs dang bcas pas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: pha logs smra ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu mi sgrub par mtshan nyid ji ltar 'dod pa dang / de 'dra bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan gang dang / nor ba'i gtan tshigs dang bcas pas bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should not establish it only as not having the definition of the opponent, but one should teach it by means of a reason that includes whatever is accepted as the definition, whatever else has that appearance, and whatever mistaken reason there is.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bdag med pa bstan par bya na /
analyzed: bdag med pa bstan par bya na /
translated: If one is to teach selflessness,

original: yong ni phung po lnga las logs shig na bdag ces bya ba med mod kyi thog ma med pa nas bdag tu rtog pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa nyon mongs pa'i yid ces bya bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas chos thams cad kyi sa🔽bon chang ba dngos por snang ngo cog gi rgyu 'byin pa de la bdag tu brtags nas de nyid yul @181b la mi gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yong ni phung po lnga las logs shig na bdag ces bya ba med mod kyi thog ma med pa nas bdag tu rtog pa'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa nyon mongs pa'i yid ces bya bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas chos thams cad kyi sa bon chang ba dngos por snang ngo cog gi rgyu 'byin pa de la bdag tu brtags nas de nyid yul @181b la mi gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: The self does not exist separately from the five aggregates. However, the so-called afflicted mentality, which is generated by the habitual propensities of the conception of a self since beginningless time, conceives the so-called foundation consciousness, which is the seed of all phenomena, to be a self.🔽It conceives that which is the cause of all things that appear to be real to be a self.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par ma rtogs nas bdag ces bya ba rtag pa khyab pa gcig pu zhig yod par 'dod pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par ma rtogs nas bdag ces bya ba rtag pa khyab pa gcig pu zhig yod par 'dod pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is this that is called the self, and so on.

original: 'jig rten pha rol dang las kyi 'bras bu yod pa bstan na yod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dang las kyi 'bras bu yod pa bstan na yod kyi /
translated: If one teaches the existence of other worlds and the effects of karma,

original: de dag med na 'jig rten 'di yod par yang mi 'gyur las byed pa yang mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag med na 'jig rten 'di yod par yang mi 'gyur las byed pa yang mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: then this world will exist. But if they do not exist, then this world will not exist, and the performance of karma will not occur.

original: tshe snga ma rmi dran phyi ma mi shes pa dang / skyid sdug 'phral du myong ba las gang gi rgyu las byung ba mi dmigs pa ni sgrib pas bsgribs pas lan no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshe snga ma rmi dran phyi ma mi shes pa dang / skyid sdug 'phral du myong ba las gang gi rgyu las byung ba mi dmigs pa ni sgrib pas bsgribs pas lan no zhes bya ste /
translated: The reason that one does not remember one's former lives and does not know one's future lives, and that one experiences pleasure and pain immediately without seeing their causes, is that one is obscured by obscurations.

original: sgrib pa'i rnam pa gang la rigs pas sgrib par byed pa bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i rnam pa gang la rigs pas sgrib par byed pa bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The obscurations are taught to be the obscurations of reasoning, etc.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la skad cig mar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams la skad cig mar mi 'dod de /
translated: One does not accept that compounded phenomena are momentary.

original: rtag go zhes smra ba la yang chos de dag rtag pa zhig yin na ni gzhig tu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rtag go zhes smra ba la yang chos de dag rtag pa zhig yin na ni gzhig tu yang mi rung ste /
translated: If one says that they are permanent, then it is not possible for them to be destroyed,

original: 'jig par yang mi dmigs pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'jig par yang mi dmigs pa'i rigs na /
translated: because it is not observed that they are destroyed.

original: zhig bar dmigs pa las ni mi rtag par yang mngon te /
analyzed: zhig bar dmigs pa las ni mi rtag par yang mngon te /
translated: But since they are observed to be destroyed, they are clearly impermanent.

original: so so'i skye bos ni rgyang bsrings na me 'bar ba 'am chu 'bab pa'i rgyun la yang rtag par mthong ba dang 'dra bar phyin ci log bzhi la goms pas bsgribs pa'i dbang gis 'dra ba'i rgyun la rtag pa lta bur nor bas mthong du zad do zhes
analyzed: so so'i skye bos ni rgyang bsrings na me 'bar ba 'am chu 'bab pa'i rgyun la yang rtag par mthong ba dang 'dra bar phyin ci log bzhi la goms pas bsgribs pa'i dbang gis 'dra ba'i rgyun la rtag pa lta bur nor bas mthong du zad do zhes
translated: Ordinary beings, like those who see a burning fire or a flowing river as permanent when they are at a distance, see only what is obscured by their habituation to the four errors. They mistakenly think that the continuity of things is like permanence.

original: bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above statement.

original: de rnams gang la yang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar zhing ci rigs su bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams gang la yang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar zhing ci rigs su bstan to //
translated: All of these are taught in accordance with the characteristics of valid knowledge, as appropriate.

original: smras pa / zhes bya ba khong du gzhug pa de dag / a'a tsarya aa sam gas smra ba'i rgyan rnam pa lngar bstan pa lta bu'i tshul gyis tshig tu brjod cing bstan pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / zhes bya ba khong du gzhug pa de dag / a'a tsarya aa sam gas smra ba'i rgyan rnam pa lngar bstan pa lta bu'i tshul gyis tshig tu brjod cing bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “This is how it is” is expressed and taught in words in the manner of the five ornaments of speech taught by Ācārya Asaṅga.

original: smra ba'i rgyan gang zhe na /
analyzed: smra ba'i rgyan gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ornaments of speech?

original: rnam pa lngar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar shes par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as fivefold:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi gtsug lag shes pa dang / tshig 'bru dang ldan pa dang / 'jigs pa dang brtan pa dang des pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi gtsug lag shes pa dang / tshig 'bru dang ldan pa dang / 'jigs pa dang brtan pa dang des pa'o //
translated: knowing one’s own and others’ scriptures, having eloquence, being fearless, and being steady and gentle.

original: don zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa la sogs pa gsum po de dag gi don to //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa la sogs pa gsum po de dag gi don to //
translated: The “object” is the object of those three, the thesis, etc.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod de rigs pa'i gtan tshigs du mas nan tan du bsgrubs bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod de rigs pa'i gtan tshigs du mas nan tan du bsgrubs bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: “Proof” is the repeated establishment of the thesis by many reasons as one wishes.

original: yang dag par shes par bya ba ni pha logs go bar bya ba yang ji ltar ma log pa yang dag pa'i don nyid go bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shes par bya ba ni pha logs go bar bya ba yang ji ltar ma log pa yang dag pa'i don nyid go bar bya'o //
translated: “Correct knowledge” is the understanding of the object as it is, without error.

original: de'i rgyur gyur ba dang / rkyen du gyur pa ni gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur ba dang / rkyen du gyur pa ni gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The “cause” and “condition” of that is called “the knowledge of the proof by means of reasons.”

original: de yang mtshan nyid @182a * //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid @182a * //
translated: That is also characterized as follows:

original: rdzogs pa'i tshad mas gang la gang rigs pa'i yul la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i tshad mas gang la gang rigs pa'i yul la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sgrub pa'o //
translated: The proof of the object as one wishes by means of the valid cognition that has the complete characteristics.

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That knowledge of the proof by means of reasons is also of two kinds:

original: yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
translated: pure and impure.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
translated: Among them, the pure characteristics are five.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdun no //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdun no //
translated: The impure characteristics are seven.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five characteristics of complete purification?

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la phab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The characteristic of the direct perception of that, the characteristic of the direct perception of the one who abides in that, the characteristic of the application of an example of one's own class, the characteristic of complete purification, and the characteristic of the teaching of the establishment of the pure scripture.

original: 'di ni tshad ma yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the distinction between the complete purification and the non-purification of valid cognition.

original: gtan tshigs zhib tu ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs zhib tu ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The details of the reasons will be presented below.

original: 'jig rten na sems can gyi don byed ces zer ba dang rang gi mthu sems pa dag dam bcas shing ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sems can gyi don byed ces zer ba dang rang gi mthu sems pa dag dam bcas shing ston te /
translated: In the world, those who claim to benefit sentient beings and those who think of their own power make promises and teach.

original: smra ba'i don 'grub pa dang yang dag par shes par byed 'dod pa yang mngan /
analyzed: smra ba'i don 'grub pa dang yang dag par shes par byed 'dod pa yang mngan /
translated: They also desire to accomplish the meaning of speech and to make it known.

original: de kun gyis bsam pa bzhin du 'grub ba ma zhes bya na /
analyzed: de kun gyis bsam pa bzhin du 'grub ba ma zhes bya na /
translated: If it is said that all of that is not accomplished as intended,

original: de ltar gcig tu nges pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar gcig tu nges pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no certainty as to one or the other.

original: 'grub pa yang yod mi 'grub ba yang yod do //
analyzed: 'grub pa yang yod mi 'grub ba yang yod do //
translated: There is success and there is failure.

original: de ci las gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci las gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa de'i rgyu dang rkyen du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa las gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis sgrub pa de'i rgyu dang rkyen du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa las gyur te /
translated: It is due to the purity or impurity of the logical proof, which is characterized by the cause and condition of that.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni don ma log par rtogs te 'grub par rung /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni don ma log par rtogs te 'grub par rung /
translated: A logical proof that possesses the characteristic of purity causes one to understand the meaning without error and so it is suitable for success.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni don la log par 'dzin te 'grub tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni don la log par 'dzin te 'grub tu mi rung ngo //
translated: A logical proof that possesses the characteristic of impurity causes one to grasp the meaning in error and so it is not suitable for success.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bye brag shes pa ni bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bye brag shes pa ni bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog ste /
translated: Therefore, one who knows the good qualities of the characteristics and the distinctions, abides in the correct view and establishes others in the correct view.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu mi ltung bar shes bzhin du spyod do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu mi ltung bar shes bzhin du spyod do //
translated: One practices with introspection, not falling into the hands of sinful friends.

original: mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bye brag mi shes pa ni bdag kyang log par lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang log par lta ba la 'jog ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bye brag mi shes pa ni bdag kyang log par lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang log par lta ba la 'jog ste /
translated: Not knowing the general and specific characteristics, one dwells in false views oneself and establishes others in false views.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan kyang mi go bar mos bzhin du spyod do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan kyang mi go bar mos bzhin du spyod do //
translated: Even though taught by a spiritual teacher, one does not understand and practices with a biased mind.

original: gtan tshigs @182b sgrub pa yan lag gi le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: gtan tshigs @182b sgrub pa yan lag gi le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter, on the proof of the reason.

original: // / mngon sum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: // / mngon sum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The definition of direct perception is as follows:

original: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du gang 'jig rten mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du gang 'jig rten mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: It is said, Whatever is directly perceived in the world as impermanent, suffering, and selfless is the definition of direct perception.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sgrib bdag gis ma bsgribs pas yul la mngon du dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sgrib bdag gis ma bsgribs pas yul la mngon du dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Direct perception is the unobscured direct observation of an object by consciousness produced by the four conditions.

original: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas dus gcig spyod yul gcig tu da ltar byung ba'i yul thad kar bab pa la dmigs nas /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas dus gcig spyod yul gcig tu da ltar byung ba'i yul thad kar bab pa la dmigs nas /
translated: The five present consciousnesses and the mental consciousness induced by them focus on the present object that directly appears in a single domain.

original: yul de so so'i rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul de so so'i rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The individual self-awareness of that object is called the definition of direct perception.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis chos kyi khams la dmigs pa'ang chos la dmigs pa'i mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis chos kyi khams la dmigs pa'ang chos la dmigs pa'i mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, the mental consciousness alone that focuses on the phenomena element is called direct perception that focuses on phenomena.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas te yul so sor nges pa la 'jug pa gcig dang mnyam du 'jug gam lnga char dang mnyam du 'jug ce na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas te yul so sor nges pa la 'jug pa gcig dang mnyam du 'jug gam lnga char dang mnyam du 'jug ce na /
translated: Do the eye consciousness and so on and the mental consciousness engage their specific objects either individually or simultaneously?

original: yod ni gang dang yang mnyam du 'jug mod kyi dus gcig tu 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga po las yul gyi rkyen gyi mthu 'am yid la byed pa'i mthu gang che bas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis mnyam du 'jug ste /
analyzed: yod ni gang dang yang mnyam du 'jug mod kyi dus gcig tu 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga po las yul gyi rkyen gyi mthu 'am yid la byed pa'i mthu gang che bas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis mnyam du 'jug ste /
translated: Two mental consciousnesses occur simultaneously with the five sense consciousnesses when the power of the object condition or the power of attention is strong.

original: lnga char dang dus gcig tu mi 'jug go //
analyzed: lnga char dang dus gcig tu mi 'jug go //
translated: But all five do not occur simultaneously.

original: lhag ma rnams dang yang rim gyis mnyam du 'jug ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang yang rim gyis mnyam du 'jug ste /
translated: The remaining mental consciousnesses occur in sequence.

original: mgal me bskor ba la gdu bur snang ba bzhin du mgyogs pas dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa kun dang dus gcig tu so so'i yul la 'jug pa 'dra bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: mgal me bskor ba la gdu bur snang ba bzhin du mgyogs pas dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa kun dang dus gcig tu so so'i yul la 'jug pa 'dra bar yang snang ngo //
translated: Just as a firebrand appears as a circle, so too the mental consciousness appears to engage its object simultaneously with all the sense consciousnesses because of its speed.

original: rkyen bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen bzhi'i tshul chos mngon pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: rkyen bzhis bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen bzhi'i tshul chos mngon pa las 'byung ba /
translated: The Abhidharma states that consciousness is generated by four conditions.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen bzhi ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen bzhi ste /
translated: There are four conditions of eye consciousness.

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: 1. the causal condition, 2. the immediately preceding condition, 3. the object as condition, 4. the dominant condition.

original: rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the causal condition?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the co-existent and the dominant.

original: @183a * // de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: @183a * // de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the immediately preceding condition?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang rnams kyi 'og tu bar chad med par mig gi rnam par shes pa de de ma thag tu skyes pa 'am skye ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang rnams kyi 'og tu bar chad med par mig gi rnam par shes pa de de ma thag tu skyes pa 'am skye ba'o //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities that have just ceased immediately before the eye-consciousness.

original: de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object as condition?🔽It is visible form.

original: gzugs so // de'i bdag po'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs so // de'i bdag po'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dominant condition?

original: bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: It is all the dharmas, except the effect itself.🔽As is the case with the eye-consciousness, so is the case with the ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousnesses.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: As is the case with the eye-consciousness, so is the case with the mind-consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshul ni yang mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i de la yangs pa'i blo gros len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshul ni yang mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i de la yangs pa'i blo gros len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'di lta ste /
translated: “O Viśālamati, the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on and based on the appropriating consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the eye consciousness, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten cing mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten cing mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus gcig la spyod yul mthun pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus gcig la spyod yul mthun pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: At the same time, the conceptual mind consciousness that accompanies the eye consciousness and has the same object arises.

original: de la yangs pa'i blo gros rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang sna dang lce dang / rnam par shes ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang reg bya rnams la brten cing lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yangs pa'i blo gros rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang sna dang lce dang / rnam par shes ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang reg bya rnams la brten cing lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The mind of extensive thought is the mental consciousness that arises in dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, as well as the body, which is the basis of the body consciousness, and tangible objects.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dus gcig pa spyod yul mthun pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dus gcig pa spyod yul mthun pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The mental consciousness that is simultaneous with the body consciousness and has the same object is the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa cig thang cig byung na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa cig thang cig byung na /
translated: If the eye consciousness arises for a moment,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mthun pa cig kyang thang cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mthun pa cig kyang thang cig 'byung ngo //
translated: then the conceptual mental consciousness that has the same object as the eye consciousness also arises for that moment.

original: gal te thang cig tu gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te thang cig tu gnyis sam /
translated: If two or three arise in one moment,

original: gsum mam / bzhi 'am rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams thad cig 'byung bar 'gyur na yang rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang spyod yul mthun ba cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum mam / bzhi 'am rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams thad cig 'byung bar 'gyur na yang rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang spyod yul mthun ba cig 'byung ngo //
translated: When three, four, or the five collections of consciousness arise simultaneously, a conceptual mental consciousness arises in association with the five collections of consciousness.🔽O Viśālamati, when the conditions for the arising of a single wave in a great river current are present, a single wave arises. When the conditions for the arising of many waves are present, many waves arise.

original: 'di lta ste yangs pa'i blo gros chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la rlabs gcig 'byung ba nas mang por 'byung ba'i rkyen nye @183b bar gnas na mang por 'byung ba dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste yangs pa'i blo gros chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la rlabs gcig 'byung ba nas mang por 'byung ba'i rkyen nye @183b bar gnas na mang por 'byung ba dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba nas /
translated: When the conditions for the arising of a single reflection in a round mirror are present, a single reflection arises.

original: gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan mang po 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas na /
translated: When the conditions for the arising of many reflections are present, many reflections arise.

original: mang po yang 'byung mod kyi chu'i rgyun kyang mi 'chad /
analyzed: mang po yang 'byung mod kyi chu'i rgyun kyang mi 'chad /
translated: However, the flow of the river is not interrupted.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yang ma yin /
translated: The round mirror does not become the nature of a reflection.

original: yongs su zad par yang mi mngon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su zad par yang mi mngon zhes gsungs so //
translated: It does not appear to be completely exhausted.

original: mdo 'di las len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya'o //🔽dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i yangs pa'i blo gros kyi le'u las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten cing rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye bar gsungs pa'i don 'di ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di las len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya'o // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i yangs pa'i blo gros kyi le'u las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten cing rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye bar gsungs pa'i don 'di ni /
translated: The term “appropriating consciousness” in this sūtra refers to the foundation consciousness.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang bshad de /
translated: The meaning of the statement in the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention in the chapter of Bodhisattva Vairocanaprajñā that the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the foundation consciousness is explained in the Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra.🔽There it says:

original: de la gsungs pa'i blo gros chen po mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu bzhi dag gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la gsungs pa'i blo gros chen po mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu bzhi dag gis 'byung ngo //
translated: “Mahāmati, the eye consciousness arises from four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: rang gi sems snang ba 'dzin pa la khong du ma chud pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi gzugs kyi bag chags la mngon par zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba 'dzin pa la khong du ma chud pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi gzugs kyi bag chags la mngon par zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: not understanding the apprehension of the appearances of one’s own mind, adhering to the latent tendencies of the form of the bad habit of mental proliferation since beginningless time, the nature of consciousness itself,🔽and the power of the immediately preceding condition.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: They are amazed at the characteristics of the various forms.

original: blo gros chen po rgyu bzhi po 'di dag gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chu klung lta bu las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rlabs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rgyu bzhi po 'di dag gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chu klung lta bu las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rlabs 'byung ngo //
translated: Mahāmati, these four causes give rise to the waves of eye consciousness from the river of the foundation consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang spu'i khung bu rnams la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang spu'i khung bu rnams la yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as with eye consciousness, so it is with all the sense faculties and the pores of the body.

original: me long la gcig dang rim gyis yul gyi gzugs snang ba dang / rgya mtsho la rlung gis btab pa bzhin du yul gyi rlung dang / sems kyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs rgyu'i bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba las dang rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: me long la gcig dang rim gyis yul gyi gzugs snang ba dang / rgya mtsho la rlung gis btab pa bzhin du yul gyi rlung dang / sems kyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs rgyu'i bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba las dang rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Like reflections appearing in a mirror, either all at once or in sequence, and like the waves in the ocean whipped up by the wind, the waves of the ocean of mind, characterized by the uninterrupted activity of the causes, are the same and yet different, and they are free from being identical or distinct.

original: shin tu 'brel ba'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid khong du mi chud pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug go //
analyzed: shin tu 'brel ba'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid khong du mi chud pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug go //
translated: The five collections of consciousness do not understand the nature of the very close relationship.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag dad lhan cig tu rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su chud par byed pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes @184a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag dad lhan cig tu rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su chud par byed pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes @184a * //
translated: The five collections of consciousness, together with the mental consciousness, which has the characteristic of distinguishing the specific causes and objects, are said to be fully engaged.

original: pa de dag gi rgyu las byung ba'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: pa de dag gi rgyu las byung ba'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: The mental consciousness arises from them as its cause, and it engages in the specific objects of the five collections of consciousness.🔽They and it are mutually causal, but they do not think, “We are engaged together, clinging to the conceptual thoughts that appear to our own minds.”

original: de dag dang de'ang bdag ni lhan cig tu phan tshun rgyur gyur cing rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas zhugs pa'o snyam du mi sems te 'on kyang phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du lhan cig tu ma rig🔽pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag dang de'ang bdag ni lhan cig tu phan tshun rgyur gyur cing rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas zhugs pa'o snyam du mi sems te 'on kyang phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du lhan cig tu ma rig🔽pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Rather, they engage in distinguishing the objects of ignorance, together, with the characteristic of being mutually inseparable.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bzhi 'byung ba ni dngos po rnams kyi rgyu gtan la phab par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bzhi 'byung ba ni dngos po rnams kyi rgyu gtan la phab par bstan pa'o //
translated: The four conditions of the eye consciousness, etc., as they occur in the noble Laṅkâvatāra Sūtra, are taught to determine the cause of things.

original: de la rang gi snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa ni dmigs pa'o zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de la rang gi snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa ni dmigs pa'o zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: There, the non-understanding of the grasping of one’s own appearance is said to be the objective support.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, form, etc., are the objective condition.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa gnas ngan len gyi gzugs kyi bag chags la mngon par zhen pa ni rkyen to zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa gnas ngan len gyi gzugs kyi bag chags la mngon par zhen pa ni rkyen to zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: The addiction to the latent potentialities of the form of the negative reflex actions of verbal proliferation since beginningless time is said to be the condition.

original: mig la sogs pa bdag po'i rkyen la bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bdag po'i rkyen la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye, etc., are the dominant condition.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis bar du mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rkyen gzhan gyis bar du mchod pa yin te /
translated: The nature of consciousness is the condition of mind and the mental factors, which are not separated from the other conditions.

original: 'di ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: This is the condition as the antecedent.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ni lhan cig tu 'byung ba dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ni lhan cig tu 'byung ba dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: The various forms are the co-existent and associated dharmas.

original: 'di ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: This is the causal condition.

original: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rkyen bzhi yang gong du smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rkyen bzhi yang gong du smos pa bzhin no //
translated: As with the eye, the other four conditions for the other consciousnesses are as mentioned above.

original: de'i nang nas gzugs zhes 'byung ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa so so'i rkyen bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang rig dang chos zhes gang la gang rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i nang nas gzugs zhes 'byung ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa so so'i rkyen bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang rig dang chos zhes gang la gang rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Among them, the words “form” should be applied to each consciousness as appropriate, as in “sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.”🔽All the atoms of the sense faculties and the pores of the skin are also like this.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang spu'i khung bu rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po go snyod kyi me tog 'dra ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang spu'i khung bu rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po go snyod kyi me tog 'dra ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The eye faculty is like a jasmine flower, and so on up to🔽the body faculty is like armor.

original: lus kyi dbang po khrab 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs dang ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po khrab 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs dang ba rnams yin te /
translated: These are the clear forms.

original: de dag gi rdul phra rab dang / spu'i khung bu nas rnam par shes pa skye ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rdul phra rab dang / spu'i khung bu nas rnam par shes pa skye ba la bya'o //
translated: The atoms and pores of the body are the sources of the consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba ni me long dang chu'i dpe dang 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba ni me long dang chu'i dpe dang 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The arising of the consciousnesses from the store consciousness is like the examples of the mirror and the water.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gcig pa dang @184b tha dad pa ma yin par 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdul phra mo'i dpes bstan pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gcig pa dang @184b tha dad pa ma yin par 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdul phra mo'i dpes bstan pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The phrase “free from identity and difference” means that the active consciousnesses and the store consciousness are neither identical nor different, as is shown by the example of the lump of clay and the particles of clay.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ni yul la 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ni yul la 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of karma is the grasping of objects.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the species is the consciousness.

original: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba yang 'di dag 'brel pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba yang 'di dag 'brel pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of their connection” means that they are connected.

original: ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang /
translated: What is meant by “the comprehension of their nature”?

original: la mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: la mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not reasonable.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga zhes bya ba ni mig nas lus kyi bar gyi rnam par shes pa lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga zhes bya ba ni mig nas lus kyi bar gyi rnam par shes pa lnga la bya'o //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are the five consciousnesses from the eye consciousness to the body consciousness.🔽The understanding of the characteristics of the differentiation of causes and objects is called the understanding of the six causes.

original: rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa zhes bya ba las rgyu ni byed pa'i rgyu la sogs ba drug go //
analyzed: rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa zhes bya ba las rgyu ni byed pa'i rgyu la sogs ba drug go //
translated: The six causes are the efficient cause and so on.

original: de dag gi bye brag yid kyi rnam par shes pas khong du chud par nus pas na khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag yid kyi rnam par shes pas khong du chud par nus pas na khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The differentiation of those is able to be understood by the mental consciousness, and therefore it is called the understanding of the differentiation.

original: de dag gi rgyu las byung ba'i bdag nyid 'jug ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga nyon mongs pa'i yid du gyur pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu las byung ba'i bdag nyid 'jug ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga nyon mongs pa'i yid du gyur pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The arising of the five consciousnesses from the afflicted mind is called the arising of the five consciousnesses from the cause of the afflicted mind.🔽The five consciousnesses and the afflicted mind do not think of each other as co-existent causes and so on.

original: de dag dang de'ang bdag cag lhan cig rgyur gyur pa la sogs par mi sems pa ni dngos po thams cad sems tsam du ni ma rig pa dang / rnam par shes pa lngas rgud pa'i rkyen byas te /
analyzed: de dag dang de'ang bdag cag lhan cig rgyur gyur pa la sogs par mi sems pa ni dngos po thams cad sems tsam du ni ma rig pa dang / rnam par shes pa lngas rgud pa'i rkyen byas te /
translated: All things are mind only, but due to ignorance and the five consciousnesses acting as conditions for decline,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi myong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi myong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
translated: The arising of the mental consciousness and the experience of other consciousnesses are the mental consciousness that increases the latent impressions in the foundation consciousness.

original: bag chags kyis rgyas par byas shing rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba lta bur rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyur gcig par khong du mi chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis rgyas par byas shing rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba lta bur rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyur gcig par khong du mi chud pa la bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “one consciousness does not understand the cause of another” is that one consciousness does not understand the cause of another.🔽However, they engage in the characteristic of nondifference.

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag yul la mnyam du zhugs pa na shes pa gnyis kas kyang yul mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin🔽du tha mi dad par dmigs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag yul la mnyam du zhugs pa na shes pa gnyis kas kyang yul mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tha mi dad par dmigs pa la bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “when those five consciousnesses and mental consciousness engage in an object equally, both consciousnesses apprehend the object without difference in its characteristics” is that they apprehend the object without difference in its characteristics.

original: sgrib pas ma bsgribs zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pas ma bsgribs zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the obscurations in the phrase “not obscured by obscuration”?

original: 'phags pa phung po gsum pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa phung po gsum pa las 'byung ba /
translated: The noble Three Baskets states:

original: las kyi sgrib pa 'am chos kyi sgrib pa'am nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa 'am chos kyi sgrib pa'am nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of karma, the obscurations of the Dharma, the obscurations of the afflictions,

original: lta ba'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: lta ba'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of views,

original: mi shes pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of ignorance,

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of karmic ripening,

original: chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i sgrib pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i sgrib pa'am /
translated: the obscurations of being bereft of the Dharma,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas,

original: theg pa chen po la sun 'byin pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la sun 'byin pa'i sgrib pa 'am /
translated: the obscurations of disparaging the Great Vehicle,

original: @185a * // sdig pa'i grogs pos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'am /
analyzed: @185a * // sdig pa'i grogs pos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'am /
translated: the obscurations of afflicted negative companionship,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sgrib pa dang chod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sgrib pa dang chod pa ste /
translated: and the obscurations and hindrances to perfecting the aspirations of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra’s conduct.

original: sgrib pa'i las byas shing bsags pa gang gis bsgribs shing kun nas langs nas sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i las byas shing bsags pa gang gis bsgribs shing kun nas langs nas sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: “The karmic obscurations that I have created and accumulated have obscured and agitated me, causing me to go to the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to go to the animal realm,

original: lha dbul por 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: lha dbul por 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to become a poor god,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lta ba yongs su mi 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lta ba yongs su mi 'dzin pa'am /
translated: not to uphold the view of the Buddha,

original: chos nyan pa yongs su mi len pa'am /
analyzed: chos nyan pa yongs su mi len pa'am /
translated: not to receive the teachings,
