original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rin po che mi shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rin po che mi shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: not to understand the precious Dharma of the Tathāgata,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang grogs po mi 'thob bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang grogs po mi 'thob bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: not to obtain a friend who is a bodhisattva,

original: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba mi 'thob pa 'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba mi 'thob pa 'am /
translated: not to be accepted by a true spiritual friend,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung za ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung za ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to be accepted by those who have little in the way of wholesome roots,

original: byang chub kyi sems stor bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems stor bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to lose the thought of awakening,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam mi nyan pa 'am /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam mi nyan pa 'am /
translated: not to listen to the path of the perfections,

original: bdud sdig to can dag gis mnar bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can dag gis mnar bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to be tormented by wicked Māra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ring du byed pa 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ring du byed pa 'am /
translated: to be far from the Dharma of the Buddha,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsom pa'i sbyor ba thams cad las ldog pa 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsom pa'i sbyor ba thams cad las ldog pa 'am /
translated: to turn away from all the practices that give rise to wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la 'khu bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la 'khu bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: to betray a spiritual friend,

original: brtsam pa yongs su dag pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: brtsam pa yongs su dag pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: and not to understand the purity of one’s actions.

original: dran pa mi nyams pa 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: dran pa mi nyams pa 'thob pa'am /
translated: to attain undiminished mindfulness,

original: chos lta ba khong du mi chud pa 'am /
analyzed: chos lta ba khong du mi chud pa 'am /
translated: to not understand the view of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa la mi mos pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa la mi mos pa'am /
translated: to not be inspired by the Buddha’s emanations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la som nyi za 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la som nyi za 'am /
translated: to have doubts about the Buddha’s teachings,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo khong du mi chud pa 'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo khong du mi chud pa 'am /
translated: to not understand the door of samādhi,

original: sa nas sar gnas pa mi 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: sa nas sar gnas pa mi 'thob pa'am /
translated: to not attain the stages of the bhūmis,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs pa mi 'thob pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs pa mi 'thob pa 'am /
translated: to not attain companionship with bodhisattvas,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bskang ba dang byas pa bsrung ba khong du mi chud pa 'am /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bskang ba dang byas pa bsrung ba khong du mi chud pa 'am /
translated: to not understand the fulfillment of the perfections and the protection of what has been done,

original: smon lam chen po las nur ba 'am /
analyzed: smon lam chen po las nur ba 'am /
translated: to turn away from the great aspirations,

original: spyod pa yongs su dag pa khong du mi chud pa'am /
analyzed: spyod pa yongs su dag pa khong du mi chud pa'am /
translated: to not understand the completely pure conduct,

original: gzungs kyi rgyan gyi snang ba mi 'thob par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gzungs kyi rgyan gyi snang ba mi 'thob par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: or to not attain the illumination of the adornment of dhāraṇī.

original: spobs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba khong du mi chud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam 'dris par bya ba khong du mi chud pa dang / chos mnyam pa nyid mi rtogs @185b pa dang / bsod nams mnyam pa nyid mi bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: spobs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba khong du mi chud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam 'dris par bya ba khong du mi chud pa dang / chos mnyam pa nyid mi rtogs @185b pa dang / bsod nams mnyam pa nyid mi bskyed pa dang /
translated: It is not to understand the light of the ornament of eloquence, it is not to understand the prayer to be familiar with the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, it is not to realize the sameness of phenomena, it is not to generate the sameness of merit,

original: ye shes mnyam pa nyid khong du mi chud pa dang / 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyis kun du gzhom bar 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes mnyam pa nyid khong du mi chud pa dang / 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyis kun du gzhom bar 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: it is not to understand the sameness of wisdom, and it is to be overcome by the phenomena of samsara.

original: grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang yon tan gyi chos dang / nan tan thams cad la kun du rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur pa'i 'gebs pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang yon tan gyi chos dang / nan tan thams cad la kun du rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur pa'i 'gebs pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: These and so forth are the obscurations that are the turning away from the bodhisattva conduct, qualities, and all practices for the ten hundred thousand countless eons.

original: las kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba nas sdig pa'i grogs pos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa bcur gsungs pa ni sgrib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba nas sdig pa'i grogs pos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa bcur gsungs pa ni sgrib par byed pa'o //
translated: The ten kinds of obscurations, from the obscuration called “action” up to the obscuration called “afflictive emotion due to evil companions, ” are the obscurations.

original: de dag gis bsgrib par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis bsgrib par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that is obscured by them?

original: mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The brief teaching is:

original: kun du bzang po'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sgrib pa dang / chod pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de la yang bye brag tu bstan pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sgrib pa dang / chod pa zhes gsungs pa yin no // de la yang bye brag tu bstan pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: “The obscurations to the fulfillment of the universal good’s vow, and the interruptions. ”🔽The detailed explanation is:

original: 'khor ba'i chos kyis kun gzhom par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs par gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos kyis kun gzhom par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sum cu rtsa gsum la sogs par gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: “The thirty-three, beginning with the one who goes to the hells, up to the one who is overcome by the phenomena of cyclic existence. ”

original: sgrib pa de dag gis ma bsgribs pa'i mngon sum de'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa de dag gis ma bsgribs pa'i mngon sum de'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The direct intuition that is not obscured by those obscurations is also threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i mngon sum dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mngon sum dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mngon sum dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mngon sum dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: the direct intuition that is imagined, the direct intuition that is dependent, and the direct intuition that is perfected.

original: de la sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang sa sha stag la sogs te /
analyzed: de la sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang sa sha stag la sogs te /
translated: In this regard, the illusory person, the earth, and so on,🔽

original: ji ltar bsgoms pa bzhin du dmigs pa ni kun brtags pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgoms pa bzhin du dmigs pa ni kun brtags pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: The direct perception of the imagined is the observation of the object of meditation, such as a magical person or a mere lump of clay, just as it is meditated upon.

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po'i tshul bzhin dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mngon sum mo //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po'i tshul bzhin dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mngon sum mo //
translated: The direct perception of the dependent is the observation of the mode of being of the object, such as the impermanence of all compounded things.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa bden pa bcu lta bur dmigs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa bden pa bcu lta bur dmigs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: The direct perception of the perfected is the observation of reality, such as the ten principles of the path of insight.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang gnyis su dmigs te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang gnyis su dmigs te /
translated: Among these, the mundane direct perception is the observation of the two, the imagined and the dependent.🔽The supramundane direct perception is the observation of the perfected.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa la sogs par dmigs /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa la sogs par dmigs /
translated: The supramundane direct perception is the observation of the perfected.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad kyi 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba rgyun du skye ba la phyi ma skyes nas snga ma 'gags par dmigs pa dang / 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i bya ba phyi ma byed cing snga ma gtong bar @186a * //🔽dmigs pa de dag so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad kyi 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba rgyun du skye ba la phyi ma skyes nas snga ma 'gags par dmigs pa dang / 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i bya ba phyi ma byed cing snga ma gtong bar @186a * // dmigs pa de dag so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of direct perception is the individual intuitive knowledge of the continuity of the arising of the similar and dissimilar aspects of all conditioned things, the observation that the later ones arise and the earlier ones cease, and the observation that the later ones perform the similar and dissimilar actions and abandon the earlier ones.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bstal  bar dmigs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa nyams kyis tshor te so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bstal  bar dmigs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa nyams kyis tshor te so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of direct perception is the individual intuitive knowledge of the observation that all conditioned things are suffering, the intuitive knowledge of the harm of birth, etc.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa la phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid las gzhan du gyur pa bdag gi mtshan nyid ma dmigs par so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa la phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid las gzhan du gyur pa bdag gi mtshan nyid ma dmigs par so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of direct perception is the individual intuitive knowledge of the observation that all things are selfless, the non-observation of the characteristic of a self that is different from the characteristics of the five aggregates.

original: kun brtags pa sgyu ma la sogs par dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa sgyu ma la sogs par dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the observation of the imagined, such as an illusion?

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhig mthong na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhig mthong na /
translated: When one sees an illusory person,

original: skyes bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang / mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pas dung ser por dmigs pa dang / rab rib can gyis zla ba tshes pa la gnyis su mthong ba dang / rna nad kyis btab pas rlung dang chu dpa'i sgra rtag tu thos pa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang / mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pas dung ser por dmigs pa dang / rab rib can gyis zla ba tshes pa la gnyis su mthong ba dang / rna nad kyis btab pas rlung dang chu dpa'i sgra rtag tu thos pa dang /
translated: The direct perception of the body is the perception of the specific characteristics of objects, such as touch, by the body faculty.

original: 'di lta bu dag ni so so rang gis rig pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //🔽rnal 'byor pa la sogs pas bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag ni so so rang gis rig pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do // rnal 'byor pa la sogs pas bsgoms te /
translated: The direct perception of the mind is the perception of the specific characteristics of objects, such as phenomena, by the mind faculty.🔽The direct perception of the eye is the perception of objects as they are, such as the color blue, by the eye faculty.🔽The direct perception of the ear is the perception of objects as they are, such as sound, by the ear faculty.🔽The direct perception of the nose is the perception of objects as they are, such as smell, by the nose faculty.🔽The direct perception of the tongue is the perception of objects as they are, such as taste, by the tongue faculty.

original: keng rus la sogs par mthong ba dang / sa sha stag la sogs par mthong ba dang / bdag mthe bo tsam du mthong ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs par dmigs pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /🔽mngon sum gyi tshad mar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: keng rus la sogs par mthong ba dang / sa sha stag la sogs par mthong ba dang / bdag mthe bo tsam du mthong ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs par dmigs pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te / mngon sum gyi tshad mar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The direct perception of the body is the perception of objects as they are, such as touch, by the body faculty.🔽The direct perception of the mind is the perception of objects as they are, such as phenomena, by the mind faculty.🔽The direct perception of the eye is the perception of objects as they are, such as the color blue, by the eye faculty.🔽The direct perception of the ear is the perception of objects as they are, such as sound, by the ear faculty.

original: mngon sum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: mngon sum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: The direct perception of the nose is the perception of objects as they are, such as smell, by the nose faculty.🔽The direct perception of the tongue is the perception of objects as they are, such as taste, by the tongue faculty.🔽The direct perception of the body is the perception of objects as they are, such as touch, by the body faculty.🔽The direct perception of the mind is the perception of objects as they are, such as phenomena, by the mind faculty.🔽The direct perception of the eye is the perception of objects as they are, such as the color blue, by the eye faculty.🔽The direct perception of the ear is the perception of objects as

original: // / rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: // / rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The characteristics of inference that is pure are as follows:🔽The impermanence of compounded phenomena is directly perceived by one who abides in the existence of the world beyond, in the non-expiration of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang 'jig rten pha rol po yod pa dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnam par chud mi za ba gang de la gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / gang sems can sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang 'jig rten pha rol po yod pa dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnam par chud mi za ba gang de la gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / gang sems can sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa dang /
translated: The diversity of sentient beings is directly perceived by one who abides in the diversity of sentient beings.

original: gang sems can bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang sems can bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The happiness and suffering of sentient beings, their virtue and nonvirtue, are directly perceived by one who abides in the happiness and suffering, virtue and nonvirtue of sentient beings.

original: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is not directly perceived is to be inferred.

original: 'di dang tshul 'di lta bu dag ni de la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dang tshul 'di lta bu dag ni de la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: These and other such things are the characteristics of the direct perception of one who abides in that.

original: @186b de la gnas pa'i mngon sum gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang rjes su dpag par bya ba de'i rang bzhin lkog na 'dug ste /
analyzed: @186b de la gnas pa'i mngon sum gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang rjes su dpag par bya ba de'i rang bzhin lkog na 'dug ste /
translated: The so-called “perception of the locus” is that when the nature of something to be inferred is hidden,

original: mngon sum gyis ma dmigs kyang de la gnas pa'i rtags sam /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma dmigs kyang de la gnas pa'i rtags sam /
translated: even though it is not perceived by perception, the inferential mark or

original: las sam / chos sam /
analyzed: las sam / chos sam /
translated: the effect or the property or

original: rgyu 'am / 'bras bu 'am /🔽de rnams kyi nang nas gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos rjes su dpags te /
analyzed: rgyu 'am / 'bras bu 'am / de rnams kyi nang nas gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos rjes su dpags te /
translated: the cause or the result

original: de'i gnas dang rang bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas dang rang bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: among those is perceived by perception, and the locus and nature are known by the mind that engages in inference.

original: la la zhig gnas dang / rang bzhin ni mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod la /
analyzed: la la zhig gnas dang / rang bzhin ni mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod la /
translated: Some say that the locus and nature are perceived by perception,

original: rtags la sogs pa de la gnas pa mngon sum gyis ma dmigs na /
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa de la gnas pa mngon sum gyis ma dmigs na /
translated: but if the inferential mark, etc., that is located there is not perceived by perception,

original: gnas dang rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpags te /
analyzed: gnas dang rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpags te /
translated: the locus and nature are inferred,🔽and the inferential mark, etc., that is located there is known.

original: rtags la sogs pa de la gnas pa shes par bya ba dang / da ltar byung ba mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod la /
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa de la gnas pa shes par bya ba dang / da ltar byung ba mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod la /
translated: The present is perceived by perception,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa shes par bya ba yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa shes par bya ba yod do //
translated: but the past and future are known.

original: rjes su dpag go cog ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag go cog ni /
translated: All inference is🔽of that which is not directly perceived, by a cognition that is in conformity with direct perception.

original: gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa la rjes su dpag cing shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa la rjes su dpag cing shes par bya'o //
translated: It is said that inference is of that which is not directly perceived.

original: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i skyes bu la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba la / gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i skyes bu la bya'o //
translated: “ That which is not directly perceived” refers to a person who is obscured.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni sgrib pas bsgribs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni sgrib pas bsgribs pa la bya'o //
translated: “ That which is not directly perceived” refers to that which is obscured by an obstruction.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni lkog na 'dug pa'i yul rtogs par 'dod cing 'jal ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni lkog na 'dug pa'i yul rtogs par 'dod cing 'jal ba la bya ste /
translated: Inference is the desire to understand and the evaluation of a hidden object.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad kyi skad cig ma nyid mi rtag par rags pa dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba la 'du byed rnams gnyen po dang bcas pa rkyen gyis 'jig pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing snga ma 'das
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad kyi skad cig ma nyid mi rtag par rags pa dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas shes par bya ba la 'du byed rnams gnyen po dang bcas pa rkyen gyis 'jig pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing snga ma 'das
translated: In this regard, the momentariness of all conditioned things is to be understood by inference of that which is directly perceived as gross impermanence. The conditioned things, together with their antidotes, are destroyed by conditions. The subsequent continuity is not the same as the previous one, which has passed away.

original: te 'gag pa 'am /
analyzed: te 'gag pa 'am /
translated: Or is it that it is not tenable that it is both?🔽

original: zla ba 'am /
analyzed: zla ba 'am /
translated: or a month,🔽or a day, or even a moment, or a second, or a single instant.

original: zhag lon la mngon par 'gyur ba la yang chu tshod dang / se gol brdabs pa tsam gyi par dus su 'gyur bar snang ba las na da bas kyang myur ba skad cig ngar  yod par dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhag lon la mngon par 'gyur ba la yang chu tshod dang / se gol brdabs pa tsam gyi par dus su 'gyur bar snang ba las na da bas kyang myur ba skad cig ngar  yod par dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The inference of the existence of a moment that is even shorter than that is the definition of inference through effect and cause.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig pa'i rgyun du gnas te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig pa'i rgyun du gnas te /
translated: The continuum of compounded phenomena endures in a series of moments.

original: tshe 'di la rgyun yod pa bzhin du tshe rabs gzhan la yang rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'jig rten pha rol kyang yod de sems can sna tshogs la gnas pa dmigs pa'i rjes su @187a * //
analyzed: tshe 'di la rgyun yod pa bzhin du tshe rabs gzhan la yang rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'jig rten pha rol kyang yod de sems can sna tshogs la gnas pa dmigs pa'i rjes su @187a * //
translated: Just as the continuum exists in this life, the continuum arises in other lives as well. Therefore, the world beyond also exists.

original: dpag pas shes par bya ba la 'jog na mi la sogs pa 'greng ste 'gro ba dang phyugs la sogs te dud de 'gro ba dang / sbrul la sogs te 'phye zhing 'gro ba dang / bya la sogs ba nam mkha' la lding ba dang /
analyzed: dpag pas shes par bya ba la 'jog na mi la sogs pa 'greng ste 'gro ba dang phyugs la sogs te dud de 'gro ba dang / sbrul la sogs te 'phye zhing 'gro ba dang / bya la sogs ba nam mkha' la lding ba dang /
translated: If it is posited that it is to be known through inference of the observation of the existence of various sentient beings, then it is like the following examples. Humans and so on move about standing, cattle and so on move about crawling, snakes and so on move about slithering, birds and so on move about flying in the sky, and fish and so on move about swimming in the water.

original: nya la sogs pa chu na 'phyo ba dang de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa rnam pa sna tshogs ma bslabs par yang shes te rtsol ba dang / la la'i gnas ci la 'cha'/
analyzed: nya la sogs pa chu na 'phyo ba dang de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa rnam pa sna tshogs ma bslabs par yang shes te rtsol ba dang / la la'i gnas ci la 'cha'/
translated: Without training, they know how to swim in the water like fish and so forth, and they know various other incompatible things.🔽What is the abode of some?

original: la la'i zas su ci za /
analyzed: la la'i zas su ci za /
translated: What is the food of some?

original: la la'i yon tan du ci yod /
analyzed: la la'i yon tan du ci yod /
translated: What are the qualities of some?

original: la la'i skyon du ci chags te /
analyzed: la la'i skyon du ci chags te /
translated: What are the faults of some?🔽They know various different behaviors and so forth.

original: sna tshogs kyi spyod pa mi 'dra ba la sogs pa dang / skam la gnas pa ni chu'i gting du 'dug par mi bzod /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi spyod pa mi 'dra ba la sogs pa dang / skam la gnas pa ni chu'i gting du 'dug par mi bzod /
translated: Those that live on land cannot endure being in the depths of the water.

original: chu la 'dug pa ni skam la gnas par mi bzod /
analyzed: chu la 'dug pa ni skam la gnas par mi bzod /
translated: Those that live in the water cannot endure being on land.

original: grang bas ni tshad khungs mi thub /
analyzed: grang bas ni tshad khungs mi thub /
translated: Those that are cold cannot endure heat.🔽Those that are hot cannot endure the cold.

original: dros pas ni grang mo mi thub pa la sogs pa rang gi chos ma yin pa byed mi nus pa dang de'i nang nas kyang la la ni bslabs na lobs pa dang / bsgoms na goms su rung ba yang yod /
analyzed: dros pas ni grang mo mi thub pa la sogs pa rang gi chos ma yin pa byed mi nus pa dang de'i nang nas kyang la la ni bslabs na lobs pa dang / bsgoms na goms su rung ba yang yod /
translated: They are unable to do things that are not their own dharma.

original: la la ni bslabs kyang mi lobs la bsgoms kyang goms su mi rung ba yang yod pa dang / ba glang dang rta la sogs pa mi las nyams rtsal che la bang mgyogs pa yang mis bkol du rung ba dang / lji ba dang shig la sogs pa mi bas chung yang mi la za ba dang /
analyzed: la la ni bslabs kyang mi lobs la bsgoms kyang goms su mi rung ba yang yod pa dang / ba glang dang rta la sogs pa mi las nyams rtsal che la bang mgyogs pa yang mis bkol du rung ba dang / lji ba dang shig la sogs pa mi bas chung yang mi la za ba dang /
translated: Some insects such as lice and fleas are smaller than humans but eat humans.

original: skye gnas bzhi nas skye ba'i tshul mi mthun pa dang / 'di 'dra ba la sogs pa sems can sna tshogs pa la sogs pa gnas pa mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod pa las na /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi nas skye ba'i tshul mi mthun pa dang / 'di 'dra ba la sogs pa sems can sna tshogs pa la sogs pa gnas pa mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod pa las na /
translated: Since the various types of sentient beings such as these are directly observed to exist,🔽it is inferred that they go to another world in the same way.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du yad de'i tshul gyis 'gro par dpag pa ni rgyu dang las dang chos kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du yad de'i tshul gyis 'gro par dpag pa ni rgyu dang las dang chos kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of inference are cause, action, and the subsequent inference of phenomena.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol yod cing sems can rnams 'khor ba na gnas bar gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol yod cing sems can rnams 'khor ba na gnas bar gyur na /
translated: Thus, if another world exists and sentient beings abide in samsara,

original: skyid pa dang sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod pa yang tshe snga ma'i las kyi rgyu las byung ste /
analyzed: skyid pa dang sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod pa yang tshe snga ma'i las kyi rgyu las byung ste /
translated: The existence of specific differences, such as happiness and suffering, also arises from the cause of karma in previous lives.🔽Observing the engagement in and occurrence of the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions of sentient beings' happiness and suffering, the experience of the ripening of happiness and suffering in other worlds also occurs through the power of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: sems can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las spyod pa la gnas shing 'byung bar dmigs nas 'jig rten gzhan du bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa myong ba yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba la gnas pa 'di'i tshul gyis las kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las spyod pa la gnas shing 'byung bar dmigs nas 'jig rten gzhan du bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa myong ba yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba la gnas pa 'di'i tshul gyis las kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of inferential reasoning is the ascertainment that the ripening of karma is not wasted by this method.

original: 'di dag ni @187b rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni @187b rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: These are the characteristics of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not to be taken as valid inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter, on inference.

original: // / rang gi rigs kyi dpe dang sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la nang dang phyi'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'jig pa dang / skye bar dmigs pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la grags bas nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pas nye bar sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: // / rang gi rigs kyi dpe dang sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la nang dang phyi'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'jig pa dang / skye bar dmigs pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la grags bas nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pas nye bar sbyar ba dang /
translated: The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.🔽The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.🔽The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.

original: rang dbang med par dmigs pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / phyi rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud ba nye bar dmigs pa 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa nye bar sbyar ba 'di dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //🔽so so'i skye bo rnams la thub pa dag gis gtsug lag tu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang dbang med par dmigs pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / phyi rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud ba nye bar dmigs pa 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa nye bar sbyar ba 'di dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //🔽so so'i skye bo rnams la thub pa dag gis gtsug lag tu bstan pa ni /
translated: The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.🔽The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.🔽The characteristics of examples the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.🔽The characteristics of examples from one's own class are well known to all the world, since the destruction and arising of internal and external formations are observed.

original: gang 'jig rten la ma grub pa bsgrub cing khong du ma chud pa khong du gzhug pa'i phyir ston pas na /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la ma grub pa bsgrub cing khong du ma chud pa khong du gzhug pa'i phyir ston pas na /
translated: Because it teaches in order to establish what is not established in the world and to make understood what is not understood,

original: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa yang rung /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa yang rung /
translated: it is direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag par shes par bya ba yang rung /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par shes par bya ba yang rung /
translated: or it is to be known through inference,

original: the tshom sel ba'i grogs su rang gi rigs kyi dpes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom sel ba'i grogs su rang gi rigs kyi dpes bstan par bya'o //
translated: or it is to be taught through examples of one's own class in order to assist in dispelling doubt.

original: 'di las nang dang phyi'i 'du byed rnams 'jig pa dang ; skye ba zhes bya ba nas rang dbang med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsum po ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las nang dang phyi'i 'du byed rnams 'jig pa dang ; skye ba zhes bya ba nas rang dbang med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsum po ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, the three beginning with destruction and arising of internal and external formations up to without independence refer to impermanence, suffering, and non-self.

original: de gsum la dpe  nye bar sbyar bas kyang chos 'di gsum bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de gsum la dpe  nye bar sbyar bas kyang chos 'di gsum bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Those three should be established through the application of examples to these three dharmas.

original: skad cig pa yang mi rtag pa'i don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig pa yang mi rtag pa'i don du 'gyur te /
translated: Momentary also becomes the meaning of impermanence.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dpes bstan pa'i nang du 'dus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dpes bstan pa'i nang du 'dus par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that arising and destruction are included in the teaching through examples.

original: phyi rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud pa dpes bstan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu chung mi za ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud pa dpes bstan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu chung mi za ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The teaching by way of examples of external prosperity and decline proves the existence of a world beyond and that the effect of action is not lost.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni gcig ste /
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni gcig ste /
translated: The characteristic of an example is one:

original: 'jig rten la mngon sum du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la mngon sum du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: it proves to the world by way of direct perception.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that?🔽The direct perception of the impermanence of compounded phenomena by those who speak the truth but are not learned, is subsumed by the continuity of a single similar [moment], and so they view it as having the characteristic of permanence.

original: bden par smra ba'i thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa mngon sum gyis dmigs kyang 'dra ba'i rgyun gcig gis gcig sdud pas bsdus te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba dag mi rtag par dpes bstan pa las 'dus byas kyi
analyzed: bden par smra ba'i thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa mngon sum gyis dmigs kyang 'dra ba'i rgyun gcig gis gcig sdud pas bsdus te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba dag mi rtag par dpes bstan pa las 'dus byas kyi
translated: In order to teach them impermanence by way of an example, [the Buddha] said,

original: chos ni @188a * //
analyzed: chos ni @188a * //
translated: “Monks, all compounded phenomena

original: gzhig tu rung ba'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: gzhig tu rung ba'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: are of the nature of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i gnyen pos gzhig par 'gyur ba ni sla /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i gnyen pos gzhig par 'gyur ba ni sla /
translated: It is easy to destroy that which is subject to destruction by the antidote of destruction.”

original: brlan gyi gnyen po me la chu bab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dus byas su yang rigs gcig la chu blugs na me 'gag par dmigs shing 'jig rten dag me gsod na /
analyzed: brlan gyi gnyen po me la chu bab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dus byas su yang rigs gcig la chu blugs na me 'gag par dmigs shing 'jig rten dag me gsod na /
translated: When the world is extinguished,

original: chu tshol ba 'am /🔽me mar ram /
analyzed: chu tshol ba 'am / me mar ram /
translated: water is sought.🔽When a lamp or a torch is fanned by the wind or by one’s breath, the flame is extinguished.

original: sgron ma la rlung gis btab pa 'am dbugs kyis bus na me lce 'gag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i me dang rlung mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgron ma la rlung gis btab pa 'am dbugs kyis bus na me lce 'gag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i me dang rlung mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The direct perception of fire and wind is called “established by direct perception in the world.”

original: me'i rgyun rang la gag pa la yang me lce 'gags nas mdag ma las thal ba dang sol bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me'i rgyun rang la gag pa la yang me lce 'gags nas mdag ma las thal ba dang sol bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: The flame of the fire is extinguished in itself, and from the embers ash and charcoal arise.

original: mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing snga ma 'jig pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yang 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing snga ma 'jig pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yang 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of a later dissimilar continuum and the disintegration of the former is also called “established by direct perception in the world.”

original: mi rtag pa rags pa la skad cig la phra mo'i cha yod pa'i dpe ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rags pa la skad cig la phra mo'i cha yod pa'i dpe ni /
translated: The example of the subtle part in an instant of coarse impermanence is as follows.

original: snam bu la skud pa'i cha yod pa yang snal mar 'dzag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: snam bu la skud pa'i cha yod pa yang snal mar 'dzag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The part of the thread in the cloth is like the yarn that is drawn out.🔽Or, the part of the particle in the lump of clay is like the destruction of the subtle particle.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu la rdul gyi cha yod pa yang rdul phra rab tu 'jig pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i 'jim pa dang rdul mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu la rdul gyi cha yod pa yang rdul phra rab tu 'jig pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i 'jim pa dang rdul mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The direct perception of clay and particles is called the establishment of the world by direct perception.

original: rtag par snang ba de mi rtag pa'i rgyun yin par bstan pa ni chu'i rgyun la dang ba dang / rnyog pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i tshe snga phyi tha dad par mngon pa las ni /
analyzed: rtag par snang ba de mi rtag pa'i rgyun yin par bstan pa ni chu'i rgyun la dang ba dang / rnyog pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i tshe snga phyi tha dad par mngon pa las ni /
translated: The teaching that the appearance of permanence is a continuum of impermanence is like the continuum of water, which is a different earlier and later when it becomes clear or turbid.

original: dang ba'i rgyun du 'bab pa yang snga phyi tha dad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dang ba'i rgyun du 'bab pa yang snga phyi tha dad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The continuum of clarity flows as a different earlier and later.

original: me lce dang blo la yang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun snga phyir byung ba'i tshe tha dad par mngon pa las na /
analyzed: me lce dang blo la yang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun snga phyir byung ba'i tshe tha dad par mngon pa las na /
translated: Or, in the case of a flame and the mind, when a different earlier and later continuum arises, it is evident as different.

original: 'dra ba'i rgyun du gnas pa yang snga phyi tha dad do zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba dang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyun du gnas pa yang snga phyi tha dad do zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba dang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten la mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perception of a similarity by direct perception, when it is said that the continuum of a similar type endures, is called “established by direct perception in the world.”

original: ril ba chus bkang ba'i spyi bo thur du bstan na ;
analyzed: ril ba chus bkang ba'i spyi bo thur du bstan na ;
translated: It is like the top of a water-filled pot turned upside down.

original: thigs pa phyi ma'i gdong la snga ma mi snod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: thigs pa phyi ma'i gdong la snga ma mi snod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The face of the later drop is not seen in the earlier one.🔽Or it is like a flower falling when it becomes a fruit.

original: nam 'bras bur gyur pa ni me tog ltung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi ma mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam 'bras bur gyur pa ni me tog ltung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi ma mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ni 'jig rten mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The perception of the earlier and later by direct perception is called “established by direct perception in the world.”

original: gzhan la yang 'di dag gi tshul gyis @188b ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang 'di dag gi tshul gyis @188b ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply these methods to other cases as appropriate.

original: 'du byed rnams la bde bar 'dzin pa dag sdug bsngal yin pa dpes bstan na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bde bar 'dzin pa dag sdug bsngal yin pa dpes bstan na /
translated: When the apprehension of pleasure in formations is taught by example as being suffering,

original: skye ba dang na ba la sogs pa'i chos yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: skye ba dang na ba la sogs pa'i chos yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: it is like the existence of the phenomena of birth, sickness, and so on.

original: tshor ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin pas na /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin pas na /
translated: All feelings are by nature suffering.

original: phrag pa la khur bgal ba g-yas g-yon du spos pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phrag pa la khur bgal ba g-yas g-yon du spos pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: They are like a burden on the shoulder, which is shifted from one side to the other.

original: bde ba de yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'am spyod lam bzhi las gag kyang rung ring du gnas na sdug bsngal dang 'dra'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba de yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'am spyod lam bzhi las gag kyang rung ring du gnas na sdug bsngal dang 'dra'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, this happiness is suffering, or it is like suffering when one has to remain in one of the four postures for too long.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par dpes bstan pa la 'dus byas kyi chos ni rkyen 'dus pas grub ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par dpes bstan pa la 'dus byas kyi chos ni rkyen 'dus pas grub ste /
translated: The author explains by means of examples that all things are without self. Conditioned things are established by the coming together of conditions.

original: shing rta sbyar ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'am khang ba phub ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni de'i rang bzhin las bdag ces bya ba gud na nam mkha' la ri bong gi rva med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shing rta sbyar ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'am khang ba phub ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni de'i rang bzhin las bdag ces bya ba gud na nam mkha' la ri bong gi rva med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are like a chariot, which is an assemblage, or like a house, which is a collection. Unconditioned things are not a self, because their nature is different from that of a self, just as the horn of a rabbit does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dang las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar bstan pa'i dpe ni 'phags pa bzang skyong gis dris pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dang las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar bstan pa'i dpe ni 'phags pa bzang skyong gis dris pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: The example that shows that there is a world beyond and that the effects of actions are not lost is like the one that occurs in the noble Good Eon Sutra.

original: de la sogs pa sde snod gsum gyi nang nas dpe'i rnam pa 'byung ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par gang la gang rigs par bstan to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa sde snod gsum gyi nang nas dpe'i rnam pa 'byung ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par gang la gang rigs par bstan to //
translated: In this way, the examples that occur in the three baskets are taught in accordance with their characteristics and in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the characteristics of examples of one's own type, the sixth chapter of the Treatise on the Pith Instructions on Prajñāpāramitā, Called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / yongs su gregs pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: // / yongs su gregs pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The Characteristics of Thoroughly Established Reality

original: gang 'di de mngon sum dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gang 'di de mngon sum dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of the thoroughly established reality are the characteristic of the direct perception of that, the characteristic of the direct perception of the basis of that, and the characteristic of the application of an example of one's own type.

original: de 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: It should be understood that the definition of a fully established phenomenon is that which is ascertained as one and only in the establishment of that.

original: yongs su gregs  pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / rjes su dpag par rig pa dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba dang gsum tshogs na 'grub pa la gcig tu des pa 'di ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su gregs  pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / rjes su dpag par rig pa dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba dang gsum tshogs na 'grub pa la gcig tu des pa 'di ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: A fully established phenomenon is a phenomenon that is ascertained as one and only in the establishment of that which is ascertained by the three: direct perception, inference, and the application of an example of its type.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa gsum so sor smos pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa gsum so sor smos pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bye brag go //
translated: The individual mention of the three, direct perception and so on, is a specific characteristic.

original: yongs su gregs pa gcig tu bgrang ba ni grub pa'i don gyis gcig go //🔽de @189a * //
analyzed: yongs su gregs pa gcig tu bgrang ba ni grub pa'i don gyis gcig go // de @189a * //
translated: The single enumeration of a fully established phenomenon is one in terms of the object of establishment.

original: gsum ldan na don la nges par byas ba ni dper na sngon gyi bye brag zhig thos te /
analyzed: gsum ldan na don la nges par byas ba ni dper na sngon gyi bye brag zhig thos te /
translated: The ascertainment of an object when those three are complete is like, for example, having heard a specific point in the past,

original: the tshom du gyur pa la de ltar sus mthong zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'dra /
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa la de ltar sus mthong zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'dra /
translated: if one asks, “Who saw it that way?” it is like direct perception.

original: de yin par cis mngon zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'dra /
analyzed: de yin par cis mngon zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'dra /
translated: The question How is that known? is like an inference.

original: de dang 'dra ba gzhan gang la srid ces bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba gzhan gang la srid ces bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe dang 'dra ste /
translated: The question Where else is that possible? is like an example from one's own class.

original: de gsum mthun na yid ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de gsum mthun na yid ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: If those three agree, it is like the word mind.

original: sems can ni ma rig pa dang nga rgyal dang the tshom la sogs pa dang bcas pas na /
analyzed: sems can ni ma rig pa dang nga rgyal dang the tshom la sogs pa dang bcas pas na /
translated: Since sentient beings are accompanied by ignorance, pride, doubt, and so on,

original: mi las bla mar gyur pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul bstan pa la ma rig pa'i dbang gis ni don log par 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi las bla mar gyur pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul bstan pa la ma rig pa'i dbang gis ni don log par 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: when the teachings of one who is superior to humans and the domain of supramundane wisdom are taught, due to the power of ignorance, they will grasp the meaning incorrectly.

original: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis ni gang goms pa la ngan du byed pa 'byung /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis ni gang goms pa la ngan du byed pa 'byung /
translated: Due to the power of pride, they will be hostile to what they are accustomed to.

original: the tshom gyi dbang gis ni yang dag par bstan pa la yid mi ches pa 'byung bas na /
analyzed: the tshom gyi dbang gis ni yang dag par bstan pa la yid mi ches pa 'byung bas na /
translated: Due to the power of doubt, they will not believe the correct teachings.

original: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gtan la dbab pa yang de ltar dgos so //
analyzed: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gtan la dbab pa yang de ltar dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment by the characteristic of complete refutation is also like that.

original: yongs su gregs pa'i le'u steng bdun pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su gregs pa'i le'u steng bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh chapter on complete refutation.

original: // / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: // / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The characteristics of the teaching of the ascertainment of the very pure scriptures are as follows:

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Whatever is taught by the Omniscient One, such as

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba 'di dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba 'di dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: “nirvana is peace,” should be known as the characteristics of the teaching of the ascertainment of the very pure scriptures.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid lnga po 'di dag gi sa rigs pas brtag pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid lnga po 'di dag gi sa rigs pas brtag pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the investigation of these five characteristics by reasoning is pure.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Because it is pure, it should be taught. Thus, the characteristics have been explained.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab rnams yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab rnams yin te /
translated: The Dharma taught by the Omniscient One is the scriptures endowed with the twelve branches.

original: de thams cad kyi don ni mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid las gzhan du mi gsung bas na /
analyzed: de thams cad kyi don ni mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid las gzhan du mi gsung bas na /
translated: Since the meaning of all of them does not teach anything other than nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: nirvana is called “peace.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: That nirvana is twofold, by way of the Mahayana and the Sravakayana.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chos thams cad thog ma nas zhi bas nu rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par khong du chud de /🔽@189b chos gag kyang mya ngan las bzlar med pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba dang sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar dmigs nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad thog ma nas zhi bas nu rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par khong du chud de / @189b chos gag kyang mya ngan las bzlar med pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba dang sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar dmigs nas /
translated: Since all phenomena are primordially peaceful, one realizes that they are naturally in nirvana.🔽Since there is no phenomenon that is not in nirvana, there is a nonabiding nirvana.🔽And, having observed the suffering of those who are not in nirvana, there is a nirvana that is peaceful with regard to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'da' ba dang gnyis kyis zhi bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'da' ba dang gnyis kyis zhi bar ston pa'o //
translated: These two teach peace.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ces bya ba ni chos rnams de bzhin nyid bdun la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ces bya ba ni chos rnams de bzhin nyid bdun la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Such aspects” are the seven suchnesses of phenomena and so forth.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: mdo 'di las gsungs pa byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di las gsungs pa byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni /
translated: The suchness that is taught in this sutra is

original: gang 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: the absence of a beginning and end of compounded phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni gang chos rnams kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni gang chos rnams kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o ;
translated: The reality of characteristics is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam mo //🔽gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam mo // gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The reality of representations is the mere representation of the compositional factors.🔽The reality of abidance is what I have explained as the truth of suffering.

original: log pa'i nan tan gyi de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i nan tan gyi de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The reality of wrong practice is what I have explained as the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The reality of purification is what I have explained as the truth of cessation.

original: yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas lam gyi bden pa bshad pa bstan pa'o zhes gsungs pa de dag bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi de bzhin nyid ni gang ngas lam gyi bden pa bshad pa bstan pa'o zhes gsungs pa de dag bshad par bya ste /
translated: The reality of right practice is what I have explained as the truth of the path.

original: de bzhin nyid bdun po de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis gcig cing yang grub pa'i mtha' gnyis gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdun po de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis gcig cing yang grub pa'i mtha' gnyis gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: These seven realities are one in terms of the Mahāyāna and two in terms of the Hīnayāna.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'du byed kyi thog ma med pa'ang 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / 'du byed kyi thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' dmigs su med pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi thog ma med pa'ang 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / 'du byed kyi thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' dmigs su med pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first is that the beginning of formations is not the beginning of cyclic existence, and the second is that the beginning and end of formations cannot be observed.

original: bdag med pa yang ji ltar mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag ces bya ba med pa dang chos so cog kyang sgyu ma dang 'dra ste bdag med pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: bdag med pa yang ji ltar mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag ces bya ba med pa dang chos so cog kyang sgyu ma dang 'dra ste bdag med pa dang gnyis so //
translated: The second is that the so-called self that is imputed by tīrthikas does not exist and that all phenomena are like illusions and are selfless.

original: 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba yang 'du byed thams cad la dbang byed pas sems pa yin pa dang / 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyis brtags pa tsam las gzhan med pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba yang 'du byed thams cad la dbang byed pas sems pa yin pa dang / 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyis brtags pa tsam las gzhan med pa dang gnyis so //
translated: The second is that since mind controls all formations, it is intention and that all formations are nothing other than mere imputations by mind.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang phung po lnga /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang phung po lnga /
translated: The truth of suffering is the five aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyis gtse bar mthong nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyis gtse bar mthong nas /
translated: Having seen that they are afflicted by the three or eight sufferings,

original: 'khor bas skyo ba dang / 'du byed sdug bsngal bar mthong bas sems can @190a * //
analyzed: 'khor bas skyo ba dang / 'du byed sdug bsngal bar mthong bas sems can @190a * //
translated: one becomes disenchanted with cyclic existence and sees that formations are suffering.

original: thams cad la snying rje chen po skye ba dang gnyis so //🔽kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad la snying rje chen po skye ba dang gnyis so // kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: and the arising of great compassion for all.🔽The truth of the origin of suffering is twofold:

original: phung po phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur bar rtogs pa dang / de nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: phung po phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur bar rtogs pa dang / de nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang gnyis so //
translated: the realization that afflictions become the cause of future aggregates, and the realization of the purity of their nature.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang dmigs pa can gyi 'gog pa'i bden pa dang mi dmigs pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang dmigs pa can gyi 'gog pa'i bden pa dang mi dmigs pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is twofold: the truth of cessation that is an object of observation and the cessation that is not an object of observation.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu pa yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu pa yin te /
translated: The truth of the path is twofold: the eightfold noble path and the ten perfections.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus, these two aspects🔽should be understood as the distinction between the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: bkri ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi bye brag tu shes par gyis shig / yong ni mi las bla mar gyur pa'i gtsug lag dpyad pa la tshig gi tha snyad kyi grub pa 'ba' zhig gi kha dor du mi rung ste /
analyzed: bkri ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi bye brag tu shes par gyis shig / yong ni mi las bla mar gyur pa'i gtsug lag dpyad pa la tshig gi tha snyad kyi grub pa 'ba' zhig gi kha dor du mi rung ste /
translated: Now, in the investigation of the scriptures that are superior to the human, it is not suitable to be biased toward mere verbal conventions;

original: lung las 'byung ba dang mthun par bsgrub dgos pas na /
analyzed: lung las 'byung ba dang mthun par bsgrub dgos pas na /
translated: since it is necessary to establish [the scriptures] in accordance with what appears in the scriptures,

original: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba kun kyang lung dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba kun kyang lung dang sbyar ro //
translated: All the practices and the things to be practiced are also in accordance with the scriptures.

original: lung gi mtshan nyid ni chos kyi phyag rgya rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pas btab pa yin no //
analyzed: lung gi mtshan nyid ni chos kyi phyag rgya rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pas btab pa yin no //
translated: The definition of the scriptures is that they are sealed with the Dharma mudrā, which is the teaching of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the gateway to liberation.

original: ci'i phyir lung shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the scriptures extremely pure?

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyang chos mthun par ston pas na lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyang chos mthun par ston pas na lung zhes bya'o //
translated: Because all the buddhas of the three times teach in accordance with the Dharma, they are called the scriptures.

original: chos kyi tshad mar byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la rang bzo'i lhad ma zhugs pas na shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshad mar byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la rang bzo'i lhad ma zhugs pas na shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they possess the defining characteristics of being based on the Dharma and are not adulterated with personal fabrications, they are called extremely pure.

original: chos de dag 'jig rten du ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: chos de dag 'jig rten du ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How are those Dharmas in the world?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mkhyen pa nyid dang / rkang par ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten rig pa skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa lha dang mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ba des chos thams cad ji ltar mngon par thugs
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mkhyen pa nyid dang / rkang par ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten rig pa skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa lha dang mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ba des chos thams cad ji ltar mngon par thugs
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the One with Insight and Accomplishments, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, who appeared in the world, understood🔽the nature of all phenomena.

original: su chud pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang ston pa des gsungs so //
analyzed: su chud pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang ston pa des gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one endowed with knowledge and feet, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the charioteer who tames people, the unexcelled, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Bhagavat, the Blessed One, the one who has appeared in the world, has taught to others just as he has realized all phenomena.

original: de'i rgyu nas che ba'i bar du gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nas che ba'i bar du gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that up to greatness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skye bo srid pa bstan pa las 'byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni rgyu gcig gis ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skye bo srid pa bstan pa las 'byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni rgyu gcig gis ma yin /
translated: The appearance of the Tathāgata, who is born from the teaching of existence for beings, is not due to a single cause.

original: byed pa gcig gis skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: byed pa gcig gis skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from a single action.

original: tshad med grangs med pa brgya stong gi @190b rim pa yongs su rdzogs par byas shing rab tu skye ba rnam pa bcu'i tshul gyis 'byung ngo /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa brgya stong gi @190b rim pa yongs su rdzogs par byas shing rab tu skye ba rnam pa bcu'i tshul gyis 'byung ngo /
translated: It arises through the method of ten kinds of birth, having completed the stages of immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa tshad med pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po tshad med pa dang / tshad med par spyod pa'i smon lam la sogs pa tshad med pa bcu las 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa tshad med pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po tshad med pa dang / tshad med par spyod pa'i smon lam la sogs pa tshad med pa bcu las 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs pa 'di ni /
translated: From the ten immeasurable practices of immeasurable superior intention, immeasurable great love, immeasurable great compassion, immeasurable prayers to engage in immeasurable practices, and so on.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the characteristics of the cause.🔽The noble Buddha Land states:

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: The pure expanse of reality, mirrorlike wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual realization, and the wisdom of accomplishing activities arise from the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di lngas chos thams cad la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par rnam pa thams cad kyang mkhyen la skal ba yod pa'i sems can kun kyang so so'i bsam pa bzhin du grub par mdzad pa 'di ni sa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lngas chos thams cad la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par rnam pa thams cad kyang mkhyen la skal ba yod pa'i sems can kun kyang so so'i bsam pa bzhin du grub par mdzad pa 'di ni sa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: These five indicate that the Buddha knows all aspects of all phenomena without any subject-object duality, and that he causes all sentient beings with the right karmic fortune to accomplish their goals in accordance with their individual aspirations.🔽The following is the definition of omniscience as it appears in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The definition of omniscience is fivefold:

original: su gang 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen par sgra rnam par grags shing 'byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / stobs bcus sems can kun gyi the tshom gcod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i chos bstan pa bzhi dag gis des bshad pa la pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang /
analyzed: su gang 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen par sgra rnam par grags shing 'byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / stobs bcus sems can kun gyi the tshom gcod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i chos bstan pa bzhi dag gis des bshad pa la pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang /
translated: It is that which is renowned and appears in the world as omniscience, it is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being, it is the ten powers that eliminate the doubts of all sentient beings, it is the four forms of fearlessness that teach the Dharma without any fear, and it is the eighteen distinctive qualities that are not shared by others.

original: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad snang zhing /
analyzed: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad snang zhing /
translated: Whose Dharma and Vinaya is the eightfold noble path seen?

original: dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te /
translated: And whose Dharma and Vinaya are the four types of spiritual practitioners seen?

original: de ltar 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyor dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyor dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the five characteristics of omniscience: origination, signs, the elimination of doubt, the absence of debate and the absence of dispute.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas ci zhig mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas ci zhig mkhyen ce na /
translated: What does the omniscient one know?

original: 'phags pa rin po che'i sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las 'byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i che ba ni mi chags pa'i bsam gtan pas ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtha' dang kun gyi mtha' mi rnyed do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshang med pa'i gzugs kyi sku mngon par sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rin po che'i sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las 'byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i che ba ni mi chags pa'i bsam gtan pas ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtha' dang kun gyi mtha' mi rnyed do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshang med pa'i gzugs kyi sku mngon par sgrub pa dang /
translated: The greatness of omniscience that appears in the sutras such as the Cloud of Jewels is that the dhyana of nonattachment does not find the limit of the object of concentration and the limit of all, that it accomplishes the Tathagata's form body without remainder,🔽and that it is the cause of the Dharma body.

original: 'phrul gyi spyan gyi yul tshad med @191a * //🔽pa dang / 'phrul gyi snyan gyi yul tshad med pa dang / tshad med pa'i ye shes kyis skad cig thang cig yud tsam zhig la mtha' med pa'i gzugs mtha' med pa'i sgra gsan /
analyzed: 'phrul gyi spyan gyi yul tshad med @191a * // pa dang / 'phrul gyi snyan gyi yul tshad med pa dang / tshad med pa'i ye shes kyis skad cig thang cig yud tsam zhig la mtha' med pa'i gzugs mtha' med pa'i sgra gsan /
translated: The object of the eye of wisdom is immeasurable.🔽The object of the ear of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: mtha' med pa'i chos mkhyen te dus gsum char la yang thogs pa med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i chos mkhyen te dus gsum char la yang thogs pa med do zhes bya'o //
translated: With immeasurable wisdom, in an instant, a short moment, a small fraction of time, he hears immeasurable sounds, knows immeasurable dharmas, and is unimpeded in all three times.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two marks of a great man?

original: 'phags pa rgya cher rol ba'i mdo las byung ba dbu la gtsug tor yod pa dang / dbu mthon mthing la g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / dpral ba mnyam la che ba dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dang / spyan mthon mthing la rdzi ma 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rgya cher rol ba'i mdo las byung ba dbu la gtsug tor yod pa dang / dbu mthon mthing la g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / dpral ba mnyam la che ba dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dang / spyan mthon mthing la rdzi ma 'dra ba dang /
translated: As they appear in the noble extensive sutra: He has a crown protrusion on his head, his head is dark blue and curls to the right, his forehead is even and broad, he has hair-tufts between his eyebrows, his eyes are dark blue and have eyelashes like an ox's,

original: so bzhi bcu thags bzang ba dang / mche ba dkar ba dang / 'gram ba seng ge 'dra ba dang / lce che zhing srab pa dang / ro stod seng ge 'dra ba dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / spu'i khung bu re re nas skyes pa dang /
analyzed: so bzhi bcu thags bzang ba dang / mche ba dkar ba dang / 'gram ba seng ge 'dra ba dang / lce che zhing srab pa dang / ro stod seng ge 'dra ba dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / spu'i khung bu re re nas skyes pa dang /
translated: His teeth are forty in number, even and well set, and his canine teeth are white. His cheekbones are like those of a lion, his tongue is large and slender, and the upper part of his body is like that of a lion. His body is as broad as it is tall, like the banyan tree, and each of his body hairs grows separately.

original: pho mtshan mi snang bar nub pa dang / brla gang zhing zlum pa dang / byin pa ri dags kyi rgyal po aen ya 'dra ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa che ba dang / zhabs dang phyag 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / zhabs dang phyag gi sor mo'i bar dra bas 'brel ba dang /
analyzed: pho mtshan mi snang bar nub pa dang / brla gang zhing zlum pa dang / byin pa ri dags kyi rgyal po aen ya 'dra ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa che ba dang / zhabs dang phyag 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / zhabs dang phyag gi sor mo'i bar dra bas 'brel ba dang /
translated: His penis is retracted within a sheath, his thighs are rounded and well-proportioned, and his calves are like those of the eneya antelope. His feet and hands are soft and supple, and the fingers and toes of his hands and feet are connected by a web.

original: zhabs dang phyag gi sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi sting mtho ba dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang / dpung mgo zlum pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / pags pa srab la gser gyi kha dog 'dra ba dang / ma btung bar phyag pus mo'i lhang la reg pa dang /🔽zhabs rab tu gnas pa dang / zhabs dang phyag gi mthil na 'khor lo'i mtshan yod pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang 'di dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las 'byung ngo //🔽de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhabs dang phyag gi sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi sting mtho ba dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang / dpung mgo zlum pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / pags pa srab la gser gyi kha dog 'dra ba dang / ma btung bar phyag pus mo'i lhang la reg pa dang / zhabs rab tu gnas pa dang / zhabs dang phyag gi mthil na 'khor lo'i mtshan yod pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang 'di dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las 'byung ngo // de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa 'dzin pa shes pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs dang /
