analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa 'dzin pa shes pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing what is correct and incorrect, the power of knowing the ripening of actions in terms of the past, present, and future, the power of knowing various interests, the power of knowing various dhātus,

original: dbang po mchog dang tha ma shes pa'i stobs dang / @191b thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'jog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang tha ma shes pa'i stobs dang / @191b thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam shes pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'jog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: the power of knowing superior and inferior faculties, the power of knowing all paths and where they lead, the power of knowing the absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, and the power of knowing defilement and purification,

original: rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa shes pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa shes pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of remembering past lives, the power of knowing death and rebirth, and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the four forms of fearlessness?

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par shes pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar chad kyi chos rnams gzhan ma yin par gdon mi za ba'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par shes pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar chad kyi chos rnams gzhan ma yin par gdon mi za ba'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: They are fearlessness in fully and perfectly awakening to all phenomena, fearlessness in knowing that all defilements have been exhausted, fearlessness in teaching other phenomena that are obstacles as being definitely without doubt, and fearlessness in teaching the path that leads to emancipation.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i lam de kho na la mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i lam de kho na la mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: They are fearlessness with regard to the complete and perfect enlightenment of all phenomena, fearlessness with regard to the knowledge of the exhaustion of all defilements, fearlessness with regard to the certainty of the teaching of the obstacles, and fearlessness with regard to the path that leads to the attainment of all perfections.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Noble Eightfold Path?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /🔽yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: dge sbyong bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of saints?

original: lam ston pa dang / lam rgyal ba dang / lam la gnas pa dang / lam sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lam ston pa dang / lam rgyal ba dang / lam la gnas pa dang / lam sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The path is the teacher, the path is the victor, the path is the abode, and the path is the one who repudiates.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don la yun ring po nas ye shes dang bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa ma lus par rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don la yun ring po nas ye shes dang bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa ma lus par rdzogs pas na /
translated: The Omniscient One, having accumulated the stores of merit and wisdom for a long time, has completed them all for the sake of self and others.

original: dge ba thams cad mnga' ba ni sa chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad mnga' ba ni sa chen po bzhin no //
translated: He is the possessor of all virtues, like the great earth.

original: de la gzhan gyi rkyen gyi rkyen las 'gyur ba ni sa las skye'o cog la thabs mi shes pas spyad na ni rtsi yang dug tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi rkyen gyi rkyen las 'gyur ba ni sa las skye'o cog la thabs mi shes pas spyad na ni rtsi yang dug tu 'gyur /
translated: In this regard, the transformation of the conditions of others is that, when one uses what grows from the earth without knowing the methods, even medicine becomes poison.

original: zas kyang nad du 'gyur /
analyzed: zas kyang nad du 'gyur /
translated: Food becomes disease.

original: thabs shes pas spyad na ni dug kyang bdud rtsir rung /
analyzed: thabs shes pas spyad na ni dug kyang bdud rtsir rung /
translated: But when one uses it knowing the methods, even poison becomes nectar.

original: zas kyang srog gi zungs byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zas kyang srog gi zungs byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Food becomes the life-force.

original: chos so cog ma lus par mkhyen kyang sems kyis brtags pa tsam du thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: chos so cog ma lus par mkhyen kyang sems kyis brtags pa tsam du thugs su chud pas na /
translated: Although he knows all dharmas without exception, he understands them to be merely mental fabrications.

original: de'i nyes pas mi gos pa ni /
analyzed: de'i nyes pas mi gos pa ni /
translated: Therefore, he is not defiled by their faults.

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa dang nam mkhar 'grogs kyang nam mkha' la chags pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa dang nam mkhar 'grogs kyang nam mkha' la chags pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: Although the form aspect is associated with space, it is not attached to space.

original: sems can rnams sgrib pa las ma grol ba'i phyir thugs rje dang bcas pa'i smon lam @192a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams sgrib pa las ma grol ba'i phyir thugs rje dang bcas pa'i smon lam @192a * //
translated: Because sentient beings are not liberated from obscurations, the compassionate aspiration

original: gyis mnyam pa med pa dang / mnyam pa'i phung po lnga'i sku mi gtong ste /
analyzed: gyis mnyam pa med pa dang / mnyam pa'i phung po lnga'i sku mi gtong ste /
translated: does not abandon the body of the five aggregates, which is unequaled and equal.🔽Although it is grasped as having no end, it is the end.

original: mtha' med pa'i mthar 'dzin kyang shes rab yongs su dag pa las byung bas na /
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i mthar 'dzin kyang shes rab yongs su dag pa las byung bas na /
translated: Because it arises from completely pure wisdom,🔽it is very pure, unlike the aggregates of ordinary beings.

original: phal gyi phung po dang khyad zhugs pa ni shin tu dag pa'i shel dang rdo ba gnyis sra ba'i rang bzhin du 'dra yang /
analyzed: phal gyi phung po dang khyad zhugs pa ni shin tu dag pa'i shel dang rdo ba gnyis sra ba'i rang bzhin du 'dra yang /
translated: Although crystal and stone are similar in their nature of solidity,

original: shel ni chos nyid kyis gsal bas rdo rje ltar gzhan la sgrib pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shel ni chos nyid kyis gsal bas rdo rje ltar gzhan la sgrib pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: the crystal is clear by its very nature, so it is like a vajra, unobstructed to others.

original: khams gsum na spyod par snang yang ting nge 'dzin gyis mthu las gyur bas na /
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod par snang yang ting nge 'dzin gyis mthu las gyur bas na /
translated: Although it appears to be active in the three realms, it is not conceptual.

original: rtog pa mi 'byung bar sna tshogs spyod pa ni me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa mi 'byung bar sna tshogs spyod pa ni me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin no //
translated: Its various activities are like reflections appearing in a mirror.

original: rnam par dag pa'i lung ston pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu yin par yang rnam par dag pa'i lung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lung ston pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do // thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu yin par yang rnam par dag pa'i lung las 'byung ngo //
translated: The prediction of purity is also omniscience.🔽The characteristic of omniscience is found in the scriptures of purity.

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang lung gnyis gcig las gcig shes par rung ba /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang lung gnyis gcig las gcig shes par rung ba /
translated: Thus, omniscience and scripture are mutually established.

original: ci la zhugs pa'i mthus shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci la zhugs pa'i mthus shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By the power of what is one able to know?

original: chos kyi tshul la zhugs pa'i mthus shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul la zhugs pa'i mthus shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is able to know by the power of engaging the way of Dharma.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'phags pa chos kun bgro ba'i mdo las 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kun bgro ba'i mdo las 'byung ba /
translated: It is found in the Sūtra on the Enumeration of Dharmas:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, by engaging in ten ways in the way of Dharma, one should understand the Buddha.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten? They are as follows:

original: rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas dang / smon lam gyi sangs rgyas dang / sems kyi sangs rgyas dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
translated: the buddha of similar causes, the buddha arisen from the fully ripened, the buddha of meditative concentration, the buddha of aspiration, the buddha of mind, the buddha of essence, the buddha of perfect enjoyment,

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang / btags pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes de dag gi bye brag bshad pa dang rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang / btags pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes de dag gi bye brag bshad pa dang rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: the emanation buddha, the imputed buddha, and the buddha placed in front.

original: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs byas pa yin /
analyzed: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs byas pa yin /
translated: The buddha placed in front is a statue.

original: btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dang mkhan po yin te ;
analyzed: btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dang mkhan po yin te ;
translated: The imputed buddha is the master and preceptor.

original: mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas mngon sum du dmigs pas btags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig la yid ches shing bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas mngon sum du dmigs pas btags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig la yid ches shing bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur /
translated: By directly observing the buddha placed in front, one will have confidence in the words of the imputed buddha and will serve them.

original: btags pa'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: btags pa'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: By venerating the nominal buddha, one will come to have confidence in the emanation buddha.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas @192b la yid ches pas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas @192b la yid ches pas /
translated: By having confidence in the emanation buddha,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: one will come to comprehend the way of the enjoyment buddha.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khong du chud pas ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khong du chud pas ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: By comprehending the way of the enjoyment buddha, one will come to comprehend the essential buddha.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas smon lam gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas smon lam gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: By comprehending the essential buddha, one will come to comprehend the aspirational buddha.

original: smon lam gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: smon lam gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: By comprehending the aspirational buddha, one will come to comprehend the samādhi buddha.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas sems kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas sems kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: By comprehending the samādhi buddha, one will come to comprehend the mind buddha.

original: sems kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas rnam bar smin pa las 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi sangs rgyas khong du chud pas rnam bar smin pa las 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: By mastering the buddhahood of mind, one masters the buddhahood that arises from the ripening of karma.

original: rnam par smin pa las 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs khong du chud pas rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas khong du chud de thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung gi mtshan nyid gcig la gcig ltos nas de gnyis ka khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs khong du chud pas rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas khong du chud de thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung gi mtshan nyid gcig la gcig ltos nas de gnyis ka khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: By mastering the buddhahood that arises from the ripening of karma, one masters the buddhahood that is similar to the cause. By understanding the characteristics of omniscience and scripture in relation to each other, one masters both.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter, on the characteristics of the extremely pure scriptures.

original: // / tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi bka' thang la /
analyzed: // / tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi bka' thang la /
translated: The authoritative statements on the enumeration and characteristics of valid cognition🔽are as follows.🔽The reasoning of establishing the argument

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa de yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa de yang /
translated: is as follows.

original: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang / mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang / mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, there are three valid cognitions: direct perception, inference, and scriptural testimony.

original: tshad ma 'di dag ci'i phyir gsungs zhes ltag 'og spun te sbyar na 'jig rten na gsum gyi sems can dag tshad ma ma yin par tshad mar ston cing tshad mar mi rung ba la tshad mar 'dzin par byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: tshad ma 'di dag ci'i phyir gsungs zhes ltag 'og spun te sbyar na 'jig rten na gsum gyi sems can dag tshad ma ma yin par tshad mar ston cing tshad mar mi rung ba la tshad mar 'dzin par byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang /
translated: If one asks why these valid cognitions were taught, the answer is that the Buddha taught them in order to remove the net of wrong views that had arisen, was arising, and would arise in the world, in the minds of sentient beings who were not valid cognitions but who were regarded as valid cognitions, and who held as valid cognitions those who were not valid cognitions.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba mkhyen nas /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba mkhyen nas /
translated: Having known that,

original: log par lta ba'i dra ba bstsal ba'i phyir tshad ma 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i dra ba bstsal ba'i phyir tshad ma 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he taught these valid cognitions in order to remove the net of wrong views.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni ring thung la sor la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / mang nyung la bre la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / lci yang la srang la sogs pas gzhal ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni ring thung la sor la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / mang nyung la bre la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / lci yang la srang la sogs pas gzhal ba lta bu yin te /
translated: Valid cognition is like measuring long and short with a cubit, measuring much and little with a bushel, and measuring heavy and light with a scale.

original: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung dang gsum mo //🔽tshad ma gsum bya ba ni dngos po bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa dang / de dag las kyang shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos dang gsum yod pas tshad ma yang @193a * //
analyzed: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung dang gsum mo // tshad ma gsum bya ba ni dngos po bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa dang / de dag las kyang shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos dang gsum yod pas tshad ma yang @193a * //
translated: The three means of valid knowledge are direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: gsum du gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum du gsungs so //
translated: The three means of valid knowledge are taught because there are three kinds of objects: those that are hidden, those that are not hidden, and those that are very hidden.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma yang zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, there are three means of valid knowledge: direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: tshad ma de dag gi mtshan nyid ni de gcig kyang lnga lngar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma de dag gi mtshan nyid ni de gcig kyang lnga lngar shes par bya ste /
translated: The definition of each of these three means of valid knowledge should be understood as fivefold.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga zhes gsungs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga zhes gsungs pa rnams yin no //
translated: The five aspects of purity are mentioned.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that they are pure in five ways.

original: ji ltar yongs su dag ce na /🔽mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pas nor ram /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su dag ce na / mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pas nor ram /
translated: How are they pure?

original: ma nor gtan la dbab /
analyzed: ma nor gtan la dbab /
translated: Direct perception is ascertained by direct perception, not by inference.🔽Inference is ascertained by inference, not by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum du myong bas don la nges par gzhog ste ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum du myong bas don la nges par gzhog ste ;
translated: Inference is that which brings about certainty about an object through the experience of direct perception.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de gnyis la the tshom yod pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpes gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de gnyis la the tshom yod pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpes gsal bar byed do //
translated: When there is doubt about both direct perception and inference, it is clarified by an example of one's own class.

original: de gsum tshogs na 'grub ba la gcig tu nges pas yongs su gregs pa yin te /
analyzed: de gsum tshogs na 'grub ba la gcig tu nges pas yongs su gregs pa yin te /
translated: When those three are assembled, it is completely ascertained by the certainty of accomplishment.

original: 'jig rten gyi tshad ma'i grangs su chud do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshad ma'i grangs su chud do //
translated: It falls within the enumeration of worldly valid cognition.

original: lung gis ni mi las bla mar gyur ba'i chos yod par mi shes pa des mtshon cing ston /
analyzed: lung gis ni mi las bla mar gyur ba'i chos yod par mi shes pa des mtshon cing ston /
translated: By scripture, one does not know that there is a Dharma superior to humans. It is indicated and taught by that.

original: mtshan nyid 'di lngas yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di lngas yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these five characteristics, it becomes completely pure.

original: yong ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyang rung 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang rung /
analyzed: yong ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyang rung 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyang rung /
translated: The meaning of completely pure is that any Dharma, whether worldly or beyond the world,

original: gang la don rtogs par byed do cog ni yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la don rtogs par byed do cog ni yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: is completely realized by the perfection of the characteristic of complete purity.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / shes par dka' ba rnams la ni mtshan nyid lnga po re re dang mthar gyis sbyar zhing brtag dgos pas mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gsal bar mngon no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / shes par dka' ba rnams la ni mtshan nyid lnga po re re dang mthar gyis sbyar zhing brtag dgos pas mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gsal bar mngon no //
translated: As for the supramundane phenomena and those that are difficult to know, one must apply each of the five characteristics and examine them, so the distinctions of the characteristics are clearly evident.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos dang shes par sla ba rnams ni mtshan nyid bzhi po tshad mas rtogs par byed mod kyi de dag gi gzhal bya yar 'dris pa'i shas che ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos dang shes par sla ba rnams ni mtshan nyid bzhi po tshad mas rtogs par byed mod kyi de dag gi gzhal bya yar 'dris pa'i shas che ste /
translated: Mundane phenomena and those that are easy to know are indeed understood by the four characteristics through valid knowledge, but the objects of comprehension of those are mostly familiar.

original: lan du mar bslab mi dgos pas mtshan nyid kyi bye brag kyang myur zhing phra ste gsal ba mi mngon bzhin du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lan du mar bslab mi dgos pas mtshan nyid kyi bye brag kyang myur zhing phra ste gsal ba mi mngon bzhin du 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is not necessary to train in them many times, the distinctions of the characteristics also occur quickly and subtly, without being evident.

original: tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi bka' thang gi le'u ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid kyi bka' thang gi le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter: the chapter on the number of valid knowledge and the authoritative statement of the characteristics.

original: // / bka' thang gis mngon sum gyi tshad mar byas la /
analyzed: // / bka' thang gis mngon sum gyi tshad mar byas la /
translated: The authoritative statement is taken as the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the valid knowledge of direct perception?

original: ma bsgribs pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis sngon du drangs pa'i steng du nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis sngon du drangs pa'i steng du nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin no //
translated: In the case of unobscured objects, the five characteristics purify the object, with direct perception leading the way, and with subsequent inference and so forth following after it.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five characteristics?

original: mig la sogs pa'i @193b rnam par shes pa lnga po las gcig dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang gnyis kyis bdag bdag gi yul la rnam pa ci yod pa so so rang gis rig par gyur ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang gang
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i @193b rnam par shes pa lnga po las gcig dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang gnyis kyis bdag bdag gi yul la rnam pa ci yod pa so so rang gis rig par gyur ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang gang
translated: The first is the characteristic of direct perception, which is the individual reflexive awareness of the five sense consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness, and the mental consciousness induced by them, of the aspects of their own objects.🔽The second is the characteristic of subsequent inference, which is the understanding of the evidence and so forth of those objects that are directly perceived through inferring them by means of direct perception.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa de dag gi rtags la sogs par bcas pa mngon sum gyis rjes su dpag nas rtogs par khong du chud pa nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang rigs gcig pa gzhan la yang 'di 'dra bar yod pa 'jig rten la sgrub pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa de dag gi rtags la sogs par bcas pa mngon sum gyis rjes su dpag nas rtogs par khong du chud pa nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang rigs gcig pa gzhan la yang 'di 'dra bar yod pa 'jig rten la sgrub pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The third is the characteristic of the example of one's own reasoning, which is the establishment in the world that something similar to that exists in other things of the same type.

original: de gsum mthun pas sgrub par gyur pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs par nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lung las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du 'byung ba lung gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o //🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis /
analyzed: de gsum mthun pas sgrub par gyur pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs par nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lung las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du 'byung ba lung gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis /
translated: The characteristics of phenomena as they occur in the scriptures are to be applied to the characteristics of the scriptures, which have the characteristics of being well-known, being spoken by the Omniscient One, and being in harmony with the three—scripture, reason, and the essence of phenomena.

original: chos kyi khams la sogs pa rang gi yul la mngon sum du dmigs pa mtshan nyid lnga dang sbyar ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams la sogs pa rang gi yul la mngon sum du dmigs pa mtshan nyid lnga dang sbyar ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The five characteristics are also applied to the direct perception of the phenomena element and so on by the mental consciousness alone in relation to its own object.🔽The five characteristics of direct valid knowledge are pure, and impermanence and so on are calculated and established in accordance with the above explanation.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du gang 'du byed du rtogs pa thams cad kyi 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma skyes nas snga ma
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du gang 'du byed du rtogs pa thams cad kyi 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma skyes nas snga ma
translated: All that is understood as compounded is similar in terms of the continuum of the similar and dissimilar arising of the later from the earlier.

original: 'gag par dmigs pa dang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i bya ba phyi ma med cing snga ma gtong bar dmigs pa de dag so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'gag par dmigs pa dang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i bya ba phyi ma med cing snga ma gtong bar dmigs pa de dag so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of direct perception is: the individual reflexive awareness of the cessation of the prior and the non-existence of the subsequent activity, which is either similar or dissimilar to the observed object.

original: de la 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun gzhan dang gzhan byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de la 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun gzhan dang gzhan byung ba'i tshe /
translated: In this regard, when there is the arising of another continuum, which is either similar or dissimilar,

original: snga ma 'gag pa'i phyir mi rtags pa nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye bar rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma 'gag pa'i phyir mi rtags pa nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye bar rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the understanding of the prior as having ceased is the definition of inference.

original: 'du byed rnams ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nang nas kyang mi rtag par mngon pa me'i rgyun la me lce 'gags nas mdag ma las thal ba dang sol bar 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nang nas kyang mi rtag par mngon pa me'i rgyun la me lce 'gags nas mdag ma las thal ba dang sol bar 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan te /
translated: The impermanence of conditioned phenomena is taught by the example of a firebrand, which is endowed with the characteristic of permanence, but is impermanent, as when the flame of a firebrand ceases and becomes embers and charcoal.

original: byin gyis srid pa dang sbyar zhing mi rtag par sgrub pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byin gyis srid pa dang sbyar zhing mi rtag par sgrub pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of an example of one’s own class is: the establishment of impermanence by applying the example of a firebrand to existence.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of a fully established phenomenon is that which is established by the collection of those three characteristics.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of an inference based on what is renowned to others is that which is comprehended by an omniscient being.

original: @194a * // 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: @194a * // 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of a scriptural inference is that which is stated by a Buddha.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis mi rtag par yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis mi rtag par yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, impermanence is fully established by a direct perception that is pure in terms of the five characteristics.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar dmigs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa nyams kyis tshor te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar dmigs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa nyams kyis tshor te /
translated: The definition of a direct perception that observes that all compounded phenomena are suffering is that which is experienced by the power of the harm of birth and so on.

original: so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //🔽sdug bsngal myong ba dag mi bzod pa lta bu'i tshul las bltas te /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do // sdug bsngal myong ba dag mi bzod pa lta bu'i tshul las bltas te /
translated: The definition of a direct perception that is individually realized is that which is individually realized.

original: 'bras bu las sdug bsngal ba nyid du dpags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu las sdug bsngal ba nyid du dpags te /
translated: The definition of an inference based on what is renowned to others that observes that all compounded phenomena are suffering is that which infers suffering from the result, such as the inability to bear the experience of suffering.

original: khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The understanding of that is the characteristic of inference based on what is near.

original: 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nang nas kyang sdug bsngal bar mngon pa skye ba dang / na ba la logs pa'i chos yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'am spyod lam bzhi las gag kyang rung ring du gnas na sdug bsngal dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nang nas kyang sdug bsngal bar mngon pa skye ba dang / na ba la logs pa'i chos yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'am spyod lam bzhi las gag kyang rung ring du gnas na sdug bsngal dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan te /
translated: The characteristic of the suffering of suffering is taught by the example of the suffering of birth and the suffering of disease, which are the most obvious forms of suffering among the formations, or by the example of any of the four postures of the body, which are painful if one remains in them too long.

original: byin gyis srid pa dang sbyar ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byin gyis srid pa dang sbyar ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the example of one's own class is the application of the example to existence.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the complete is the establishment of the three characteristics together as one.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal zhis 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal zhis 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the scriptural is the statement of the Omniscient One in the scriptures of the three baskets that all formations are suffering.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis sdug bsngal bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis sdug bsngal bar grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, suffering is established by direct perception that is completely pure due to the five characteristics.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa la 'di skad bdag gi mtshan nyid smra ba ltar rtag pa gcig pu khyad par ma dmigs pa na bdag med par so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa la 'di skad bdag gi mtshan nyid smra ba ltar rtag pa gcig pu khyad par ma dmigs pa na bdag med par so so rang gis rig pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: As for the selflessness of all phenomena, the characteristic of direct perception is the individual's own awareness of selflessness when the characteristics of permanence, singularity, and non-observation of distinction are spoken of in terms of mine.

original: phung po lnga la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba'i rtags la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: phung po lnga la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba'i rtags la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
translated: The signs, etc. of the six aspects that are connected with the characteristics of the self in the five aggregates🔽are the characteristics of inference.

original: gang yang mi dmigs pas bdag med pa nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang mi dmigs pas bdag med pa nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The understanding of selflessness through non-observation is the characteristic of subsequent inference.🔽The understanding of selflessness through the non-observation of the self in conditioned phenomena, which are themselves without self, is the characteristic of non-observation.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag med pa'i nang nas kyang rang dbang med par mngon sum pa bum pa la sogs pa rkyen la sdod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag med pa'i nang nas kyang rang dbang med par mngon sum pa bum pa la sogs pa rkyen la sdod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: For example, like a vase, etc. that are without self and depend on conditions.

original: shing rta sbyar ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan cing bdag yod pa mi srid ba dang sbyar ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shing rta sbyar ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan cing bdag yod pa mi srid ba dang sbyar ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The example of the chariot is taught to illustrate this, and the non-existence of the self is illustrated by the example of the chariot.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub la gcig tu @194b nges  pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub la gcig tu @194b nges  pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The establishment of the three characteristics is the characteristic of the thoroughly established nature.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i lung las chos thams cad bdag med do zhes 'byung ba'i lung gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i lung las chos thams cad bdag med do zhes 'byung ba'i lung gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the scriptures is that all phenomena are taught to be selfless by the Omniscient One.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis bdag med par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis bdag med par grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the selflessness of all phenomena is established by the direct perception that is purified by the five characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshang ma zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshang ma zhe na /
translated: Why is it called direct perception?

original: bsgribs pa med de /
analyzed: bsgribs pa med de /
translated: It is not obscured.

original: dmigs pas mngon sum mo //
analyzed: dmigs pas mngon sum mo //
translated: It is direct perception because it is the object.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'gal pas gtan la phebs pas na tshad ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'gal pas gtan la phebs pas na tshad ma'o //
translated: It is valid cognition because it is ascertained by the non-contradictory characteristics.

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhig mthong na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhig mthong na /
translated: Moreover, when seeing an illusory person,

original: skyes bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang / mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa dung la ser por dmigs pa dang / rab rib can gyis zla ba tshes pa la gnyis su mthong ba dang / rna nad kyis btab pas rlung dang chud ba'i sgra rtag tu thos pa dang 'di lta bu dag ni so so rang gis rig pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang / mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa dung la ser por dmigs pa dang / rab rib can gyis zla ba tshes pa la gnyis su mthong ba dang / rna nad kyis btab pas rlung dang chud ba'i sgra rtag tu thos pa dang 'di lta bu dag ni so so rang gis rig pa yin te /
translated: The specific individual, the one afflicted with jaundice who perceives a conch shell as yellow, the one with cataracts who sees two moons, and the one afflicted with an ear disease who constantly hears the sound of wind and water, have direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of direct perception.

original: rtags la sogs pa drug po'i nang na gang las rtogs par gyur pa de'i phyir sgyu ma yin par shes pa 'am mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa dang / rab rib kyi skyon zhugs ba dang / rna bar rlung zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis de ma yin pa la de 'dra bar snang ba nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa drug po'i nang na gang las rtogs par gyur pa de'i phyir sgyu ma yin par shes pa 'am mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa dang / rab rib kyi skyon zhugs ba dang / rna bar rlung zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis de ma yin pa la de 'dra bar snang ba nyid du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The understanding that an illusion is known to be an illusion because of the six, such as the reason, and the understanding that the appearance of something that is not that is due to the conditions of the affliction of jaundice, the fault of cataracts, the entry of wind into the ear, and so on, is the definition of subsequent inference.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis gzhan dang gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba'i nang na shes par sla ba smig rgyu la chu ltar snang ba dang / dha dhu ra zos na ri lu ser por snang ba dang / mig dar gyis g-yogs te bltas na /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis gzhan dang gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba'i nang na shes par sla ba smig rgyu la chu ltar snang ba dang / dha dhu ra zos na ri lu ser por snang ba dang / mig dar gyis g-yogs te bltas na /
translated: When one eats dhātakī fruit, a yellow pill appears.

original: zla ba gnyis gsum yan chad du mthong ba dang brag ca'i sgra byung na ;
analyzed: zla ba gnyis gsum yan chad du mthong ba dang brag ca'i sgra byung na ;
translated: When one looks with eyes covered by a blindfold, one moon appears as two or three.🔽When an echo occurs, it sounds as if there is speech.

original: smra ba yod pa 'dra bar grag pa dang / 'di lta bu'i tshul la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin ba'ang rgyen  las gzhan dang gzhan du dmigs pa srid ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: smra ba yod pa 'dra bar grag pa dang / 'di lta bu'i tshul la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin ba'ang rgyen  las gzhan dang gzhan du dmigs pa srid ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In this way, it is possible to observe that what is not the intrinsic identity of something else appears as something else. This is the example-identity of its own type.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ascertainment of the establishment of the collection of those three identities is the fully established identity.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid bzhis yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis sgyu ma la sogs pa nying du shes par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid bzhis yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis sgyu ma la sogs pa nying du shes par grub pa'o //
translated: In this way, the establishment of the knowledge of illusion and so on is accomplished by direct perception that is purified by the four identities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang la gang rigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad ba de dang des ma bsgribs te mthong pas na mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gang la gang rigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad ba de dang des ma bsgribs te mthong pas na mngon sum mo //
translated: Because it is direct perception, since whatever is unobstructed is seen by whatever condition is appropriate for it.

original: rang bzhin rtogs par khong du chud @195a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtogs par khong du chud @195a * //
translated: The nature is realized and comprehended.

original: de ; rkyen gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir mi 'brang bas na tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de ; rkyen gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir mi 'brang bas na tshad ma'o //
translated: It is valid cognition, since it is not followed by a condition that changes it.

original: yang gzhan du na rnal 'byor pas bsgoms te /
analyzed: yang gzhan du na rnal 'byor pas bsgoms te /
translated: Moreover, the yogi/nī meditates and sees white bones, etc. ,

original: rus pa dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba dang / zad par sa la sogs par mthong ba dang / bdag mthe bo tsam du mthong ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs par dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rus pa dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba dang / zad par sa la sogs par mthong ba dang / bdag mthe bo tsam du mthong ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs par dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: sees the totality of earth, etc. , sees the self as the size of a thumb, and so on. Such observation is the definition of direct perception.

original: de'i tshe sngon ma bsgoms pa ni 'di dag med pa las bsgoms pa'i mthus byung ba tsam du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon ma bsgoms pa ni 'di dag med pa las bsgoms pa'i mthus byung ba tsam du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: At that time, one who has not previously meditated realizes and comprehends that these are merely the result of the power of meditation, which is the definition of subsequent inference.

original: sngon sbrul dang sdig sbrul dag gis sdangs pa'i mig sngar thag pa'i dum bu dang / sol ba'i grugs ma 'am gzhan dag las kyang sbrul lam sdig sbrul lta bur mthong zhing sdangs pa 'byung ba yang srid pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngon sbrul dang sdig sbrul dag gis sdangs pa'i mig sngar thag pa'i dum bu dang / sol ba'i grugs ma 'am gzhan dag las kyang sbrul lam sdig sbrul lta bur mthong zhing sdangs pa 'byung ba yang srid pa ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The example of one's own class is this: in the presence of someone frightened by a snake or a scorpion, a piece of rope, a pile of charcoal, or something else, may be seen as a snake or a scorpion and may cause fear.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of complete establishment is the combination of those three characteristics.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las chos thams cad sems tsam zhes bya ba dang sems ni chos thams cad la dbang byed do zhes 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las chos thams cad sems tsam zhes bya ba dang sems ni chos thams cad la dbang byed do zhes 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of scripture is that which is taught by the Omniscient One, the scriptures of the Three Baskets, which state that all phenomena are mind only and that the mind controls all phenomena.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgoms pa las byung bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgoms pa las byung bar grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the direct perception that is purified by the five characteristics is established as arising from meditation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems kyis brtags pa yongs su smin pa nyid mthong ba na mngon sum mo //
analyzed: sems kyis brtags pa yongs su smin pa nyid mthong ba na mngon sum mo //
translated: When one sees the full ripening of the mind's investigation, it is direct perception.

original: dngos po med pa la sems kyis brtags pa tsam du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la sems kyis brtags pa tsam du rtogs par khong du chud pa ni yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The full purification is the understanding that the non-existent is merely investigated by the mind.

original: bka' thang gi mngon sum tshad mar bya ba'i le'u ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: bka' thang gi mngon sum tshad mar bya ba'i le'u ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter on the valid means of knowledge of direct perception in the treatise.

original: // / bka' thang gi rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bya ba /
analyzed: // / bka' thang gi rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bya ba /
translated: The valid means of knowledge of inference in the treatise

original: de la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the valid means of knowledge of inference?

original: bsgribs pa'i yul de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sngon du drangs pa'i steng du mngon sum du myong ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i yul de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sngon du drangs pa'i steng du mngon sum du myong ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin te /
translated: It is the inference that is drawn from the direct perception of the object that is obscured, and it is purified by the five characteristics such as experience and so forth.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rtags la sogs pa gnas pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa la rjes su dpag cing shes par bya @195b ba rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags la sogs pa da la mngon sum du dmigs pa zhig yod na /
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa gnas pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa la rjes su dpag cing shes par bya @195b ba rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags la sogs pa da la mngon sum du dmigs pa zhig yod na /
translated: The definition of inference is that which is to be understood and known through inference, that is, by a mind that engages in the observation of the presence of a reason and so on and does not observe the presence of the thing related to it through direct perception.🔽The definition of direct perception is that which is known through the direct observation of the reason and so on,

original: de yong gis ci la gnas pa sngon bdag gis mngon sum du dmigs te dran na yang rung gzhan gyis mngon sum du dmigs pa'i tshig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las shes par 'gyur ba nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang de dang rigs gcig pa
analyzed: de yong gis ci la gnas pa sngon bdag gis mngon sum du dmigs te dran na yang rung gzhan gyis mngon sum du dmigs pa'i tshig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las shes par 'gyur ba nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang de dang rigs gcig pa
translated: and if there is direct observation of that, it is also suitable to know it through the memory of the direct observation of its presence by oneself in the past or through the knowledge of the direct observation of it by another, which is passed down from one person to another.🔽The definition of an example of the same type is that which is similar to that and is known to the world to be of the same type.

original: gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba yod par 'jig rten la sgrub pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid de gsum mthun pas 'grub tu rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di 'dra ba yod par 'jig rten la sgrub pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid de gsum mthun pas 'grub tu rung ste /
translated: Those three definitions are suitable to be established by agreement.

original: bsgrub pa la gcig tu nges par 'gyur bas na yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs par nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lung las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du 'byung ba lung gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa la gcig tu nges par 'gyur bas na yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs par nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lung las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du 'byung ba lung gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Since it is definitely one in the proof, it has the characteristic of being well known. Since it is definitely taught by the Omniscient One, it has the characteristic of being taught by the Omniscient One. The characteristics of phenomena as they appear in the scriptures are applied to the characteristics of the scriptures.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pas skad cig la sogs pa la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag pas skad cig la sogs pa la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni /
translated: Inference is the valid cognition that ascertains and proves momentariness and so forth through the five characteristics of valid inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las lnga bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las lnga bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: As explained in the chapter on the characteristics of inference, there are five.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis 'jig pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing 'gag pa la de bas kyang myur bar skad cig pa yod par dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis 'jig pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun phyi ma byung zhing 'gag pa la de bas kyang myur bar skad cig pa yod par dpag pa ni chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The arising and ceasing of the subsequent continuum, which is different from the disintegration of conditioned phenomena due to their conditions, is inferred to exist as momentary, even more quickly. This is the characteristic of inferring phenomena and causes.

original: skad cig pa phra mo la mi rtag pa rags pa gnas te /
analyzed: skad cig pa phra mo la mi rtag pa rags pa gnas te /
translated: Coarseness of impermanence abides in subtle momentariness.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid du 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum gyis dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid du 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum gyis dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement the noble ones observe by direct perception that all formations are momentary is the definition of direct perception.

original: nang dang phyi'i 'du byad la sems kyi rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mgyogs pa dang / me lce 'bar ba'am sa gzug po la chu 'bab pa'i rgyun mgyogs pa dmigs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i 'du byad la sems kyi rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mgyogs pa dang / me lce 'bar ba'am sa gzug po la chu 'bab pa'i rgyun mgyogs pa dmigs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement the continuum of mind changes from one moment to the next in relation to internal and external formations, like the rapid observation of the quickness of a fire's flame or the flow of a river on a steep mountain is the definition of example.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement the three characteristics are established by their collection is the definition of ascertainment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa sde snod gsum pa'i lung las /
translated: The scriptures of the three scriptural collections taught by the Omniscient One state:🔽In each moment, the four characteristics of conditioned states such as arising and the four secondary characteristics arise.

original: skad cig pa re re la yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi po skye ba ni skyed par byed /
analyzed: skad cig pa re re la yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi po skye ba ni skyed par byed /
translated: Arising causes generation.

original: gnas pa'i ni 'dug par @196a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'i ni 'dug par @196a * //
translated: Abiding causes endurance.

original: byed rga ba ni rnyings phar  byed /
analyzed: byed rga ba ni rnyings phar  byed /
translated: Aging makes it old.🔽Impermanence makes it perish.

original: mi rtag pa ni 'jig par byed pa la sogs pa gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni 'jig par byed pa la sogs pa gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The extensive proofs are like this.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of a reliable scripture.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar bsgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar bsgrub po //
translated: Thus, by the valid knowledge of inference that has these five characteristics, all compounded phenomena are established as momentary.

original: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod pa las na /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas mngon sum gyis dmigs su yod pa las na /
translated: Since the various sentient beings are observed by direct perception to abide in various actions,

original: 'jig rten gzhan du yang de'i tshul gyis 'gro bar dpag pa ni rgyu dang las dang chos kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du yang de'i tshul gyis 'gro bar dpag pa ni rgyu dang las dang chos kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: it is inferred that in the same way they go to other worlds. This is the definition of inference from cause, action, and phenomena.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams tshe'i 'du byed zad cing 'jig rten pha rol du skye ba 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum gyis dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams tshe'i 'du byed zad cing 'jig rten pha rol du skye ba 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum gyis dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The noble ones directly observe that ordinary beings, when the compositional factors of their lifespan are exhausted, are born in the next world. This is the definition of direct perception.

original: 'phags pa bzang skyong gis dris pa'i mdo las 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro zhes bya ba 'ang gzugs med pa'i phung po rnam par shes par 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa bzang skyong gis dris pa'i mdo las 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro zhes bya ba 'ang gzugs med pa'i phung po rnam par shes par 'gro ste /
translated: says, “One who goes to another world goes to the formless aggregates of consciousness.

original: dper na rlung gi khams gzugs bltar mi snang ba ldang zhing 'gro ba me tog la sogs pa dri zhim po dang rul pa la sogs pa dri nga ba gang dang phrad pa de'i dri khyer te mnam ma par 'gyur ba rlung de'i gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: dper na rlung gi khams gzugs bltar mi snang ba ldang zhing 'gro ba me tog la sogs pa dri zhim po dang rul pa la sogs pa dri nga ba gang dang phrad pa de'i dri khyer te mnam ma par 'gyur ba rlung de'i gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
translated: For example, the invisible form of the element of wind rises and moves, and wherever it contacts a pleasant smell such as a flower or an unpleasant smell such as a corpse, it carries that smell and becomes fragrant or foul smelling.🔽The form of that wind is not observed, and the form of that smell is not observed.

original: dri de'i gzugs kyang mi dmigs mod kyi rlung gi rgyun kyang mi 'chad la dri nga ba dang zhim po so so'i ro las kyang ma gyur par mnam par gyur pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dri de'i gzugs kyang mi dmigs mod kyi rlung gi rgyun kyang mi 'chad la dri nga ba dang zhim po so so'i ro las kyang ma gyur par mnam par gyur pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: However, the continuum of the wind is not interrupted, and it becomes fragrant or foul smelling without changing from its own taste.

original: rnam par shes pa dang las gnyis ka la yang gzugs med mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang las gnyis ka la yang gzugs med mod kyi /
translated: Both consciousness and karma are formless.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa ni de'i 'bras bu mngon pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa ni de'i 'bras bu mngon pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: However, the ripening of karma is like the arising of a result.

original: gzhan du na las gang byas pa'i rgyus 'jig rten pha rol tu gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba ni me long gi nang du gzugs gang bstan pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang / 'jim pa la rgya ci 'dra bas btab pa'i 'bur snang ba dang 'dra bar skye'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na las gang byas pa'i rgyus 'jig rten pha rol tu gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba ni me long gi nang du gzugs gang bstan pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang / 'jim pa la rgya ci 'dra bas btab pa'i 'bur snang ba dang 'dra bar skye'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of an example of one’s own type is: the arising of a form in the next world due to the cause of the karma that was done is like the arising of a reflection of a form in a mirror, or like the appearance of a mold in clay, according to the mold that was used.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of a fully established example is: the establishment of the three characteristics in combination is ascertained as one.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i sde snod gsum pa'i lung las sems can 'chi kar rdul 'byung ba la sogs pa rtags las gnas gar skye ba bshad pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi mngal la @196b sogs par skye ba na 'du shes ci 'dra ba dang bcas te /
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i sde snod gsum pa'i lung las sems can 'chi kar rdul 'byung ba la sogs pa rtags las gnas gar skye ba bshad pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi mngal la @196b sogs par skye ba na 'du shes ci 'dra ba dang bcas te /
translated: The definition of an example of another’s type is: the explanation in the scriptures of the three baskets that were spoken by the Omniscient One, such as the signs of where sentient beings will be born from their death throes, and the consciousness that accompanies the conception in the womb of the next world, and so on.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The extensive statement of the reasonings such as the one above is the definition of a reliable scripture.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'jig rten pha rol yod par bsgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'jig rten pha rol yod par bsgrub po //
translated: Thus, the existence of a world beyond is established by the valid cognition of inference endowed with the five characteristics.

original: bde ba sdug bsngal gyi smin pa myong ba yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la gnas pa 'di'i tshul gyis las kyi smin pa chud mi za bar dpag pa'i chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba sdug bsngal gyi smin pa myong ba yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la gnas pa 'di'i tshul gyis las kyi smin pa chud mi za bar dpag pa'i chos dang rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The experience of the ripening of happiness and suffering in dependence on virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is the definition of the inference of the nonexpiration of the ripening of karma and the inference of the cause and effect of karma.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum du dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon sum du dmigs zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement “the ripening of karma and its effect are directly perceived by the āryas” is the definition of direct perception.

original: dge ba byed ba rnams ni bdag kyang 'tsher dogs med pa la gzhan gyis kyang bya dga' sbyin pa la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa'i bde ba myong /
analyzed: dge ba byed ba rnams ni bdag kyang 'tsher dogs med pa la gzhan gyis kyang bya dga' sbyin pa la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa'i bde ba myong /
translated: Those who engage in virtue experience the happiness of being protected from harm and of being given rewards by others.

original: mi dge ba byed pa rnams ni bdag kyang 'tsher zhing 'jigs la /
analyzed: mi dge ba byed pa rnams ni bdag kyang 'tsher zhing 'jigs la /
translated: Those who do nonvirtue are timid and fearful.

original: gzhan gyis kyang chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa gnod par bya ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba dang / tshong pa tshong spyod pa la brtson pa ni skam rdzas kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul pa zhing rmod pa la brtson pa ni nas 'bras kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa gnod par bya ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba dang / tshong pa tshong spyod pa la brtson pa ni skam rdzas kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul pa zhing rmod pa la brtson pa ni nas 'bras kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: They experience the suffering of being punished by others, such as being executed. Those who strive in trading have abundant goods to sell. Those who strive in farming have abundant barley and rice.🔽Those who strive in tending cattle have abundant sheep and cattle.

original: 'brog pa phyugs 'tsho ba la brtson pa ni she dang phyugs kyi phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs te gang la nan tan gyis brtson pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba la brtson pa'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'brog pa phyugs 'tsho ba la brtson pa ni she dang phyugs kyi phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / 'di lta bu la sogs te gang la nan tan gyis brtson pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba la brtson pa'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Such striving is like the abundant merit of striving in virtue.

original: gang tshong skyong che la gzungs mi rub pa ni brkam rdzas kyis rgud pa dang / gang dog la ngan cing chang dad che ba ni nas 'bras kyis rgud pa dang / gang 'tsho skyong zhan cing phyugs la mig che ba ni rkang 'gros kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang tshong skyong che la gzungs mi rub pa ni brkam rdzas kyis rgud pa dang / gang dog la ngan cing chang dad che ba ni nas 'bras kyis rgud pa dang / gang 'tsho skyong zhan cing phyugs la mig che ba ni rkang 'gros kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those who are poor in cattle and have large eyes for their livestock are poor in livestock.

original: log pa'i sbyor ba de'i yo byad kyis phongs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: log pa'i sbyor ba de'i yo byad kyis phongs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: These are like being poor in the requisites of wrong practice. This is the definition of the example of one's own kind.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of the fully established characteristic is that which is definitely one in the accomplishment by the combination of those three characteristics.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i sde snod gsum pa'i lung las /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i sde snod gsum pa'i lung las /
translated: The definition of scripture is the scriptures of the three baskets taught by the Omniscient One.

original: las gang byas pa las smin pa ci 'dra ba'i 'bras bu myong ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung @197a * //🔽gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: las gang byas pa las smin pa ci 'dra ba'i 'bras bu myong ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung @197a * //🔽gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of scripture is the extensive explanation of the reasons such as the karma that is done and the similar result that is experienced, and so on.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid lngas las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the five characteristics establish that the result of action is not lost.

original: mtshan nyid de rnams nang mi 'gal bar sgrub pa ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de rnams nang mi 'gal bar sgrub pa ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: The establishment of those characteristics without internal contradiction is the valid knowledge of pure inference.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrib pas bsgribs pa la dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pas bsgribs pa la dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Because it is an inference of that which is obscured by obscuration.

original: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure by means of its characteristics.

original: ma nges pa'i skyon med pas na yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i skyon med pas na yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: Because it is free from the fault of uncertainty, it is the valid knowledge of purity.

original: bka' thang gi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /🔽// / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma la /
analyzed: bka' thang gi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar bya ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o / // / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma la /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter on the valid knowledge of inference, following the treatise.🔽The valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture?

original: shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos la mtshan nyid 'di 'dra ba zhig yod do zhes yid ches pa'i lung las 'byung bas sngon du drangs pa'i steng du nye ba'i mngon sum la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin no //🔽de gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos la mtshan nyid 'di 'dra ba zhig yod do zhes yid ches pa'i lung las 'byung bas sngon du drangs pa'i steng du nye ba'i mngon sum la sogs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par byas pa yin no // de gang zhe na /
translated: The characteristics of very obscured phenomena are like this.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni /
translated: The characteristics of the three doors of liberation are as follows.🔽The characteristics of the scriptures that are trusted sources are those that teach emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya yin pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pa dang bcas pa las 'byung ba yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid dang lung las gang bstan pa'i dngos po de yang 'phags pa dag gis mngon du byas te /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya yin pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pa dang bcas pa las 'byung ba yid ches pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid dang lung las gang bstan pa'i dngos po de yang 'phags pa dag gis mngon du byas te /
translated: The characteristics of the scriptures that are direct perceptions are those that teach the things that are realized by the noble ones.

original: mngon sum du dmigs nas so so rang gis rig par lung las 'byung ba'i nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang so so'i skye bo dag gi blos brtag cing dpyad na yang 'thad par bzung du rung ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs nas so so rang gis rig par lung las 'byung ba'i nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang so so'i skye bo dag gi blos brtag cing dpyad na yang 'thad par bzung du rung ste /
translated: The characteristics of the scriptures that are logical are those that are suitable to be held as tenable when investigated and analyzed by the minds of ordinary beings.

original: nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nyan thos kyi theg par khas len pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sder gtogs pa gzhan dang mthun /
analyzed: nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nyan thos kyi theg par khas len pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sder gtogs pa gzhan dang mthun /
translated: The definition of an inference based on what is well known is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.

original: theg pa chen por khas len pa yang theg pa chen po'i sder gtogs pa gzhan dang mthun pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o //🔽shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen por khas len pa yang theg pa chen po'i sder gtogs pa gzhan dang mthun pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid de gsum tshogs pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar ba'o // shin tu bsgribs pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na /
translated: The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i yon tan dang 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs dang 'di lta bu la sogs nas 'bras bu'i bar gyi rnam pa drug po gang yang mngon sum gyis mi dmigs te /🔽shin tu bsgribs pa @197b rnams yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i yon tan dang 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs dang 'di lta bu la sogs nas 'bras bu'i bar gyi rnam pa drug po gang yang mngon sum gyis mi dmigs te /🔽shin tu bsgribs pa @197b rnams yin no //
translated: The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is close is that it is a correct sign that is known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.🔽The definition of an inference based on what is not well known is that it is a correct sign that is not known to both the proponent and the opponent and is a property of the subject.

original: mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i lung gi tshad mas shin tu bsgribs pa'i yul la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni dper bya na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i lung gi tshad mas shin tu bsgribs pa'i yul la gzhal zhing sgrub pa ni dper bya na /
translated: The valid cognition of scriptural testimony, which has five characteristics, is used to evaluate and establish extremely obscure objects.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba ste /
translated: For example, the statement “nirvana is peace”
