original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba mtshan ma kun las 'das pa'o zhes rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ston pa can las 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba mtshan ma kun las 'das pa'o zhes rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ston pa can las 'byung ba ni lung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: is found in the three doors of liberation. This is the characteristic of scriptural testimony.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du gzigs te bstan par lung las 'byung ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du gzigs te bstan par lung las 'byung ba ni nye ba'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement in the scriptures that the omniscient one directly perceives nirvana is the characteristic of direct perception.

original: rigs pa dang sbyar te dpyad na /
analyzed: rigs pa dang sbyar te dpyad na /
translated: When analyzed by applying reasoning,

original: 'phral gyi sdug bsngal ni rgyu spang bas bsal du rung chos thams cad ni rang bzhin med de ji ltar bsgom du yang rung ba las na /
analyzed: 'phral gyi sdug bsngal ni rgyu spang bas bsal du rung chos thams cad ni rang bzhin med de ji ltar bsgom du yang rung ba las na /
translated: the immediate suffering can be eliminated by abandoning its cause. All phenomena are devoid of inherent nature. Since it is suitable to meditate on this,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang mtshan ma thams cad zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhig kyang yod par 'thad pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang mtshan ma thams cad zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhig kyang yod par 'thad pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The logical possibility of nirvana, which is the pacification of all suffering and all signs, is the characteristic of inference based on what is near.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di 'dra bar 'byung ba bzhin du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i sder gtogs pa gzhan las kyang mya ngan las 'das pa sdug
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di 'dra bar 'byung ba bzhin du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i sder gtogs pa gzhan las kyang mya ngan las 'das pa sdug
translated: The characteristic of nirvana as taught in the noble Unraveling the Intent Sūtra is also found in other scriptures belonging to the Great Vehicle, such as the noble scriptural collection of the bodhisattvas.

original: bsngal dang mtshan ma thams cad zhi ba'o zhes 'byung ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsngal dang mtshan ma thams cad zhi ba'o zhes 'byung ba ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement that nirvana is the pacification of all suffering and all signs is the characteristic of the example of its own type.

original: mtshan nyid gsum tshogs na 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum tshogs na 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa ni yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: When the three characteristics are complete, the establishment of nirvana is certain, and that is the characteristic of complete acceptance.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i lung gi tshad mas mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan pa'i lung gi tshad mas mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgrub pa'o //
translated: Thus, through the valid knowledge of scriptural statements that possesses these five characteristics, nirvana is established as having the characteristic of peace.

original: yid ches pa'i tshad ma'i lung gi le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshad ma'i lung gi le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The twelfth chapter, the chapter on the scripture of valid knowledge of confidence.

original: // / yongs su ma dag pa'i gtan tshigs la /
analyzed: // / yongs su ma dag pa'i gtan tshigs la /
translated: The seven characteristics of the reason that is not purified.

original: de la yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven characteristics of the reason that is not purified?

original: de las gzhan dang mthun pa'i bar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mthun pa'i bar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristic of observing what is similar to that, the characteristic of observing what is dissimilar to that, the characteristic of observing everything as similar, the characteristic of observing everything as dissimilar, the characteristic of the example that is similar to the natural type,

original: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lus rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes @198a * //
analyzed: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lus rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes @198a * //
translated: the characteristic of what is well known, and the characteristic of teaching the body that is not purified.

original: gsungs pa de dag gi bye brag bshad do //
analyzed: gsungs pa de dag gi bye brag bshad do //
translated: Those are explained as the distinctions.

original: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Observing what is similar to that is twofold.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga ma yin pa'i tshad ma gzhan dang mthun pa'i dmigs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi yul gyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji lta ba las rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga ma yin pa'i tshad ma gzhan dang mthun pa'i dmigs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi yul gyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji lta ba las rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs te /
translated: The object of a valid cognition that is in accordance with the characteristics of a conditioned object, such as impermanence, is in accordance with the characteristics of an unconditioned object, such as permanence, self, and so on.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is in accordance with the characteristics of an unconditioned object is in accordance with the four misconceptions.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.

original: phyin ci log bzhir lta bas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhir lta bas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.

original: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de las gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽mi mthun par dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de las gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no // mi mthun par dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.🔽The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.

original: tshad ma gzhan dang mi mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan dang mi mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The object of a valid cognition that is not in accordance with another is in accordance with another, as before.

original: mngon sum 'ba' zhig tshad ma byed cing 'phral du bltar mi snang ba'i yul 'jig rten pha rol med par lta ba la sogs pa byed pa po dang / chad pa por lta ba rnams so //🔽thams cad mthun par dmigs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa'i mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum 'ba' zhig tshad ma byed cing 'phral du bltar mi snang ba'i yul 'jig rten pha rol med par lta ba la sogs pa byed pa po dang / chad pa por lta ba rnams so // thams cad mthun par dmigs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa'i mngon sum yin no //
translated: The proponents of the nonexistence of other worlds, etc., are the authors and the proponents of the view of nonexistence, who make their assertions on the basis of direct perception alone, and who do not take into account the things that are not immediately evident.🔽The perception of all as impure is direct perception that is not pure.

original: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //🔽gzhan gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dpe ni /
analyzed: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa ni yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no // gzhan gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dpe ni /
translated: The perception of all as pure is inference that is not pure.

original: log pa'i sbyor bas dpe ston pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i sbyor bas dpe ston pa'o //
translated: The example that is similar to the other is the example that is taught by false application.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i gregs pa ni grub pa'i mtshan nyid log pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i gregs pa ni grub pa'i mtshan nyid log pa'o //
translated: The reason that is not pure is the false definition of the established conclusion.

original: lung rnam par ma dag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas bstan pa'i lung ngo //
analyzed: lung rnam par ma dag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas bstan pa'i lung ngo //
translated: The scripture that is not pure is the scripture that is taught by one who is not omniscient.

original: de la chos thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas /
translated: Among these, all things are perceived by the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i mngon sum yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i mngon sum yin zhe na /
translated: The statement “The definition of perception is that it is consciousness of an object” is the general definition of perception.

original: shes par bya ba nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i sgras ni mngon sum gyi don yin te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i sgras ni mngon sum gyi don yin te /
translated: The term “consciousness” in the statement “it is consciousness of an object” refers to direct perception.

original: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba'i phyir dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa lngas ma drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang phyi rol gyi yul thams cad la mngon sum gyis dmigs pa nyid du 'dzin pa
analyzed: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba'i phyir dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa lngas ma drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang phyi rol gyi yul thams cad la mngon sum gyis dmigs pa nyid du 'dzin pa
translated: Because all phenomena are objects of mental consciousness, mental consciousness that is not induced by the five physical sense consciousnesses is direct perception that apprehends all external objects.

original: dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / lkog na 'dug ba la sogs dran pas bag chags @198b la dmigs pa'i yul yang dngos po nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa lta bu yad kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig mngon sum gyis tshad mar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / lkog na 'dug ba la sogs dran pas bag chags @198b la dmigs pa'i yul yang dngos po nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa lta bu yad kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig mngon sum gyis tshad mar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: are like the direct perception of an object.

original: thams cad mthun par dmigs pas na yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mthun par dmigs pas na yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: It is not pure because it is the direct perception of all that is similar.🔽Moreover, the mental consciousness is by nature always associated with the three conceptions.

original: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du rtog pa gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can la rtog pa phra mo mi gsal bas me gol zhing mi rtog pa'i mngon sum du 'dod pa 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa drug car
analyzed: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du rtog pa gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can la rtog pa phra mo mi gsal bas me gol zhing mi rtog pa'i mngon sum du 'dod pa 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa drug car
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas assert that it is direct perception that is nonconceptual because subtle conception is unclear, like a spark.

original: mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'dzin pas thams cad mthun par dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'dzin pas thams cad mthun par dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: It is not pure because it is the direct perception of all that is similar, since it apprehends characteristics that are similar.

original: mtshan nyid kyis yongs sum dag pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis yongs sum dag pa yin no //
translated: It is not pure because of its characteristics.

original: de'i tshul las drangs te 'di'i nang du gtogs par rtsi ba ni chos thams cad kyang rtags dang rang bzhin la sogs pa drug pos la la ni mthun la la ni mi mthun pa la thams cad mtshungs par dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshul las drangs te 'di'i nang du gtogs par rtsi ba ni chos thams cad kyang rtags dang rang bzhin la sogs pa drug pos la la ni mthun la la ni mi mthun pa la thams cad mtshungs par dmigs pa yin te /
translated: All phenomena are observed to be the same in that some are similar to the six, such as the reason and nature, and some are not.🔽For example, just as it is said that beings have minds, so it is said that trees, grass, and medicine also have minds.

original: dper na 'gro ba rnams la sems yod pa bzhin du shing dang rtsva dang sman la sogs pa la yang sems yod do zhes zer ba dang / sa rdo dang / kha zas dang / chang la sogs pa rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du 'gro ba dag gi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'dus pa las gyur te 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba med do zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba rnams la sems yod pa bzhin du shing dang rtsva dang sman la sogs pa la yang sems yod do zhes zer ba dang / sa rdo dang / kha zas dang / chang la sogs pa rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du 'gro ba dag gi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'dus pa las gyur te 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba med do zhes zer ba'o //
translated: And just as earth, stones, food, beer, and so on arise from the assembly of conditions, so the consciousness of beings arises from the assembly of the four great elements and does not go to another world.

original: dka' thub dang brtul zhugs kyi tshul la gnas so cog kyang thar pa'i lam du mtshungs so zhes zer ba dang / chos gang la sgrib pa yod pa dang sgrib pa med pa thams cad la yang mngon sum 'ba' zhig gis dmigs par 'dod de /
analyzed: dka' thub dang brtul zhugs kyi tshul la gnas so cog kyang thar pa'i lam du mtshungs so zhes zer ba dang / chos gang la sgrib pa yod pa dang sgrib pa med pa thams cad la yang mngon sum 'ba' zhig gis dmigs par 'dod de /
translated: And they assert that all phenomena, whether they are obscured or not, are observed only by direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyis mi dmigs so cog med par lta ba dang / 'di lta bu dag ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mi dmigs so cog med par lta ba dang / 'di lta bu dag ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: They view as nonexistent all that is not observed by direct perception, and they hold that such things are all equally nonexistent.

original: gang yang rtags dang rang bzhin dang las dang chos dang rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i mi mthun pa gang yang rung ba cig gi mi mthun pas phan tshun nges par mi mthun zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang rtags dang rang bzhin dang las dang chos dang rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i mi mthun pa gang yang rung ba cig gi mi mthun pas phan tshun nges par mi mthun zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: And they say that when there is a contradiction in any of the following—reason, nature, effect, property, cause, or result—then they are mutually exclusive. This is the definition of the observation of complete contradiction.

original: de ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this a completely impure inference?

original: rtags la sogs pa drug po gcig gis mi mthun pa de las de'i rnam pa gzhan yang nges par mi mthun no zhes dpog pas na rjes @199a * //🔽su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa drug po gcig gis mi mthun pa de las de'i rnam pa gzhan yang nges par mi mthun no zhes dpog pas na rjes @199a * // su dpag pa yin te /
translated: The six, reason, etc., are not in agreement with one another. Therefore, it is an inference because it is an inference that is not in agreement with one of the aspects, even though it is in agreement with another aspect.

original: rnam pa kha cig gis mi mthun pa yang rnam pa kha cig gis mthun pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mthun par dpog pa ni mtshan nyid kyis yongs su ma dag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kha cig gis mi mthun pa yang rnam pa kha cig gis mthun pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mthun par dpog pa ni mtshan nyid kyis yongs su ma dag ste /
translated: An inference that is not in agreement with any of the aspects is not a correct sign.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a “defective inference.”

original: de la rtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtags gang zhe na /
translated: What is a reason?

original: gang mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa de la gnas par nges pa'i chos bzhin no //
analyzed: gang mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa de la gnas par nges pa'i chos bzhin no //
translated: It is a property of the subject that is ascertained to be present in similar instances and absent in dissimilar instances.

original: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is a nature?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is a specific property.

original: las gang zhe na /
analyzed: las gang zhe na /
translated: What is an effect?

original: des bya ba'o //
analyzed: des bya ba'o //
translated: It is an action.🔽What is a property?

original: chos gang zhe na tshul lo //
analyzed: chos gang zhe na tshul lo //
translated: It is a mode.🔽What is a cause?

original: rgyu gang zhe na de bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na de bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is a generator.🔽What is an effect?

original: 'bras bu gang zhe na des bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhe na des bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: It is that which is generated.

original: de dag gi bye brag dpes bstan pa sa'i rtags ni gang /
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag dpes bstan pa sa'i rtags ni gang /
translated: The differences among these are illustrated by examples. What is the reason for earth?

original: gnas pa brtan par snang ba'o //🔽rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa brtan par snang ba'o // rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
translated: Its function is to support.

original: las ni 'dzin pa'o //🔽chos ni brtseg tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: las ni 'dzin pa'o // chos ni brtseg tu rung ba'o //
translated: Its quality is solidity.

original: rgyu ni sra bar rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sra bar rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the conception of solidity.

original: 'bras bu ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: Its effect is the derivative form.

original: dbyar gyi chu'i rtags ni chu skyar ro //
analyzed: dbyar gyi chu'i rtags ni chu skyar ro //
translated: The sign of water is the water fowl.

original: rang bzhin ni gsher ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gsher ba'o //
translated: Its nature is fluidity.

original: las ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: las ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Its function is to collect.

original: chos ni 'bying ba'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'bying ba'o //
translated: Its quality is wetness.

original: rgyu ni sems can gyi gsher ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sems can gyi gsher ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the conception of the wetness of sentient beings.

original: 'bras bu ni smum pa dang mnyen par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni smum pa dang mnyen par gyur pa'o //
translated: Its effect is the production of pus and so on.

original: me'i rtags ni du ba'o //
analyzed: me'i rtags ni du ba'o //
translated: The sign of fire is smoke.

original: rang bzhin ni dro ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dro ba'o //
translated: Its nature is heat.

original: las ni 'tshed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ni 'tshed par byed pa'o //
translated: Its function is to cook.

original: chos ni 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'bar ba'o //
translated: Its quality is to burn.

original: rgyu ni sems can gyi tsha ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sems can gyi tsha ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the conception of the heat of sentient beings.

original: 'bras bu ni tshos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its effect is the production of ripened states.

original: rlung gi rtags ni rdul dang sgra'o //
analyzed: rlung gi rtags ni rdul dang sgra'o //
translated: The sign of wind is dust and sound.

original: rang bzhin ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Its nature is movement.

original: las ni bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: las ni bskyod pa'o //
translated: Its function is to move.

original: chos ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Its quality is instability.

original: rgyu ni sems can gyi g-yo ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sems can gyi g-yo ba rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The cause is the movement of sentient beings, which is conceptualization.

original: 'bras bu ni g-yos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni g-yos par gyur pa'o //
translated: The result is the movement.

original: sdong po ni shing bya dang / de'i chang ngo //
analyzed: sdong po ni shing bya dang / de'i chang ngo //
translated: The trunk is the tree and its bark.

original: rang bzhin ni bshan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bshan pa'o //
translated: The nature is the woodcutter.

original: las ni ston pa'o //🔽chos ni gzhog tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: las ni ston pa'o // chos ni gzhog tu rung ba'o //
translated: The action is the cutting.🔽The phenomenon is the wood that is suitable to be cut.

original: rgyu ni rang gi sa bon no //
analyzed: rgyu ni rang gi sa bon no //
translated: The cause is the seed.

original: 'bras bu ni rang gi shing tog go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang gi shing tog go //
translated: The result is the fruit.

original: sems can gyi rtags ni smra ba dang g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi rtags ni smra ba dang g-yo ba'o //
translated: The sign of sentient beings is speech and movement.

original: rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa'o //🔽las ni phan pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa'o // las ni phan pa'am /
translated: The nature is consciousness.🔽The action is to benefit,

original: gnod pa'am gnyis ka ma yin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'am gnyis ka ma yin par byed pa'o //
translated: harm, or do neither.

original: chos ni 'tsho ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'tsho ba la brten pa'o //
translated: The phenomenon is the basis of livelihood.

original: rgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: rgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: The cause is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and stable karma.

original: 'bras bu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
translated: The result is happiness, suffering, and neither happiness nor suffering.

original: sems can las bye brag tu bya na so so'i skye bo'i rtags ni rtse @199b ba dang ca co'o //
analyzed: sems can las bye brag tu bya na so so'i skye bo'i rtags ni rtse @199b ba dang ca co'o //
translated: If one distinguishes sentient beings, the sign of ordinary beings is play and chatter.

original: rang bzhin ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The nature of the bodhisattva is the consciousness that is defiled.

original: las ni rang gi rigs kyi don gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: las ni rang gi rigs kyi don gnyer ba'o //
translated: The activity is the pursuit of the meaning of one's own kind.

original: chos ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is being under the sway of the eight worldly concerns.

original: rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The cause is karma and affliction.

original: 'bras bu ni cha'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni cha'o //
translated: The result is the aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags ni lag brkyang zhing sbyin pa dang brtan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags ni lag brkyang zhing sbyin pa dang brtan pa'o //
translated: The sign of the bodhisattva is the open hand, generosity, and stability.

original: rang bzhin ni snying rje dang byams par ldan pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni snying rje dang byams par ldan pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The nature is the wisdom endowed with compassion and love.

original: las ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The activity is benefiting sentient beings.

original: chos ni dul zhing chos kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni dul zhing chos kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is being disciplined and under the sway of the Dharma.

original: rgyu ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos dam pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos dam pa ston pa'o //
translated: The cause is the spiritual friend who teaches the sublime Dharma.

original: 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The result is the Bhagavān Buddha.

original: de la gcig gis mi mthun pas thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gcig gis mi mthun pas thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the observation that all are not in accord because one is not in accord?

original: mi dang byol song gnyis blo la sogs pa'i tshul mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: mi dang byol song gnyis blo la sogs pa'i tshul mi 'dra ste /
translated: Humans and animals have different ways of thinking and so forth.

original: mi la ni 'jig rten pha rol yod kyi byol song la ni 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod na yang rigs mthun mthun du 'khor gyi mi las byol song las mir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin te /
analyzed: mi la ni 'jig rten pha rol yod kyi byol song la ni 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod na yang rigs mthun mthun du 'khor gyi mi las byol song las mir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin te /
translated: Even if they had a world beyond, they would not be born as humans from animals, but only from a human.

original: phyogs gcig mi mthun pas thams cad mi mthun par dmigs su mi rung ba ni dper na dgun gyi tshe nang par lu ma las rlangs pa 'byung ba dang / chu gzhan las 'khyag pa snang ba gnyis rtags mi mthun la rtags can gyi rang bzhin chur mtshungs pa dang skyes pa rang gi tshul du 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs gcig mi mthun pas thams cad mi mthun par dmigs su mi rung ba ni dper na dgun gyi tshe nang par lu ma las rlangs pa 'byung ba dang / chu gzhan las 'khyag pa snang ba gnyis rtags mi mthun la rtags can gyi rang bzhin chur mtshungs pa dang skyes pa rang gi tshul du 'dug pa dang /
translated: It is not logical to observe that all is inconsistent because one part is inconsistent, for example, in winter, steam arises from a spring and ice appears in other water, these two signs are inconsistent, but the nature of the signifier is the same water.

original: skyes pa mo char zhugs pa la sogs pa rtags mi mthun te /
analyzed: skyes pa mo char zhugs pa la sogs pa rtags mi mthun te /
translated: A man sitting in his usual manner and a man who has entered a woman and so on are inconsistent signs.

original: skyes pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa yang yod pas na rtags mi mthun pa zhes phan tshun nges par mi mthun pa'i nang du gzhug tu de ltar mi rung ngo //🔽me gang na 'bar ba'i rtags su du ba 'byung ba dang char gang du 'bab pa'i rtags na bun byung ba gnyis rgyang ma nas 'thul bar 'dra la rtags can gyi rang bzhin me dang chu yin pas mi mtshungs pa dang / skyes pa rang gi tshul du 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa yang yod pas na rtags mi mthun pa zhes phan tshun nges par mi mthun pa'i nang du gzhug tu de ltar mi rung ngo // me gang na 'bar ba'i rtags su du ba 'byung ba dang char gang du 'bab pa'i rtags na bun byung ba gnyis rgyang ma nas 'thul bar 'dra la rtags can gyi rang bzhin me dang chu yin pas mi mtshungs pa dang / skyes pa rang gi tshul du 'dug pa dang /
translated: There are also similar natures of males, so it is not suitable to include those in the dissimilar signs that are mutually ascertained as dissimilar.🔽The two, the smoke that is the sign of fire burning somewhere and the mist that is the sign of rain falling somewhere, are similar in that they are seen from a distance. The natures of the sign bearers are fire and water, so they are dissimilar. The two, a male who remains in his own way and a female who acts like a male, have the natures of sign bearers that are male and female, so they are dissimilar. The ways of the signs are similar.

original: bud med pho char zhugs pa gnyis rtags can gyi rang bzhin skyes pa dang / bud med yin te mi mthun la rtags kyi tshul mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: bud med pho char zhugs pa gnyis rtags can gyi rang bzhin skyes pa dang / bud med yin te mi mthun la rtags kyi tshul mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
translated: There are also similar signs, such as the two, the sign of a male and the sign of a female.

original: mar 'khyag par bya ba na chu grang mo'i nang du gzhug pa dang chu grang mo'i nang du bcug pas kyang bu @200a * //
analyzed: mar 'khyag par bya ba na chu grang mo'i nang du gzhug pa dang chu grang mo'i nang du bcug pas kyang bu @200a * //
translated: When making butter, one puts milk in a cold place and puts it in cold water.

original: ram zhu bar 'gyur ba gnyis ni 'khyag pa dang 'ju ba'i chos mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: ram zhu bar 'gyur ba gnyis ni 'khyag pa dang 'ju ba'i chos mi 'dra ste /
translated: The two, melting and freezing, are dissimilar phenomena.

original: chur gzhug pa'i las 'dra ba dang spyin gyis sbyar ba skam na tsha bas 'dug pa dang rgya skyegs bzhu bar bya na yang tsha bas 'dug pa lta bu la sogs pa tsha ba la 'dug pa'i las 'dra la skam pa dang zhu ba'i chos mi mthun pa🔽la sogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: chur gzhug pa'i las 'dra ba dang spyin gyis sbyar ba skam na tsha bas 'dug pa dang rgya skyegs bzhu bar bya na yang tsha bas 'dug pa lta bu la sogs pa tsha ba la 'dug pa'i las 'dra la skam pa dang zhu ba'i chos mi mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
translated: The two, being hot and being dry, are dissimilar phenomena.🔽The two, crossing a river and building a bridge, are dissimilar phenomena.

original: chu la gru 'dor ba dang zam pa 'dogs pa gnyis kyi chos mi mthun la chu rgal ba'i las byed par mthun pa dang / phyugs la zhon pa dang / shing rtar 'jug pa gnyis kyi chos mi mthun la /🔽lam bgrod par byed pa las mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: chu la gru 'dor ba dang zam pa 'dogs pa gnyis kyi chos mi mthun la chu rgal ba'i las byed par mthun pa dang / phyugs la zhon pa dang / shing rtar 'jug pa gnyis kyi chos mi mthun la / lam bgrod par byed pa las mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
translated: The two, riding an ox and riding a chariot, are dissimilar phenomena.

original: aa ru ra la sogs pa'i sman 'thungs pa dang / bal bu la sogs pa'i sman 'thungs pa gnyis kas nad sos pa ni sman tha dad de /
analyzed: aa ru ra la sogs pa'i sman 'thungs pa dang / bal bu la sogs pa'i sman 'thungs pa gnyis kas nad sos pa ni sman tha dad de /
translated: The two, drinking medicine such as myrobalan and drinking medicine such as barley, are dissimilar phenomena.🔽The two, being cured by medicine and being cured by a spell, are dissimilar phenomena.

original: rgyu mi mthun la bde ba thob pa'i 'bras bu mtshungs pa /🔽'bru dang / sha dang tshod ma la sogs pa'i zas tha dad pa zos pas 'grangs par 'gyur ba zas kyi rnam pa mi mthun la 'grangs par mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod /
