translated: There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.

original: bkres pa las zas sna gcig zos pa dang / 'grangs bzhin pa las zas sna gcig zos pa gnyis gcig ni 'grangs te bde bar gyur pa dang / gcig ni na ste mi bde bar gyur pa gnyis bza' ba'i rgyu mthun la bde ba dang /
analyzed: bkres pa las zas sna gcig zos pa dang / 'grangs bzhin pa las zas sna gcig zos pa gnyis gcig ni 'grangs te bde bar gyur pa dang / gcig ni na ste mi bde bar gyur pa gnyis bza' ba'i rgyu mthun la bde ba dang /
translated: There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.

original: na ba'i bye brag tu gyur pas 'bras bu mi mthun pa dang / ga pur dang tsandan lta bu grang ba'i nad kyis btab pa dang / tsha ba'i nad kyis btab pa gnyis ka la btang ste /🔽tsha ba ni sos grang ba ni na bar gyur la /
analyzed: na ba'i bye brag tu gyur pas 'bras bu mi mthun pa dang / ga pur dang tsandan lta bu grang ba'i nad kyis btab pa dang / tsha ba'i nad kyis btab pa gnyis ka la btang ste / tsha ba ni sos grang ba ni na bar gyur la /
translated: There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.

original: sman gyi rgyu mtshungs te ;
analyzed: sman gyi rgyu mtshungs te ;
translated: There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is not the same but the result of obtaining happiness is the same.🔽There are cases where the cause is

original: sos pa dang na bar gyur pa 'bras bu mi mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod de /🔽de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mthun pa'i cha yang yod /
analyzed: sos pa dang na bar gyur pa 'bras bu mi mthun pa la sogs pa yang yod de / de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mthun pa'i cha yang yod /
translated: There are also cases where the result is dissimilar, such as when one is well or sick.

original: mi mthun pa'i cha yang yod pa la rnam pa thams cad mi mthun par dpag tu de ltar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i cha yang yod pa la rnam pa thams cad mi mthun par dpag tu de ltar mi rung ngo //
translated: In this way, there is a similar aspect and there is a dissimilar aspect, but it is not suitable to infer that all aspects are dissimilar.

original: yang de las gzhan dang mthun pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mi mthun pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir de 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pas na de yongs su ma gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes
analyzed: yang de las gzhan dang mthun pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mi mthun pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir de 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pas na de yongs su ma gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes
translated: Moreover, since the definition of the observation of all that is dissimilar exists in the observation of that which is similar to something other than that, along with an example, it is called the definition of that which is not fully established because it is not ascertained as one in establishing that.

original: gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the definition of that.

original: de las gzhan dang mthun pa dmigs pa @200b zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te tshad ma mtshan nyid lnga pa las gzhan dang mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba las gzhan du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mthun pa dmigs pa @200b zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te tshad ma mtshan nyid lnga pa las gzhan dang mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba las gzhan du dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which is similar to something other than that is observed, as previously explained. It is observed as something other than the definition of the object of a valid knowledge that has the five characteristics.

original: dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa ni mi man sa ka'i mngon sum nir gran ta la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te /
analyzed: dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa ni mi man sa ka'i mngon sum nir gran ta la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te /
translated: The explanation of “with examples” and so on is that the direct perception of the Mīmāṃsakas is similar to the valid knowledge of the Cārvākas.🔽Direct perception is the consciousness of the initial view that arises only from an entity, like the consciousness of a child or a mute.

original: mngon sum ni dang po'i lta ba'i shes pa dngos po 'ba' zhig las skyes pa byis pa dang / lkugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba yang mtshan nyid gzhan mi 'dod pas dus la la zhig tu sdong dum la mir dmigs pa yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni dang po'i lta ba'i shes pa dngos po 'ba' zhig las skyes pa byis pa dang / lkugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba yang mtshan nyid gzhan mi 'dod pas dus la la zhig tu sdong dum la mir dmigs pa yang 'byung ste /
translated: Since they do not assert another definition, at some time, an observation of a stump as a person also occurs.

original: nye ba'i rjes su dpag pas brtags te /
analyzed: nye ba'i rjes su dpag pas brtags te /
translated: It is investigated by subsequent inference.

original: rtogs pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnyen por 'gyur ba rtags la sogs pa mi mthun pa yod pa dang / barti ka'i tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni be'i she shi ka'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dpag par bya ba dang 'brel par grub pa de dang ldan pa la yod pa de med pa'i rtags kyis rjes su dpag go zhes zer ba dang mthun te
analyzed: rtogs pa ni nye ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnyen por 'gyur ba rtags la sogs pa mi mthun pa yod pa dang / barti ka'i tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni be'i she shi ka'i rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dpag par bya ba dang 'brel par grub pa de dang ldan pa la yod pa de med pa'i rtags kyis rjes su dpag go zhes zer ba dang mthun te
translated: Realization is the inference of the antidote, which is the existence of a dissimilar example, and the inference of the three modes of the sign is the definition of the inference of the opponent.🔽The inference of the opponent is established as related to the object of inference. It is an inference by the reason of the nonexistence of that which exists in that which possesses that.🔽This is similar to the statement, “The existence of the dissimilar example is taught by the pervasion, and the so-called inference of the opponent and the inference of the proponent are exhausted in the inference of seeing the sign, such as smoke, in accordance with the valid knowledge of the opponent.”

original: / de la yang khyab par ston pas mi mthun par yod pa dang / sang kya dang barti ka pa la sogs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba yang ne'i ya yi ka'i tshad ma dang mthun pa rtags du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i rjes su dpag tu zad de mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi sbyor bas🔽du ba mthong ba la /
analyzed: / de la yang khyab par ston pas mi mthun par yod pa dang / sang kya dang barti ka pa la sogs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba yang ne'i ya yi ka'i tshad ma dang mthun pa rtags du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i rjes su dpag tu zad de mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi sbyor bas🔽du ba mthong ba la /
translated: In that case, the inference of the opponent is the inference of the proponent.

original: na bun lta bu 'dra ba gzhan dang nor ba yang 'byung ste char gang na 'bab pa na me yod par dpog pa lta bu rang bzhin la sogs pa mi mthun pa yod pa dang / barti ka pa'i mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi man sa ka'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te /
analyzed: na bun lta bu 'dra ba gzhan dang nor ba yang 'byung ste char gang na 'bab pa na me yod par dpog pa lta bu rang bzhin la sogs pa mi mthun pa yod pa dang / barti ka pa'i mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi man sa ka'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te /
translated: The reason of nonobservation by the logician is similar to the valid knowledge of the nonexistence of a thing by the logician.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag la la zhig na bum pa dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i phyir bum pa med par spyod pa'i yul du 'grub ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag la la zhig na bum pa dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las ma dmigs pa'i phyir bum pa med par spyod pa'i yul du 'grub ste /
translated: In a particular place, a vase is established as the object of activity of an awareness that is the nonobservation of what is observable because it is not observed.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan med pa'i yul du grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang bum pa med pa'i thang bu mngon sum du gyur pa las bum pa med pa zhes bya ba yang logs shig na med pas bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gzhan med pa'i yul du grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang bum pa med pa'i thang bu mngon sum du gyur pa las bum pa med pa zhes bya ba yang logs shig na med pas bsgrub pa dang /
translated: Just as the object of activity of an awareness that is the nonobservation of what is observable is established as the object of activity of an awareness that is the nonobservation of what is observable, like the horns of a rabbit, and so on.🔽Also, the nonexistence of a vase is established as the object of activity of an awareness that is the nonobservation of what is observable because it is not observed.

original: sgrub par byed pa gnyis su dbyer med de rang bzhin mi mthun pa yod pa dang / tsar ka'i rigs pa'i tshad ma 'di yod na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gnyis su dbyer med de rang bzhin mi mthun pa yod pa dang / tsar ka'i rigs pa'i tshad ma 'di yod na /
translated: If this valid cognition of the reasoning of Cārvāka exists,

original: 'di yod pa las @201a * //
analyzed: 'di yod pa las @201a * //
translated: from the existence of this,

original: de las byung bar sgrub po zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de las byung bar sgrub po zhes bya ba yang /
translated: it is proven that it arises from that.

original: ne'i ya yi ka'i rjes su dpag ba las snga ma can zhes bya ba dang mthun pa de yang rigs pa dang sbyar zhing nang kyi gzhi ci las gyur pa brtag pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa lus kyi nang na yod pa bltar mi snang
analyzed: ne'i ya yi ka'i rjes su dpag ba las snga ma can zhes bya ba dang mthun pa de yang rigs pa dang sbyar zhing nang kyi gzhi ci las gyur pa brtag pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa lus kyi nang na yod pa bltar mi snang
translated: Also, having the prior is similar to the inference of Nyāya. That is also applied to reasoning, and the investigation of the inner basis from which it arises is that wind, bile, and so on that exist inside the body are not seen.🔽 Since there is no certainty that they arise from those, there is no certainty in the proof.

original: ste / de dag de dag las byung bar nges pa med pas 'grub pa la ma nges pa dang / mi man sa ka'i don gyis go ba'i tshad ma la me tsha bar rig nas sreg nus par yang don gyis shes so zhes bya ba ni yo ga tsa ra ma'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa dang mthun pa de yang mes sreg par byed pa ma
analyzed: ste / de dag de dag las byung bar nges pa med pas 'grub pa la ma nges pa dang / mi man sa ka'i don gyis go ba'i tshad ma la me tsha bar rig nas sreg nus par yang don gyis shes so zhes bya ba ni yo ga tsa ra ma'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa dang mthun pa de yang mes sreg par byed pa ma
translated: The valid cognition of understanding by the meaning of the word fire is having understood that fire is hot, one also understands by the meaning that it is able to burn. That is similar to the inference of the nature of Yoga Cārvāka. That fire burns is not seen.

original: mthong na dro ba tsam gyis tshig par mi nus te /🔽dro ba tsam gyis tshig par mi 'gyur bas sgrub pa la ma nges pa dang / mi man sa ka'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang / tshad ma lda log pa dang de ma yin pas gzhan shes pa dang / bdag shes pa las grol ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te de yang dngos po yod do cog la bsgrub pa'i tshad ma yin pas tshad ma med kyang dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong na dro ba tsam gyis tshig par mi nus te / dro ba tsam gyis tshig par mi 'gyur bas sgrub pa la ma nges pa dang / mi man sa ka'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang / tshad ma lda log pa dang de ma yin pas gzhan shes pa dang / bdag shes pa las grol ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma dang mthun te de yang dngos po yod do cog la bsgrub pa'i tshad ma yin pas tshad ma med kyang dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because it is not burned merely by seeing it.🔽The non-ascertainment of establishment, the valid cognition of the non-existence of the object of negation, the cognition of otherness by the valid cognition of that and non-that, and liberation from self-cognition are similar to the valid cognition of non-apprehension.🔽Since that is the valid cognition of establishment for all existing things, even though there is no valid cognition, it does not become non-existent.

original: med par ma nges pa dang / de ma yin pa gzhan dmigs pa las dngos po med pa sgrub pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyis med par dmigs su zad de /
analyzed: med par ma nges pa dang / de ma yin pa gzhan dmigs pa las dngos po med pa sgrub pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyis med par dmigs su zad de /
translated: The non-ascertainment of non-existence, the establishment of non-existence from the observation of otherness that is not that, and the observation of non-existence by the direct perception of mental consciousness are exhausted.

original: tshad ma gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / bdag shes pa las grol ba zhes bya ba yang tshad ma ni 'jig rten kun gyis kyang gzhal du rung bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / bdag shes pa las grol ba zhes bya ba yang tshad ma ni 'jig rten kun gyis kyang gzhal du rung bar bya dgos na /
translated: Also, the self is liberated from consciousness is not a valid cognition.

original: bdag ces bya ba nyid yod par ma grub pas na gzhal zhing sgrub tu'ang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba nyid yod par ma grub pas na gzhal zhing sgrub tu'ang mi rung ste /
translated: Since the so-called self is not established as existent, it is not suitable to be measured and established.

original: 'grub pa las ma nges pa dang / ne'i ya yi ka'i nye bar 'jol ba'i tshad ma ni mi man sa ka'i tshad ma dang mthun te /🔽ba men sngon ma mthong ba'i mi la /
analyzed: 'grub pa las ma nges pa dang / ne'i ya yi ka'i nye bar 'jol ba'i tshad ma ni mi man sa ka'i tshad ma dang mthun te / ba men sngon ma mthong ba'i mi la /
translated: The valid cognition of the uncertain establishment and the valid cognition of the near defeat of the Naiyāyika are in accord with the valid cognition of the Mīmāṃsaka.

original: ba men ba glang dang 'dra'o zhes bstan na de gnyis 'dra bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: ba men ba glang dang 'dra'o zhes bstan na de gnyis 'dra bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: When a person who has never seen a gayal is taught, The gayal is like a cow, it is said that he knows that the two are similar.

original: ba men la nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: ba men la nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa med de /
translated: However, the gayal does not have a hump, dewlap, and so on.

original: 'dra ba'i dpe yang mi rung la gzhan gyis bstan pa'i tshig las shes par zad pas lung gi tshad mar 'gal te tshad ma'i rang bzhin mi mthun pa yod pa dang 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las skye ba'i rgyun la 'dus ma byas rtag pa dang mthun pa dang bdag yod ba la sogs par dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i dpe yang mi rung la gzhan gyis bstan pa'i tshig las shes par zad pas lung gi tshad mar 'gal te tshad ma'i rang bzhin mi mthun pa yod pa dang 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las skye ba'i rgyun la 'dus ma byas rtag pa dang mthun pa dang bdag yod ba la sogs par dmigs te /
translated: It is also contradictory to the valid knowledge of scripture because it is in contradiction to the nature of valid knowledge.

original: dper na @201b dngos po dag de nyid yin par ngo shes pa las na rtag par mngon te /
analyzed: dper na @201b dngos po dag de nyid yin par ngo shes pa las na rtag par mngon te /
translated: For example, since things are recognized as being reality, they are manifestly permanent.

original: brag dang rdo rje bzhin no zhes zer ba la skye bo'i rgyun la yang 'gyur ba'i rgyun chad pa lta bu mi mthun pa yod pa dang de nyid yod par 'dzin pa yang chu 'bab pa dang / rtsi shing la sogs pa brngas nas slar skyes pa lta bu mi rtag pa la yang de nyid yin par 'dzin pa yod de 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa dang /
analyzed: brag dang rdo rje bzhin no zhes zer ba la skye bo'i rgyun la yang 'gyur ba'i rgyun chad pa lta bu mi mthun pa yod pa dang de nyid yod par 'dzin pa yang chu 'bab pa dang / rtsi shing la sogs pa brngas nas slar skyes pa lta bu mi rtag pa la yang de nyid yin par 'dzin pa yod de 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa dang /
translated: Some say: The self is like a rock or a diamond because there is no continuum of change in the continuum of beings and there is no certainty that the self is established as permanent because there is a continuum of change in the continuum of beings.

original: bdag ni khyab pa yin te yon tan thams cad na snang ba'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la bdag mngon sum ba nang spun te /
analyzed: bdag ni khyab pa yin te yon tan thams cad na snang ba'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la bdag mngon sum ba nang spun te /
translated: Some say: The self is pervasive because it appears in all qualities, like space.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bzhi dang sbyar na la las ni khyab par dmigs /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bzhi dang sbyar na la las ni khyab par dmigs /
translated: If it is applied to the four characteristics of direct perception, some say: The self is perceived as pervasive.🔽Some say: It is perceived as the size of a mustard seed, a thumb or an atom.

original: la las ni yungs 'bru dang / mthe bo dang / rdul phra mo tsam du dmigs pas zhes zer ba nang 'gal bas mngon sum gyis sun byung ba la sogs te /
analyzed: la las ni yungs 'bru dang / mthe bo dang / rdul phra mo tsam du dmigs pas zhes zer ba nang 'gal bas mngon sum gyis sun byung ba la sogs te /
translated: Since these are internally contradictory, they are refuted by direct perception.

original: 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa rnams so //
translated: There is no certainty that the self is established as one.

original: yang de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pas na de ni yongs su ma grogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa la thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir 'grub par bya ba la gcig tu ma nges pas na de ni yongs su ma grogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: “That which is not ascertained as one in the proof of the probandum is called a ‘definition that is not in common.’”

original: yongs su ma gregs pa'i phyir rigs pas brtag pa yang yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma gregs pa'i phyir rigs pas brtag pa yang yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
translated: Because it is not in common, the investigation by reasoning is also not pure.🔽Because it is not pure, it should not be relied upon.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir brtan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir brtan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: The definition of that is stated.

original: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: A non-observation that is not in common with others is as explained above.

original: tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun par dmigs pa dang / yul gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i grangs dang mtshan nyid gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun par dmigs pa dang / yul gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun par dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is an observation that is not in common with any other number or definition of valid knowledge, and it is an observation that is not in common with any other object.

original: de dag dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “Those, together with an example,” and so on.

original: lo ka ya ta pa dag mngon sum gcig pu tshad mar byed cing rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: lo ka ya ta pa dag mngon sum gcig pu tshad mar byed cing rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The Lokāyatas take direct perception alone as valid knowledge and say,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes te /
translated: Consciousness arises from the four great elements.

original: chang la ra ro ba yod par nus pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chang la ra ro ba yod par nus pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the ability to get drunk from beer.

original: 'jig rten ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa tsam zhig yod du zad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa tsam zhig yod du zad de /
translated: The world exists only as the domain of the senses.

original: lus zhig ste rdul du gyur nas gzhan du 'khor ba med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: lus zhig ste rdul du gyur nas gzhan du 'khor ba med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: When the body is destroyed and becomes dust, there is no transmigration to another life.

original: tshad ma dang lta ba gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang lta ba gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun te /
translated: This is not in accord with any other valid knowledge or view.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum gyis brtags na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi ba las @202a * //
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum gyis brtags na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi ba las @202a * //
translated: If it is examined with the direct perception of mental consciousness, consciousness is observed to exist separately from the four great elements.

original: logs shig na yod par yang dmigs la 'jig rten gyi lha dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar dmigs te /
analyzed: logs shig na yod par yang dmigs la 'jig rten gyi lha dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar dmigs te /
translated: Also, worldly gods and yogins observe transmigration to other worlds.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung pa chen po las skyes ba dang / lus zhig nas med par gyur par ma dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung pa chen po las skyes ba dang / lus zhig nas med par gyur par ma dmigs te /
translated: Consciousness is observed to arise from the four great elements, and it is not observed to become nonexistent when the body is destroyed.

original: 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa dang / 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las bram ze rgyu med par smra ba dag 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: 'grub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa dang / 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las bram ze rgyu med par smra ba dag 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: The Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra says:

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yod de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yod de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni /
translated: Brahmins who propound causelessness say, “All phenomena exist essentially and do not arise from causes and conditions.🔽For example, the tips of thorns are sharp by nature.”

original: dper na tsher ma'i rtse mo rang bzhin gyis rno ba la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba la chos thams cad so so'i rkyen du nges pa las 'byung bar snang ste /
analyzed: dper na tsher ma'i rtse mo rang bzhin gyis rno ba la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba la chos thams cad so so'i rkyen du nges pa las 'byung bar snang ste /
translated: All phenomena appear to arise from their own specific conditions.

original: dper na shing sdong po la mda' dang mdung gi rang bzhin med kyang bzo bo'i rkyen gyis mda' dang mdung du byar rung ba lta bu rang bzhin gyis grub pa ma yin par sun phyung ba la sogs par rgya cher gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dper na shing sdong po la mda' dang mdung gi rang bzhin med kyang bzo bo'i rkyen gyis mda' dang mdung du byar rung ba lta bu rang bzhin gyis grub pa ma yin par sun phyung ba la sogs par rgya cher gsungs pa yang /
translated: For example, although a tree trunk does not have the nature of an arrow or a spear, it can be made into an arrow or a spear by the conditions of a carpenter.🔽The extensive refutation of the essential existence of phenomena in such passages is similar to the refutation of the essential existence of the self and that which belongs to the self.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yod par smra ba dang bcas pa ni tshad ma lta ba gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yod par smra ba dang bcas pa ni tshad ma lta ba gzhan gang dang yang mi mthun pas na /
translated: Since the proponents of the existence of all phenomena by way of their natures do not agree with any other philosophical tenet system,

original: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa yin te /
translated: they are observed to be incompatible with others.

original: de yang sdong po la mda' mdung gi rang bzhin med pa las bzo bo'i rkyen gyis byas pa rang bzhin gyis yod par ma dmigs te /
analyzed: de yang sdong po la mda' mdung gi rang bzhin med pa las bzo bo'i rkyen gyis byas pa rang bzhin gyis yod par ma dmigs te /
translated: Moreover, since the nature of an arrow or a spear does not exist in a tree, it is not observed to be produced by the conditions of a craftsman.🔽Since the continuum of the previous entity is seen to cease, it is not established that it does not exist later on, and since the continuum of arising exists, it is not established that it is annihilated.

original: 'grub pa la ma nges pa dang dngos po snga ma 'gags pa'i rgyun mthong nas phyin chad med pa dang / chad par lta ba la yang skye ba'i rgyun rtag pa yod pas chad pa mi 'grub pa dang / par sig g-yon chen mar ma ni /
analyzed: 'grub pa la ma nges pa dang dngos po snga ma 'gags pa'i rgyun mthong nas phyin chad med pa dang / chad par lta ba la yang skye ba'i rgyun rtag pa yod pas chad pa mi 'grub pa dang / par sig g-yon chen mar ma ni /
translated: The great left-handed practitioners of Persia,

original: g-yon mi bzod pas gtsug lag kun dang mi mthun pa gcig bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag kun nas drangs te /
analyzed: g-yon mi bzod pas gtsug lag kun dang mi mthun pa gcig bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag kun nas drangs te /
translated: because they cannot tolerate the left, in order to do something incompatible with all treatises, extract from all treatises

original: byas pa lta bu ched du mi mthun par sbyar na /
analyzed: byas pa lta bu ched du mi mthun par sbyar na /
translated: and apply them in a way that is deliberately incompatible.

original: gtsug lag gzhan gyis grub pa'i mtha' yod par gyur te /
analyzed: gtsug lag gzhan gyis grub pa'i mtha' yod par gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then the philosophical position established by other treatises would be established.

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and it is not established.🔽Thus, the characteristic of a very impure scripture should be understood as naturally impure.

original: de ltar lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ma dag par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ma dag par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: The characteristic of that has been explained.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lung de ston pa'i ye shes rnam par ma dag pas des bstan pa'i lung rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma dag go //
analyzed: lung de ston pa'i ye shes rnam par ma dag pas des bstan pa'i lung rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma dag go //
translated: Because the pristine wisdom that teaches that scripture is impure, the scripture that it teaches is impure. Therefore, it is naturally impure.

original: de'i ye shes rnam par ma dag @202b ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ye shes rnam par ma dag @202b ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the impurity of that pristine wisdom?

original: sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir shes rab yongs su ma dag pas thabs kyis 'ching ba dang / thabs la mi mkhas pas 'chal ba'i shes rab tu 'gyur ba dang / rgya chung zhing mtha' dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir shes rab yongs su ma dag pas thabs kyis 'ching ba dang / thabs la mi mkhas pas 'chal ba'i shes rab tu 'gyur ba dang / rgya chung zhing mtha' dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because obscurations have not been abandoned, wisdom is not pure. Therefore, it is bound by method, and because of being unskilled in method, it becomes faulty wisdom, and it is limited and finite.

original: de'i lung rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de'i lung rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the characteristic of the impurity of that scripture?

original: don dam pa'i bden par yang rang bzhin yod par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par yang rang bzhin yod par ston pa yin te /
translated: It teaches that there is an intrinsic nature in ultimate truth.

original: rang bzhin yod pa las kyang bye brag tu phyin ci log bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams la rtog go zhe 'am /🔽bde'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa las kyang bye brag tu phyin ci log bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams la rtog go zhe 'am / bde'o zhe 'am /
translated: The characteristics of compounded phenomena are imagined to be existent by nature, and also to have the characteristics of the four errors in particular.🔽They are imagined to be happy,

original: gtsang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtsang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or pure.

original: gtsug lag de 'dra bar ston pa'i ye shes rnam par ma dag ste thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par yang lung gi mtshan nyid las shes so //
analyzed: gtsug lag de 'dra bar ston pa'i ye shes rnam par ma dag ste thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par yang lung gi mtshan nyid las shes so //
translated: The wisdom of those who teach such scriptures is impure, and it is known from the characteristics of scripture that they are not omniscient.

original: de'i lung rnam par ma dag pa yin par yang de'i ye shes sgrib pa dang bcas par gyur pa las so //
analyzed: de'i lung rnam par ma dag pa yin par yang de'i ye shes sgrib pa dang bcas par gyur pa las so //
translated: Their scriptures are impure because their wisdom is obscured.

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i lung de dag ni 'phags pa rin po che dpal la skar mkhan gyi gtsug lag sun phyung ba dang / 'phags pa chos dam pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las bram ze dag gi ston pa 'byung ba yon tan dang ba la sogs pa'i phyir brdzun smras na mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa las phyi rol du gyur pa mtha' dag
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i lung de dag ni 'phags pa rin po che dpal la skar mkhan gyi gtsug lag sun phyung ba dang / 'phags pa chos dam pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las bram ze dag gi ston pa 'byung ba yon tan dang ba la sogs pa'i phyir brdzun smras na mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa las phyi rol du gyur pa mtha' dag
translated: Those scriptures that are impure are the scriptures of the non-Buddhists, such as the astrologers' refutation of the noble Ratnamati, and the noble Dharmasarvatasthitika-smrtyupasthana, which say that a brahmin teacher who lies for the sake of a pure quality such as the appearance of the Vedas does not commit a sin.

original: gi lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gi lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, all scriptures outside of Buddhism have the characteristic of being extremely impure.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter, on impurity.

original: // / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: // / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The characteristics of reasoning by nature

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung ste chos nyi dang chos gnas pa'i dbyings 'dug pa de ni /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung ste chos nyi dang chos gnas pa'i dbyings 'dug pa de ni /
translated: Regarding that, whether the Tathagatas have arisen or not, the realm of reality, the nature of phenomena, and the realm of phenomena abide.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa de'i bye brag bshad do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes gsungs pa de'i bye brag bshad do //
translated: That is the reasoning by nature.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs par lta ba gang la chos rnams kyi bden la zhes bya ba chos nyid kyi rigs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs par lta ba gang la chos rnams kyi bden la zhes bya ba chos nyid kyi rigs pa yang yin te /
translated: The reality of phenomena is called the truth of phenomena.

original: rnam pa bcur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcur shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in ten ways.

original: de gang zhe na /🔽'phags pa chos kun bgro ba'i mdo las 'byung ba de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na / 'phags pa chos kun bgro ba'i mdo las 'byung ba de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?🔽The noble Sutra on the Enumeration of the Qualities of the Tathagata states:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa dang / nges par @203a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa dang / nges par @203a * //
translated: What are the ten truths of the bodhisattvas?

original: rtogs pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po'i bden pa dang / nus pa'i bden pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po'i bden pa dang / nus pa'i bden pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: They are the conventional truth, the ultimate truth, the truth of characteristics, the truth of distinctions, the truth of definite discernment, the truth of things, the truth of ability, the truth of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising, the truth of the knowledge of engaging the path, and the truth of the arising of the Tathagata's knowledge.

original: 'di dag ni bden pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bden pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten truths.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni /
translated: Regarding this, the conventional truth is as follows.

original: tshad dang 'brel pa yongs su chad pa kun du tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis ston ba kun rdzob rgya chen po ma yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //🔽de la don dam pa'i bden pa'i zab pa stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa yul yongs sum chad pa gzhan gyis ma yin pa mnyam pa mi mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: tshad dang 'brel pa yongs su chad pa kun du tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis ston ba kun rdzob rgya chen po ma yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o // de la don dam pa'i bden pa'i zab pa stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa yul yongs sum chad pa gzhan gyis ma yin pa mnyam pa mi mnyam pa med pa /
translated: The conventional truth is that which is not the vast conventional, which is taught by the power of other conditions, because it is the complete severance of the connection with measure.🔽The ultimate truth is this suchness of all phenomena, which is profound, endowed with emptiness, not a limited object, not something else, not equal, not unequal,

original: ma 'khrugs pa rtsod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad de bzhin nyid 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrugs pa rtsod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad de bzhin nyid 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: not disturbed, having the characteristic of being free from dispute.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni /
translated: The truth of characteristics is as follows.

original: gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal ba /
translated: The characteristic of harm is suffering.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni kun 'byung ba /
translated: The characteristic of cause is origin.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'gog pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'gog pa /
translated: The characteristic of peace is cessation.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni lam ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni lam ste /
translated: The characteristic of arising is the path.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the truth of characteristics.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, having understood that all phenomena are characterized by selflessness, one enters into flawlessness.

original: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i skyon med pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i skyon med pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Flawlessness that is based on characteristics is called the truth of characteristics.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye mi 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas skyon med ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye mi 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas skyon med ba la 'jug ste /
translated: Similarly, having understood that all phenomena are characterized by natural peace, are characterized by natural isolation, are characterized by natural emptiness, and are characterized by natural non-arising and non-cessation, one enters into flawlessness.

original: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i skyon med pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i skyon med pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Flawlessness that is based on characteristics is called the truth of characteristics.

original: de la rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa las gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa las gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: Regarding this, the truth of classification is the teaching that all phenomena are classified and taught by means of other-dependence, although they are of one characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid gcig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: One characteristic is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa smon pa med par mngon par 'du mi byed pa ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa 'di ni stong pa nyid de'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa smon pa med par mngon par 'du mi byed pa ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa 'di ni stong pa nyid de'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The absence of characteristics and the absence of aspirations of all phenomena, the non-production, non-cessation, and non-performance of activity of all phenomena, and the absence of self in all phenomena—this is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rnam par dbye ba de dag thams cad kyang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba de dag thams cad kyang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: All of these divisions have the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid la slu bar mi byed pa de'i phyir rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa zhes @203b bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid la slu bar mi byed pa de'i phyir rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa zhes @203b bya ste /
translated: Because emptiness does not deceive in this way, it is called the truth of division.

original: 'di ni rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the truth of division.

original: de la nges par rtogs pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nges par rtogs pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the truth of ascertainment?

original: 'phral zhing nges par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phral zhing nges par rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the ascertainment of the truth.

original: nges par sems pa mthong ba khong du chud pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa shes bya la mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: nges par sems pa mthong ba khong du chud pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa shes bya la mi slu ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of ascertainment, seeing, understanding, and realization that is undeceiving with regard to objects of knowledge is called the truth of ascertainment.

original: de phyir nges bar rtogs pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir nges bar rtogs pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the truth of ascertainment.🔽“What is the truth of things?

original: de la dngos po'i bden pa ni dngos po shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i bden pa ni dngos po shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of things.

original: dngos po thams cad phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: All things are the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / stong pa dang dngos po med par shes te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / stong pa dang dngos po med par shes te /
translated: These aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are known as dependent origination, emptiness, and unreality.

original: de ltar na shes nas skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na shes nas skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of the penetration of the faultless state through such knowledge, it is called the truth of things.

original: de la nus pa'i bden pa ni ye shes de dang / spong ba de dang lam des nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang ba khong du chud par nus pa ste /
analyzed: de la nus pa'i bden pa ni ye shes de dang / spong ba de dang lam des nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang ba khong du chud par nus pa ste /
translated: The truth of ability refers to the ability to eliminate the passions through that knowledge, that elimination, and that path; to comprehend the powers, the intrepidities, and the special qualities of the Buddha; and to comprehend the powers of all Tathagatas.

original: de'i phyir nus pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the truth of ability.

original: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'i bden pa ni 'dus byas thams cad zad pa can du ston te /
analyzed: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'i bden pa ni 'dus byas thams cad zad pa can du ston te /
translated: The truth of the knowledge of destruction and non-production refers to the teaching that all conditioned things are subject to destruction.

original: zad pa de yang mi zad la zad pa med do //
analyzed: zad pa de yang mi zad la zad pa med do //
translated: That extinction is not extinguished, and there is no extinction.

original: gal te zad pa la zad pa yod du zin na 'gog pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te zad pa la zad pa yod du zin na 'gog pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
translated: If extinction were to have extinction, then cessation would be extinction.

original: de'i phyir zag pa zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there would be no extinction of defilements.

original: gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de mi skye ste 'di ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de mi skye ste 'di ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not extinguished does not arise. This is the truth of the knowledge of extinction and non-arising.

original: de la lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the knowledge of engaging the path?

original: ye shes la 'jug pa'i lam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa gang gis chos thams cad ma skyes ma 'gags par shes pa des 'jug cing 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes la 'jug pa'i lam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa gang gis chos thams cad ma skyes ma 'gags par shes pa des 'jug cing 'dzud pa ste /
translated: The path of engaging wisdom is the accumulation of merit and wisdom. By that, all phenomena are known to be unborn and unceasing. That is engagement.

original: de'i phyir lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the truth of the knowledge of engaging the path.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the arising of the Tathāgata's wisdom?

original: chos kyi sprin gyis dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin gyis dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: From the Cloud of Dharma up to the Tathāgata ground, it is the truth of the arising of the Tathāgata's wisdom.

original: de bstan pa'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The Path is the means of realizing the Truths.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa bcu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa bcu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are the ten Truths of the Bodhisattvas.

original: @204a * // gzhan du na de las kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: @204a * // gzhan du na de las kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: In other Sutras, the two Truths are also taught in brief:

original: bden pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: “The two Truths should be known:🔽the relative truth of the world and the truth of ultimate sense.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las bden pa gnyis kyi bye brag rnam pa du ma zhig tu rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las bden pa gnyis kyi bye brag rnam pa du ma zhig tu rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The distinction of the two Truths is taught in detail in the Aryasatyadvayanirdesa Sutra.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bya ba la 'dod pa mi mthun pa dag yod do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bya ba la 'dod pa mi mthun pa dag yod do //
translated: There are different opinions about the ultimate truth.

original: chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang dang gang la ji lta ji lta bur dmigs shing don dam pa zhes smra ba la /
analyzed: chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang dang gang la ji lta ji lta bur dmigs shing don dam pa zhes smra ba la /
translated: When the specific characteristics of things are perceived in a certain way, they are said to be ultimate.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i blos gnyen po byang zhing rigs par smra bas sun dbyung du rung na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i blos gnyen po byang zhing rigs par smra bas sun dbyung du rung na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: But if they can be refuted by the rational mind of the wise, they are not ultimate.

original: de lta bas na don zab pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i byang chub sems dpas bshad pa'i le'u las 'byung pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ston pas btags pa'i tshig 'di ni kun du rtog pa las byung ba yin te tha snyad du
analyzed: de lta bas na don zab pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i byang chub sems dpas bshad pa'i le'u las 'byung pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ston pas btags pa'i tshig 'di ni kun du rtog pa las byung ba yin te tha snyad du
translated: Therefore, the words “conditioned” and “unconditioned,” which are imputed by the Teacher in the chapter of the Bodhisattva Explanation of the Profound Meaning, arise from imagination and are merely conventional🔽expressions.

original: brjod pa'o // de ni kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa shin du yongs su grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: brjod pa'o // de ni kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa shin du yongs su grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: Since they are thoroughly established as conventional expressions of various imaginations, they are not conditioned.

original: ji snyed du gnyis par brjod do cog ni kun du rtog pa las byung ba dang tha snyad kyis brjod pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: ji snyed du gnyis par brjod do cog ni kun du rtog pa las byung ba dang tha snyad kyis brjod pa tsam du zad de /
translated: As extensively taught, all dualistic expressions arise from imagination and are merely conventional expressions.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa ma yin pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa ma yin pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Since they are not established by their own characteristics, they are nondual.

original: chos gang la skye bar 'dod do cog kyang skye ba nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: chos gang la skye bar 'dod do cog kyang skye ba nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Whatever is asserted to be produced is not established as production.

original: 'phags pa ma dros pa klu'i rgyal pos dris pa'i mdo las 'byung ba chos thams cad med pa dang yod pa las bral zhing rkyen gyi kha na las par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma dros pa klu'i rgyal pos dris pa'i mdo las 'byung ba chos thams cad med pa dang yod pa las bral zhing rkyen gyi kha na las par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: All phenomena are seen to be free from existence and nonexistence and to arise from conditions.

original: chos de dag gang yang rgyu med pa las skye bar mthong nas gang rgyu'i kha nas las pa de ni rkyen gyi kha na las pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gang yang rgyu med pa las skye bar mthong nas gang rgyu'i kha nas las pa de ni rkyen gyi kha na las pa'o //
translated: When one sees that those phenomena do not arise without causes, one sees that they arise from conditions.

original: gang rkyen gyi kha na las pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rkyen gyi kha na las pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That which arises from conditions does not arise.🔽That which does not arise is empty.

original: gang ma skyes pa de ni stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de ni stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: skye'o cog rkyen gyis mi skye ba med la de'i rkyen rnams kyang rkyen la sdong pas na rang la skye ba'i mthu med par mngon no //
analyzed: skye'o cog rkyen gyis mi skye ba med la de'i rkyen rnams kyang rkyen la sdong pas na rang la skye ba'i mthu med par mngon no //
translated: There is no arising that does not arise from conditions, and since those conditions arise from conditions, they manifestly lack the power to arise from themselves.

original: gang skye bar snang ba de nyid mi skye ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni skyes pa'i rang bzhin med pas rkyen du mas bstangs kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na skye bar yang @204b snang ngo //
analyzed: gang skye bar snang ba de nyid mi skye ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni skyes pa'i rang bzhin med pas rkyen du mas bstangs kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na skye bar yang @204b snang ngo //
translated: If what appears to arise has the nature of non-arising, it would not arise even though it is supported by many conditions, because it lacks the nature of arising.🔽But it appears to arise.

original: de nyid las skye ba'i rang bzhin yod na ni rkyen dang ma phrad par yang skye ba'i rigs na rkyen la sdod par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid las skye ba'i rang bzhin yod na ni rkyen dang ma phrad par yang skye ba'i rigs na rkyen la sdod par yang snang ngo //
translated: If it has the nature of arising, it would arise even without encountering conditions, but it appears to depend on conditions.

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin yang yod la rkyen dang yang phrad de gnyis ka ldan pa las skye zhes bya bar yang de dag so sor skye bar ma grub na 'dus byas kyang skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin yang yod la rkyen dang yang phrad de gnyis ka ldan pa las skye zhes bya bar yang de dag so sor skye bar ma grub na 'dus byas kyang skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it arises from the combination of both, since it is not established that either one individually gives rise to it, it is not tenable that arising occurs from the combination of both.

original: gang skye ba dang rkyen rnams la snga nas yod na ni gzod bskyed kyang mi dgos te rkyen gyis byas pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang skye ba dang rkyen rnams la snga nas yod na ni gzod bskyed kyang mi dgos te rkyen gyis byas pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If arising existed prior to the conditions, it would not be necessary to generate it again, and the activity of the conditions would be pointless.

original: rkyen rnams la med na ni gzhan zhig gud nas 'ongs par gzhug dgos pas rkyen gyis bskyed par yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams la med na ni gzhan zhig gud nas 'ongs par gzhug dgos pas rkyen gyis bskyed par yang ma grub ste /
translated: If it does not exist among the conditions, it must be introduced as something that comes from somewhere else. Therefore, it is not established that it is produced by conditions.

original: 'phags pa n'a gardzu nas chos kyi snying po dge bar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa n'a gardzu nas chos kyi snying po dge bar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just as the noble Nāgārjuna has explained in the Essence of True Eloquence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab las kun rdzob kyi bden ba bstan pa yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i gsung rab las kun rdzob kyi bden ba bstan pa yang rung /
translated: The Tathāgata has taught the conventional truth in the scriptures that have twelve branches.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bstan pa yang rung /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bstan pa yang rung /
translated: He has also taught it in the mundane conventions.

original: bkri ba'i don du gsungs pa yang rung /
analyzed: bkri ba'i don du gsungs pa yang rung /
translated: He has also taught it as interpretable in meaning.

original: chos kyi sgo rnam pa mang bos bstan to cog kyang don dam pa'i bden pa la gzhug pa'i sgo yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo rnam pa mang bos bstan to cog kyang don dam pa'i bden pa la gzhug pa'i sgo yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: All the teachings that he has given in many different Dharma doors should be understood as doors that lead to the ultimate truth.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Sūtra Requested by the King of the Dhāraṇīs,

original: don tha dad pa'i gtam gyi phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung gi chos kyi dbyings ro gcig cing sgrib pa med pa sems can thams cad kyi go skabs dang ldan pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽sems can rnams de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i gtam gyi phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung gi chos kyi dbyings ro gcig cing sgrib pa med pa sems can thams cad kyi go skabs dang ldan pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / sems can rnams de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning is different, the Buddha does not appear. Having fully awakened to the unobstructed, single-flavored dharmadhatu, which is the opportunity for all sentient beings,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor te /
translated: he turns the wheel of Dharma in order to help sentient beings understand it.🔽This is called the wheel of irreversibility.

original: 'di lta ste phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i zhes gsungs pas don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag lta bu yin par ni de ltar shes te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i zhes gsungs pas don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag lta bu yin par ni de ltar shes te /
translated: Thus, one should understand that all phenomena are characterized in this way by means of the ultimate truth, the conventional truth, and so forth.

original: des na de'i phyir chos nyid kyi rigs ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir chos nyid kyi rigs ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the reasoning of dharmata.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs ba'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs ba'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter on the reasoning of dharmata.

original: // / tshad ma'i yon tan bkod pa bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i yon tan ni 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol gnyis ka'i don du 'gyur ba du ma zhig yod pa las mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: // / tshad ma'i yon tan bkod pa bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i yon tan ni 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol gnyis ka'i don du 'gyur ba du ma zhig yod pa las mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The qualities of valid cognition are set forth in the authentic scriptures. The qualities of valid cognition are of many kinds, in that they are related to the aims of this life and the next. In brief, however, they are of three kinds:

original: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa yin /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa yin /
translated: The qualities of complete purity are perfected.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa @205a * //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa @205a * //
translated: One is untainted by the faults of impurity.

original: yin ; phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan ba yin no //
analyzed: yin ; phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan ba yin no //
translated: One possesses the excellence of benefit.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the qualities of complete purity that are perfected?

original: rnam pa lngar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar shes par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood in five ways:

original: tshad ma yongs su dag pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa dang / gzhal bya phun sum tshogs pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos chub pa dang / sgrub pa yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: tshad ma yongs su dag pas 'grub pa la gcig tu nges pa dang / gzhal bya phun sum tshogs pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos chub pa dang / sgrub pa yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: One is certain to accomplish the goal by means of completely pure valid cognition. One is skilled in the mundane and supramundane teachings by means of the perfect objects of valid cognition. One has perfected the branches of practice. One has pure view.

original: tshad ma'i bye brag rab tu shes par 'gyur ba dang lnga'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i bye brag rab tu shes par 'gyur ba dang lnga'o //
translated: and the specific categories of valid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gsum po re re la yang mtshan nyid lnga lnga dang sbyar ba gcig gis gcig sbyangs te /
analyzed: de la tshad ma yongs su dag pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gsum po re re la yang mtshan nyid lnga lnga dang sbyar ba gcig gis gcig sbyangs te /
translated: With regard to that, the three valid cognitions of direct perception and so forth, which are the pure valid cognitions, are each applied with five characteristics, and one refines the other.

original: gtan la phab pas na 'grub pa la gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽gzhal bya phun sum tshogs pa ni du ba las me yod par dpag pa lta bu phugs rdzi yan chad kyis shes pa las gzhal ba ma yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol lo sogs te mi las bla mar gyur pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: gtan la phab pas na 'grub pa la gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba yin no // gzhal bya phun sum tshogs pa ni du ba las me yod par dpag pa lta bu phugs rdzi yan chad kyis shes pa las gzhal ba ma yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol lo sogs te mi las bla mar gyur pa'i chos dang /
translated: Since they are ascertained, they become definitely one in accomplishment.🔽The perfect object of comprehension is not comprehended by any knowledge other than the omniscient one, such as inferring the existence of fire from smoke, and the world beyond, and so forth. Since it is also said to be the Dharma that is superior to humans,

original: mi'i chos kyang smos pas na gzhal bya'i yul chub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi'i chos kyang smos pas na gzhal bya'i yul chub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that the object of comprehension is fully understood.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'bras bu yod par dam bca' ba dang / gtan la dbab pa'i yan lag bdun gyi tshul gyis bcas nas snod dang sbyar te smra ba'i rgyan las 'byung ba dang ldan par ston pas na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'bras bu yod par dam bca' ba dang / gtan la dbab pa'i yan lag bdun gyi tshul gyis bcas nas snod dang sbyar te smra ba'i rgyan las 'byung ba dang ldan par ston pas na /
translated: The branch of accomplishment is the vow to have the result, and the branch of ascertaining is the seven ways of ascertaining.

original: tshig dang don du bcas pa'i rnam pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: tshig dang don du bcas pa'i rnam pa dang ldan no //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with the aspects of words and meanings.

original: lta ba rnam par dag pa ni chos rnams la tshad ma yongs su dag pas gzhal te /
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag pa ni chos rnams la tshad ma yongs su dag pas gzhal te /
translated: The pure view is the evaluation of phenomena by means of pure valid knowledge.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas na bdag nyid kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas na bdag nyid kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the realization of the way things really are, one is established in the correct view and also establishes others in the correct view.

original: tshad ma'i bye brag shes pas na 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshad ma thams cad kyang /
analyzed: tshad ma'i bye brag shes pas na 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshad ma thams cad kyang /
translated: Since one knows the different types of valid knowledge, one also knows all the mundane and supramundane valid knowledges.

original: bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma bshad pa'i nang du 'dus te tshad ma yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i bye brag khong du chud par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma bshad pa'i nang du 'dus te tshad ma yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i bye brag khong du chud par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the authentic scriptures is included in this, and one will understand the distinction between the completely pure and the impure valid cognitions.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that is not tainted by the faults of impurity?

original: rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in three ways:

original: 'gal ba med pa yin /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa yin /
translated: It is free from contradiction.

original: ma nges pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ma nges pa med pa yin /
translated: It is free from uncertainty.

original: so so'i skye bo'i nor ba med pa @205b yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i nor ba med pa @205b yin no //
translated: It is free from the errors of ordinary beings.

original: de la 'gal ba med pa ni chos gang la yang rtags dang 'bras bu'i bar gyi rnam pa drug po dmigs kyis phye bas na 'gal ba med pa rnam pa gnyis te mthun bar dmigs pa la mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med pa yin /
analyzed: de la 'gal ba med pa ni chos gang la yang rtags dang 'bras bu'i bar gyi rnam pa drug po dmigs kyis phye bas na 'gal ba med pa rnam pa gnyis te mthun bar dmigs pa la mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med pa yin /
translated: Therein, freedom from contradiction is twofold: freedom from contradiction by the specific division of the six aspects from reason to effect in any phenomenon, and freedom from contradiction by the general division of the six aspects.

original: mi mthun par dmigs pa la mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun par dmigs pa la mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Freedom from contradiction by the specific division is twofold: freedom from contradiction by the characteristic of incompatibility in the observation of the compatible, and freedom from contradiction by the characteristic of compatibility in the observation of the incompatible.

original: de la ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, uncertainty is also twofold:

original: yul gyi bye brag mi rtogs shing lung du mi ston pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yin /
analyzed: yul gyi bye brag mi rtogs shing lung du mi ston pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yin /
translated: It is not a characteristic that does not understand the distinctions of objects and does not teach them.

original: srid pa tsam zhes the tshom skye bar sgrub pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa tsam zhes the tshom skye bar sgrub pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is not a proof that gives rise to doubt, saying, “It may or may not be so.”

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i nor ba med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i nor ba med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among those, the absence of error of ordinary beings is also twofold.

original: bdag gi rtog pa 'dir ris su bris pa med pa yin /
analyzed: bdag gi rtog pa 'dir ris su bris pa med pa yin /
translated: It is not a drawing of one’s own concepts.

original: gzhan gyi dring la 'jog cing zag pa la brten pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la 'jog cing zag pa la brten pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is not a dependence on the authority of others and a reliance on the contaminated.

original: phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the possession of the good qualities of benefit?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa bzhin du bris te chos la brten pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis du brlabs shing bsgrubs pa la mthu chen po yin /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa bzhin du bris te chos la brten pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis du brlabs shing bsgrubs pa la mthu chen po yin /
translated: Since it is written according to the speech of the Omniscient One and is based on the Dharma, it is a great power in the blessing and accomplishment of the Tathāgata.

original: dpal gyi zhal nas gsungs pa nang gcig gis gcig bkrol te /
analyzed: dpal gyi zhal nas gsungs pa nang gcig gis gcig bkrol te /
translated: The speech of Śrī is one that is unraveled by one’s own mind.

original: lhad ma zhugs pa'i gsung rab nyid yin pas gang gis bklags pa dang thos pa dang / bsams pa tsam gyis kyang sdig pa 'byang zhing bsod nams 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: lhad ma zhugs pa'i gsung rab nyid yin pas gang gis bklags pa dang thos pa dang / bsams pa tsam gyis kyang sdig pa 'byang zhing bsod nams 'phel ba yin no //
translated: Since it is the scriptures themselves that are unadulterated, even just reading, hearing, or contemplating them purifies evil and increases merit.

original: de ltar bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma 'di yon tan gsum dang ldan pas tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma 'di yon tan gsum dang ldan pas tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Since this authentic scripture has three good qualities, it is the cause of the two accumulations.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs shing yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon med pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs shing yongs su ma dag pa'i skyon med pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is complete with the characteristics of purity and free from the faults of impurity, it is the cause of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan yon gyi legs pa dang ldan pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it possesses the good qualities of benefit, it is the cause of the accumulation of merit.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi don du bya ba yang de gnyis su 'dus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi don du bya ba yang de gnyis su 'dus so //
translated: The activities for the benefit of this world and the next world are included in those two.

original: de ltar tshogs gnyis yongs su 'gengs pa'i yon tan brjod pas na tshad ma'i yon tan bkod par brtags so //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs gnyis yongs su 'gengs pa'i yon tan brjod pas na tshad ma'i yon tan bkod par brtags so //
translated: Since it is described as filling the two accumulations, it is considered to be the array of the good qualities of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i yon tan bkod pa'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: tshad ma'i yon tan bkod pa'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter, called the Critique of Valid Cognition.
